info.Description: Jackets, mantles, woven robes, and padded vests don’t, by themselves, provide any significant protection. However, you can imbue them with protective magic. Cloth armor doesn’t slow you down or hinder your movement at all. All characters have proficiency with cloth armor.        Magic appears at higher item levels, and grants higher armor bonuses than its mundane counterparts. Cloth armor grants +1 AC at levels 16-25, and +2 AC at levels 26-30.
Starweave armor is fashioned after patterns created in the divine Dominions of the Astral Sea.

name: Book of Infinite Spells
description: Opening this thick spellbook, bound in strange leather, causes its pages to flip in rapid succession.

info.enhancement_bonus:: +3 to attack rolls and damage rolls

special:: A character can draw a particular wizard power from the book only once, regardless of which property the character uses.

name: Curse of the Oba
description: Lalali-Puy has taught you how to use the primal spirits to drain the vitality of an enemy

name: Curseforged Armor
description: In ancient days, the tieflings poured their bitterness into their forges as a lesson to those who would betray them.

name: Cyclops Helm
description: The gemlike eye that stares from the brow of this finely wrought mithral helm reveals what is hidden.

name: Cynic's Goggles
description: With these bronze and leather eye pieces, you more easily see through illusions.

name: Dancer's Slippers
description: Your feet glide across the ground, letting you reposition yourself when an enemy's attack goes wide.
augment_1:: You regain the use of this power but cannot augment it again during this encounter.

name: Dancing Weapon
description: This blade floats beside you, cutting through the air as a dancer glides across a ballroom.

name: Dantrag's Bracers
description: These wide bracers are lined with gleaming mithral rings.

name: Dark Clover
description: These clovers are identical in shape to the garden variety, but their connection to the Shadowfell aids necrotic powers.

name: Dark Reaver Powder
description: This black powder can render a creature comatose if consumed.

name: Codex of Infinite Planes
description: Sandwiched between the heavy covers of this outsized volume are uncountable pages of metal with a dizzying array of images of symbols inscribed upon them.

name: Darkfire Gloves
description: These leather gloves are imbued with the darkfire power of the drow.

name: Darkforged Armor
description: This armor not only absorbs physical force, but becomes even more durable with prolonged battering.

name: Darkleaf Armor
description: Darkleaves from the gravetrees of the Shadowfell give this armor its protective properties.

name: Darkleaf Shield
description: Shadowfell gravetrees provide the tightly woven branches and black leaves that form this shield.

name: Darkskull
description: Darkness swells around this menacing onyx skull.

name: Darkspiral Rod
description: The darkspiral aura that exemplifies your devotion to the dark pact coalesces into a black cloud around this implement.
critical:: +1d6 necrotic and psychic damage per plus

name: Darkstrike Armor
description: Shadowy runes shift across the surface of this black armor, protecting you when you single out a foe with your attacks.

name: Dauntless Champion's Ring
description: Supernal, Iokharic, and Barazhad characters entwine about this thick mithral band, rearranging themselves when the ring's magic is activated.

name: Davros Elden's Aerial Step
description: When Garras returned a fourth time to the master's hut, he learned that Davros Elden had more skill than he let on.

name: Davros Elden's Blinding Strikes
description: On Garras's third visit, he learned the technique of making two hasty strikes in blinding succession.

name: Hammer of Thunderbolts
description: This mighty weapon seems made of mithral and adamantine swirled together, and lightninglike lines of platinum crawl over its surface. When you heft it, all your hair stands on end as if you sense the coming of a great storm.

info.enhancement_bonus:: +5 to attack rolls and damage rolls
info.critical:: +5d10 thunder damage, or +10d10 if the target is a giant.

name: Davros Elden's Defensive Step
description: The fencing master's first lesson adjusted Garras's position in a duel, maximizing defense.

name: Davros Elden's Hasty Resurgence
description: When Garras returned for a second lesson, he learned to steady himself when an enemy wore him down.

name: Dawn Warrior Armor
description: This finely wrought armor glows with an inner radiance that flares even more brilliantly in the presence of elementals.

name: Dawn Warrior Weapon
description: This finely wrought weapon glows with an inner radiance that flares even more brilliantly in the presence of elementals.

name: Dazzling Plate
description: Favored by paladins of Pelor, this shining suit of polished mithral plate strengthens your spirit and dazzles your foes.

name: Dazzling Showcase
description: A finely crafted cabinet of polished rare wood with crystal shelves, this fixture displays your collection and awes those who come before you.

name: Dazzling Weapon
description: This weapon seems to sparkle with radiant light barely contained within it.

name: Deadblast Bone
description: This rune-scarred bone has the power to temporarily stun undead.

name: Deadstone Weapon
description: This weapon is carved from stone tainted by the passing of the Dragon of Tyr, imbued with defiling magic that drinks the life of your enemies.
weapon:: Axe, hammer, heavy blade or  mace

name: Death Fang Totem
description: A wounded or vulnerable foe grants you advantage while you wield this totem of bone, teeth, and sinew.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, plus 1d6 extra damage against a target that is granting combat advantage to you.

name: Jacinth of Inestimable Beauty
description: A fiery orange-red gemstone cut in the shape of an exotic flower, this dazzling jewel is set in a graceful necklace of purest gold.

name: Death Mark Weapon
description: This weapon knows when you kill a hated foe, letting you shift away to face a new enemy.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d12 damage per plus against an enemy marked by you

name: Death Rattle
description: Bone shards clatter within this black-beaded rattle, making your necrotic attacks more potent.

name: Death Shroud Ki Focus
description: These winding sheets for the dead appear to be woven with veins of blood. As you study their shining trails, you focus on your ability to ready foes for the grave.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, plus 1d6 damage for each of your shrouds on the target or each shroud you invoked on the target of this attack roll.

name: Death Song Ring
description: The soft songs chanted by this ring in times of need are of those buried alive, hummed with fading breath to hold off the final night.

name: Death Spiral Ring
description: This ring's dizzying black spirals seem to bend space and time.

name: Death Strike Ki Focus
description: This small wooden box contains gray soil. As you work the soil into your hands, you focus your ki on matters of the grave.

name: Death Weapon
description: Dark sigils writhe all along the surface of this sinister weapon.

name: Death's Brink Armor
description: This black metal armor has the image of an outthrust hand emblazoned on its breast.

name: Death-Defying Cloak
description: This voluminous mantle lets you cheat death.

name: Deathburst Armor
description: Blood and shadow color this armor darkest crimson, and it channels the energy of death.

name: The ShadowstaffServant of the Staff
description: This staff appears to be made from twisted strands of smoky black glass, but it’s harder than steel.
hp: 1; a missed attack never damages a minion.
defenses: your defenses, not including any temporary bonuses or penalties

name: Deathcap Spores
description: When it bursts, this vessel vents a cloud of yellow powder.

name: Deathcut Armor
description: Crafted from the hides of creatures slain by necromantic magic, this armor radiates unease and offers protection against similar magic.

name: Deathspawn Potion
description: Dark gray and odorless, this liquid wards off diseases and poisons.

name: Deathstalker Weapon
description: This weapon leaves a wound that is black and withered, which continues to plague an enemy long after the attack was made.

name: Deathsteel Armor
description: Crafted from death ore drawn from the Gol Mountains in the Shadowfell, this armor protects the wearer from the necromantic energy that suffuses that plane.

name: Deathsteel Weapon
description: This weapon was forged from death ore mined from the Gol Mountains in the Shadowfell. It allows the wielder to cut through an enemy's necromantic resistances.

name: Deathward Shield
description: This ebony shield with adamantine studs protects you from dark energies.

name: Deceptive Scrying Basin
description: This etched silver basin makes it more difficult for creatures you observe to detect your prying gaze.

name: Decerebrate Weapon
description: This weapon shatters the mind and batters the senses.

name: Deck of Spells
description: All your spells are written on these cards, whose illustrations depict you crushing foes with your potent arcane arsenal.

name: Shield of Prator
description: Creased and dented, this large steel shield is emblazoned with the symbol of Pelor. Despite its appearance, it weighs lightly on the arm and almost seems to anticipate the next strike.

name: Deep Impact Weapon
description: Your attack drives your foe into the ground with the force of a falling star.

name: Deep Wounding Weapon
description: This weapon has a thin, serrated blade that punches deeply into an enemy and leaves behind a nasty wound.

name: Deep-Pocket Cloak
description: The hundreds of magically hidden pockets on this cloak allow you to keep a wealth of items close at hand.

name: Deepfarer's Pouch
description: This oilskin pouch holds more than it should, including a small breathing tube that extends from the inside.

name: Defender's Armor
description: This armor glows with silver energy.

name: Defensive Armor
description: This durable armor responds to your thoughts and reinforces itself to protect you.
augment_1:: The bonus increases to +5.

name: Defensive Staff
description: This staff increases your resistance to all types of attacks.

name: Defensive Weapon
description: This weapon glows blue when its wielder takes a defensive posture.

name: Defiant Boots
description: These sturdy iron boots grip the ground when you are moved against your will.

name: Deflection Armor
description: This armor is more resilient than it appears at first glance, and many enemies have been surprised to find their attacks suddenly deflected toward an ally.

name: Zax, Cloak of Kings
description: This brilliant cloak of spun gold is bedecked with gems and delicately embroidered with scenes of great beauty.

name: Delbanian Vambraces
description: These ice-white bracers let you pass unseen, but their power freezes you to the marrow if left unchecked.

name: Delver's Armor
description: A popular armor among adventurers, now as in ancient times.

name: Delver's Light
description: Often attached to the forehead or chest, this magic gem gives off light powered by your life force.
requirement:: You must have the living construct racial trait to use this item.

name: Demise's Staff of Ruin
description: Fashioned from blackened elven bone, this staff is an implement of devastation.

name: Demon Amulet
description: This simple amulet consists of a cord wrapped around a chunk of bone or horn from a demon.

name: Demonbane Weapon
description: This weapon glimmers with white flecks of energy from the Astral Sea that are anathema to demons.
critical:: +1d8 damage per plus, +1d10 damage per plus against demons.

name: Demonbound
description: The demon is bound to you as you are bound to it. And as you grow in power, so too does the demon.

name: Demonscale
description: Piecemeal skins, scales, and exoskeletons of demons form a frightful but sturdy suit of scale armor.

name: Demonskin Tattoo
description: Not all societies understand that tattooing a portion of demonskin onto your body isn't an evil act.

name: Demonslayer Weapon
description: Inscribed with holy prayers and runes, this powerful weapon is the bane of all demonkind.
critical:: +1d8 damage per plus, +1d12 damage per plus against demons.

name: Spear of the Skylord
description: This longspear is always twice the height of its chosen bearer. Its haft is as black as a starless night sky, and its blade is the white of pure clouds. It was granted to a wind archon general during the earliest war, and it brings war from the skies even still.

info.enhancement:: The Spear of the Skylord is a +3 longspear with the following properties and powers.

critical:: The Spear’s enhancement bonus increases to +4.               +4d6 thunder damage, or +4d8 thunder damage against creatures standing on the ground.
special:: Once per day, when you are addressed by a person of authority, the Spear leaps into its owner’s hands and makes a melee basic attack against the person.

name: Demonwrought Armor
description: This armor is fashioned with a demon's likeness, and it bestows some of the resistances that its namesake possesses.

name: Desert Rose
description: Growing only in remote desert oases, this yellow flower helps to maintain arcane and divine powers.

name: Desiccating Weapon
description: This weapon weakens the body of an enemy with each new strike.

name: Desperate Resolve Vestments
description: The divine power within these vestments turns the deadliest attack into a glancing blow.

name: Destiny Staff
description: A black raven's head with diamond eyes tops this mighty staff. It bolsters your fate, increasing your odds of survival and allowing you to act when others aren't quick enough.

name: Determined Weapon
description: When you throw this weapon, it continues to attack your foe before returning to you.

name: Devastating Ki Focus
description: This small triangular slab appears to be made of some deep green stone, mottled with flecks of black and covered in runed etchings. The slab fits in one hand but seems far heavier than it should.

name: Devil's Claw
description: This hideous, clawed hand hangs on a thick hemp cord. Holding it makes you feel as if you had the power to enthrall even the most powerful infernal beings.

name: Devil's Tongue Polearm
description: This wicked polearm's red lacquered blade takes the shape of stylized flames atop a pole of burned wood reinforced with black iron.

name: Devilblind Weapon
description: This weapon gleams with holy energy that devils find intensely painful.
critical:: +1d6 radiant damage per plus, +1d8 radiant damage per plus against devils.

name: Broken Blade of Banatruul
description: You hold the sword—more of a sword-shaped energy field, really—aloft. You see jagged shards and splinters of dark gray metal, some intersecting like puzzle pieces and others floating in the energy field’s suspension.
enhancement:: The Broken Blade of Banatruul is a +4 greatsword.               Attack rolls and damage rolls

name: Diadem of Acuity
description: This metal headband enhances your insight and perception skills.

name: Diadem of Exquisite Communication
description: This diadem makes you a conduit for unspoken thoughts and lets you take the advantage when an enemy attacks your strength of mind.
augment_1:: (Psychic): The enemy also takes psychic damage equal to your Constitution, Intelligence, or Charisma modifier (whichever is highest).

name: Diamond Bracers
description: These clear crystal vambraces of interlocking plates can protect you from virtually anything, for a time.

name: Diamond Cincture
description: Each gleaming diamond on this belt is a powerful conduit for healing energy.

name: Diamond Scabbard
description: A blade drawn from this diamond-studded scabbard is granted an incomparable magical edge.

name: Diamond Wand
description: This gem-topped wand's fragile appearance belies its strength.

name: Dice of Auspicious Fortune
description: The faces of these wooden dice show symbols the halflings associate with good luck.

name: Dimensional Anchor
description: This statue appears in many guises, but each binds nearby creatures to their locations in the world.

name: Dimensional Gauntlets
description: These light mail gauntlets allow you to lash out at nearby foes.

name: Dimensional Shackles
description: These manacles of solid energy glow a brilliant blue when placed upon a foe, effectively shackling the creature to the here and now.

name: The Immortal Game
description: This fine marble chessboard has white and red pieces. When you set the pieces out before you, a spectral, skeletal figure appears opposite you and silently beckons you to take the first move.

info.win:: The Immortal Game moves on when the game is over, rewarding the player’s tactical wisdom or punishing the player’s tactical foolishness.
info.draw:: The only way to win is to reach a concordance score of 21. At that point, the chessboard disappears and the player receives a reward as determined below.
info.loss:: A draw can occur in one of two ways. A match that reaches the 30th exchange of moves is a draw. If the owner loses the chessboard or doesn’t play at least every other day while at a concordance score of 5 or higher, that’s also a draw. If the player gets a draw, he gets neither the reward nor the curse.

name: Dimensional Stride Boots
description: You step through a thin rift in space and reappear instantly in another location nearby.

name: Diplomat's Scabbard
description: Sometimes diplomacy requires swordplay.

name: Diplomat's Table
description: This majestic darkwood table enhances your position in negotiations.

name: Dire Totem
description: As you undergo the transformation into beast form, your body grows larger, heavier, and far more dangerous.

name: Direbeast Shield
description: Covered in bear hides and marked with a wolf 's head, this shield lends the stamina of wild beasts to your allies.

name: Disk of Energy Resistance
description: The runes inscribed around the gemstone set in the center of this metal disk are wards to protect you from magical attacks.
requirement:: You must have the living construct racial trait to use this item.

name: Dislocation Weapon
description: This weapon flickers as it strikes, transporting your enemy into a disadvantageous position among your allies.
augment_2:: the enemy grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.

name: Dispelling Bolt
description: This flat-black quarrel extinguishes conjurations and zones.

name: Dispelling Tome
description: This thin tome helps you unbind magical creations.

name: Displacer Armor
description: When wearing this armor, you appear as though you're in many places at once.

info.Description: Feyleather armor is cured by an eladrin method that leaves the armor supple, but tougher than normal leather.

name: Disrupting Weapon
description: Created in ancient days by priests of Pelor, this weapon is the bane of undead everywhere.

name: Distance Weapon
description: This weapon flashes brightly as it hurtles forth, moving with enough force to carry it much farther than normal.

name: Distracting Tattoo
description: Any small, bright image in a highly visible place is sufficient.

name: Divine Retribution Armor
description: When you are hit, the divine power imbuing the links of this armor flares and empowers your attacks against those that harm you.

name: Domino of Olladra
description: The numbers on this white and gray domino's face change every time you use a prayer, emphasizing your deity's capricious nature.
requirement:: You must worship olladra or the sovereign host to use this holy symbol.

name: Door Warden
description: The ornamental face on this door interrogates and introduces your visitors.

name: Door of Alarm
description: This seemingly innocuous door issues a shrill alarm when an unknown creature walks through it.

name: Doss Lute
description: The dulcet music of this lute imbues its listeners with resilience and quiet resolve.

name: Dragon Bile
description: Harvested from the bodies of ancient dead dragons, this poison is one of the most lethal.

name: Dragon Sorcery Tattoo
description: Your chosen dragon coils around your heart and neck until you take a moment to recover your strength—the dragon's breath roars against your foes!

name: Helm of the Madman’s Blood
description: This silver helm has glowing red tracery amid its filigree, and as you move the helmet around, the red glow flows through the tracery as if it were liquid.

name: Dragonborn Greaves
description: Made of thick hide covered in scales, these ornate boots tap into your pain and rage.

name: Dragonclaw Armor
description: Sharp talons curl out from between the folds of this suit of armor.

name: Dragondaunt Shield
description: This ornate shield provides extra protection against dragon attacks and can be activated to reduce the damage of an area attack.

name: Dragonfire Tar
description: This sticky substance sears the target with ongoing flames.

name: Dragonrider Armor
description: Woven from old dragon scales, this armor is lightweight and warm to the touch.

name: Dragonscale Armor, Black
description: The sleek, black scales of this armor grant the wearer some of the power of a black dragon.

name: Dragonscale Armor, Blue
description: Arcs of lightning leap from this vibrant blue armor to strike nearby enemies.

name: Dragonscale Armor, Green
description: This green scale armor makes poison attacks you use more potent.

name: Dragonscale Armor, Red
description: When you strike a powerful blow, flames flow from the bright red scales of this armor, up your arm and weapon, and onto your foe.

name: Dragonscale Armor, White
description: From between the white scales of this armor, a chilling mist flows from your body to your target as you strike.

name: Wayfinder Badge
description: This simple gold brooch has a shape that indicates your affiliation with a secret society.
epic:: You gain a +2 bonus to Perception checks against aberrant creatures, as well as a + 2 bonus to saving throws against any effect an aberrant creature imposes on you.

info.heroic:: You can send a short message to a person you know who possesses a Wayfinder badge attuned to yours, as long as the target is on the same plane.
info.paragon:: The power becomes at-will, and the target need not be on the same plane.
info.epic:: All primal spirits the wearer knows of are considered to have attuned Wayfinder badges and are thus eligible targets for this power.

paragon:: An allied character can trigger it if you are unconscious or helpless. The ally can trigger this effect even if he or she lacks line of sight or line of effect to you, and from up to 1 mile away. You teleport to the deck of Hand of Fate in a square of your choice.
heroic_badge:: The badges start out as heroic items, and they increase in power when the PCs reach a pivotal point in the campaign early in each upper tier. Each such badge functions only in accordance with its wearer’s level and tier.               A heroic-tier badge is the equivalent of a 3rd-level magic item.

name: Dragonscale Dagger
description: The dagger isn't literally a dragon scale, but it's shaped like one and its magic kicks in when your Dragon Magic snarls into force after you are bloodied.

name: Dragonscale Shield
description: A heavy shield fashioned from interlocking dragon scales.

name: Dragonscale of Bahamut
description: Emblazoned with the image of the Platinum Dragon, this dragon scale-shaped symbol bestows protection on nearby allies.
requirement:: To use this symbol, You must worship bahamut.

name: Dragonslayer Weapon
description: The bane of dragonkind.
critical:: +1d8 damage per plus, or +1d12 damage per plus against dragons

name: Dragontooth Blade
description: The fury of dragon fire powers your attacks with this bonehandled blade.
critical:: Each enemy marked by you takes ongoing fire damage equal to 3 + the blade’s enhancement bonus (save ends).

name: Dragontooth Shield
description: Made to resemble a massive dragon's tooth, this shield can be a deadly weapon.

name: Dread Helm
description: Beneath this closed chapel de fer, your eyes become burning points and you exude palpable menace.

name: Dread Nightshade
description: This poisonous relative of the eggplant is cultivated to empower poison effects.

name: Dread Weapon
description: Those who suffer a telling blow from this weapon fill with despair, losing all hope.

name: Dreamstone Amulet
description: This amulet consists of a piece of onyxlike stone shot through with dimly glowing veins set in gold and hanging on a gold chain. The stone is carved to look like an eye, and its gold setting is like the lids of that eye. The glowing veins make the inky eye appear bloodshot with light. As you look at it, the golden lids blink, and the eye turns to focus on you.

name: Blue Orb of Dragonkind
description: The reasons for the primeval struggle between dragons and humanoids are long lost, but the artifacts created during that time are not. Among the greatest are the Orbs of Dragonkind, which grant powers similar to—and over—particular kinds of wyrms. This pale blue crystal sphere is small enough to be held in the palm of a human. Faint wisps of gold swirl throughout it.
special:: Once per day at any time, the Orb can attack you with a haze of lightning. Roll 1d20 + your level vs. Fortitude; you take ongoing 15 lightning damage (save ends).

name: Dreamstone Weapon
description: This hammer has a brutal head made of black stone veined with dimly glowing light. As you heft it you hear susurrus that you find disturbing despite being unable to discern any meaning.

name: Driftmetal Armor
description: Infused with the eldritch power of the planes, this armor gives the wearer the ability to distort his or her position and resist radiant and psychic assault.

name: Drizzt's Kick
description: Drizzt innovated this attack when he found his swords locked with an opponent during training in Menzoberranzan.

name: Drow House Insignia
description: This amulet is expertly carved to display the insignia of a drow noble house.

name: Drowsy Dust
description: You blow the dust from the palm of your hand so it spreads through the air and clouds your opponent's senses.

name: Drum of Panic
description: Covered with the hide of a cacklefiend hyena, this drum strikes fear into the hearts of your enemies.

name: Dual Arrow
description: This forked arrow divides and then conquers.

name: Dual-Threat Gauntlets
description: When you and an ally fight together, the power of these gauntlets heightens both your attacks.

name: Duelist's Bow
description: With this mighty weapon humming as you release arrow after arrow, enemy archers face certain defeat.

name: Duelist's Weapon
description: The favorite weapon of a rogue.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, +1d8 damage per plus if you have combat advantage

name: Axe of the Dwarvish Lords
description: One of five tools given to the first dwarves by Moradin, the Axe of the Dwarvish Lords appears in times of great crisis—often in the hands of a champion destined to save the dwarf people.
critical:: +4d6 damage, or +4d10 damage against creatures larger than Medium size
special:: You take a -5 penalty to attack rolls and damage rolls against any creatures other than goblins or giants. This applies regardless if you are using or even holding the Axe.

name: Dune Runner's Fruit
description: This fruit has gritty flesh and rough skin. Its thick juice is applied to the feet or shoes to speed travel.

name: Dust of Appearance
description: This plain pouch holds a single handful of sparkling dust, which it periodically renews.

name: Dust of Arcane Insight
description: This foil pouch periodically renews a supply of metallic dust that attunes you to arcane effects.

name: Dust of Banishment
description: The crimson powder periodically renewed by this red leather pouch can banish a creature to a fiery prison.

name: Dust of Creation
description: This clear bottle periodically renews a supply of golden sand that can transform into any object.

name: Dust of Disenchantment
description: The sparkling silver dust periodically renewed within this leather pouch can suppress the effects of magic.

name: Dwarfstride Boots
description: In these boots, nothing gets in your way.

name: Dwarven Armor
description: Crafted by the finest dwarf armorsmiths of old, this armor is decorated with the faces of dwarven ancestors.

name: Dwarven Boots
description: These iron boots keep you steady in the face of forceful assaults.

name: Dwarven Greaves
description: This enchanted leg armor, crafted in the dwarven tradition, can be activated to negate a pull, a push, or a slide effect.

name: The Eye of Vecna
description: One of two relics left behind by Vecna before he ascended to godhood, the Eye of Vecna is a red, embalmed orb that pulses as if alive, but remains icy cold to the touch. It retains a remnant of Vecna's mortal power—a power with a singular devotion to evil.
special:: The Eye can speak through you whenever you are stunned or unconscious. It can use either your natural voice or a sinister, eerily loud whisper.

name: Dwarven Thrower
description: The weighted haft of this mithral weapon is engraved with images of giants being struck down by dwarven throwing hammers.

name: Dwarven Throwers
description: These stout iron gauntlets turn any weapon into a ranged weapon.

name: Dynamic Belt
description: This intricately woven mesh belt improves your acrobatics and athletics skills.

name: Dynamic Weapon
description: This weapon transforms into any other melee weapon that its wielder desires.

name: Eager Hero's Tattoo
description: Scenes showing one warrior against many or a lone victorious hero are popular for this tattoo.

name: Eager Weapon
description: Your psionic power primes this weapon to surge into action when an enemy tries to slip past your guard.
critical:: +1d8 damage per plus, or +1d12 damage per plus on opportunity attacks

name: Eagle Eye Goggles
description: Though these leather goggles have dark eye pieces, they sharpen your sight when making ranged attacks.

name: Earth-Wrought Hammer
description: This hammer appears to be carved from a single piece of stone, though it's no heavier than a normal weapon. But it hits your enemies like a battering ram.

name: Earthbind Lodestone
description: When thrown to the ground, this smooth metallic stone hits with such force that it knocks airborne creatures from the sky.

name: Earthbreaker Weapon
description: Creatures of the earth suffer most at the strike of this weapon.
weapon:: Axe, flail, hammer, mace, pick or  sling

name: The Hand of Vecna
description: One of two relics left behind by Vecna before he ascended to godhood, the Hand of Vecna is a blackened, mummified left hand, icy cold to the touch. It retains a remnant of Vecna's mortal power—a power with a singular devotion to evil.
special:: Each time you miss with an attack, there is a 25% chance that the Hand uses diabolic grasp against one of your allies within range of the spell (determined randomly by the DM).

name: Earthfall Totem
description: Attacks with this rough-hewn stone totem pack a powerful punch.

name: Earthreaver Stompers
description: These heavy, steel-soled boots allow you to sense vibrations as well as give you a powerful stomp.

name: Earthroot Staff
description: This staff is as light as wood, but it seems to be made of earth and stone with a fine crystal atop it. It can bind your enemies to the earth and protect you against the same.
critical:: The target is restrained until the end of your next turn

name: Earthshaker Staff
description: This staff, topped with a shard of darkest obsidian, appears solid and unbending, like the ground itself.

name: Earthstriders
description: You instantly move through the earth using these blunt-toed shoes.

name: Earthwalker's Boots
description: These heavy boots look to be fashioned from stone, but are as flexible as ordinary leather.

name: Eberron Shard of Animosity
description: This crimson crystal flares whenever it's in the presence of an otherworldly being.

name: Eberron Shard of Bleeding Wounds
description: Your weapon cuts a bloody swathe through your foes when powered by this blood-red dragon shard.

name: Eberron Shard of Lightning
description: When you bind this flashing dragon shard crystal to your weapon, sparks fly whenever it strikes an enemy.

name: Eberron Shard of Ruin
description: Affixing this pulsing red stone to your weapon helps you smash through any obstacle.

name: The Invulnerable Coat of Arnd
description: This gleaming chain mail belonged to a poor cleric of Kord who fought to free his village from its tyrannical baron. Imbued with the cleric's fighting spirit and holy strength, the Invulnerable Coat of Arnd seeks to reclaim its ancient glory.
special:: You take a -5 penalty to all defenses against creatures whose level is equal to or lower than yours.

name: Ebon Gauntlets
description: The inner palms of these black gauntlets are covered with small metal studs. Touching the studs causes a faint sense of nausea to course through you.

name: Ebony FlyEbony Fly
description: : When you activate a figurine, the conjured creature appears in a space adjacent to you, provided the space is large enough to contain the creature without squeezing. The creature obeys only you, responding to commands spoken in any language. The creature remains for up to 8 hours or until you use a minor action to dismiss it. The conjured creature acts on the same initiative count as you. Every action it takes costs you a minor action (which you use to issue commands), and a conjured creature cannot exceed its normal allotment of actions (a standard, a move, and a minor action) during its turn. If you spend no minor actions on your turn to command the creature, it remains where it is without taking any actions on its turn.          A conjured creature has hit points, defenses, and attacks as indicated in its statistics block. It has no healing surges and cannot be healed, though it can still benefit from temporary hit points. When reduced to 0 hit points or fewer, the conjured creature disappears and cannot be conjured again until after you’ve taken an extended rest. Conjured creatures lack basic attacks and therefore cannot make opportunity attacks.          Mount: If the conjured creature has the mount keyword, you can ride the creature and are considered to have the Mounted Combat feat while mounted on it. While mounted, you can command the creature using free actions, though the mount is still limited to its normal allotment of actions. You can choose to be mounted on the creature when it appears.

name: Echo of the Crystal Forest
description: Rising from the center of the Crystal Forest is an obsidian plateau. After you ascend it, you feel your skin beginning to harden. Even after you leave, a vestige of that quality remains with you.

name: Echoing Songblade
description: The echoes of your spells reverberate in the blade, hoping to be unleashed.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, and if the attack was a bard encounter power, you can use that power one more time on your next turn against a single target with a –2 penalty to the attack roll (you must still use the appropriate action to use the power).

name: Ectoplasmic Armor
description: This armor, covered in mottled patterns that shift with your mood, lets you take on the form of a spirit.
augment_1:: You are also phasing until the end of your next turn.

name: Eladrin Armor
description: Crafted by master eladrin armorsmiths, the fine links of this chainmail sparkle in even the faintest light.

name: Eladrin Boots
description: These enchanted boots, crafted in the eladrin tradition, increase your teleport distance.

name: Eladrin Ring of Passage
description: This mithral ring enhances your teleportation abilities.

name: Elderwood FalconElderwood Falcon
description: This wooden statuette depicts a falcon with wings outspread.

name: Ilthuviel's Blackened Heart
description: The great green wyrm Ilthuviel was one of the first dragons that sought to become a dracolich. Something went awry, and he did not gain lichdom. This matte platinum amulet has a green dragon's black and shrunken heart embedded within it.
special:: Any time you are reduced to fewer than 0 hit points and then healed, the Heart takes over. You are dominated (save ends), and the Heart causes you to attack your allies.

name: Eldritch Medallion
description: When you're injured, the power of this intricately engraved medallion lets you slip away from your foes.

name: Eldritch Serpent Armor
description: The overlapping scales of this armor are taken from magical serpents.

name: Electrum SerpentElectrum Serpent
description: : The delicate electrum serpent frequently dangles from a thin chain so that it can be worn about the neck, but a few include pins to serve as pendants as well. Additionally, others might be standard 2-inch tall statuettes.               The electrum serpent is a strange figurine in that it seems to contain two creatures in one. One command summons forth a fearsome snake that streaks across the battlefield and sinks foot-long fangs into its foes. A second command summons a transparent serpent with milk-white scales that slithers and coils around its master or ally to bestow new life and vigor. Neither serpent ever appears at the same time, though some legends claim the serpents would turn upon each other if they both did appear at once.

name: Elemental Prism
description: This flickering prism focuses elemental power and converts it to a different element, bathing you in a protective glow.

name: Elemental Twist Weapon
description: This dagger allows you to twist your foes' resistances to your advantage.

name: Elementalbane Weapon
description: Forged of celestial steel and created to slay archons, this weapon excels at destroying natives of the Elemental Chaos.
critical:: +1d8 damage per plus, +1d12 damage per plus against elementals.

name: Elixir of Accuracy
description: This crisp draught leaves your senses clear and your aim true.

name: Elixir of Aptitude
description: This sweet amber broth enhances your innate talents.

name: Elixir of Dragon Breath
description: Whether frigid, acidic, or crackling with energy, this liquid grants you a potent blast of dragon breath.

name: Elixir of Flying
description: A moment after imbibing this effervescent draught, your body lifts off the ground and you feel light as a bird.

name: Spear of Urrok the Brave
description: Urrok the Brave was the greatest champion of the Empty Eye orc tribe. He fought in hand-to-hand combat with four separate dragons. When Urrok finally fell against the fifth dragon, the shamans of his tribe recovered his spear, adorning it with mystic runes and potent fetishes. The Spear of Urrok the Brave has spilled the blood of dozens of dragons by now, not only in the hands of orcs, but also in those of wielders of other races.
special:: Any time you enter battle with orcs, the Spear screams for them to reclaim it. The orcs gain a +4 bonus to initiative, and a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls against you. These bonuses apply whether you are using or merely carrying the Spear.

name: Elixir of Fortitude
description: Your body grows tougher after imbibing this viscous fuchsia liquid.

name: Elixir of Invisibility
description: When you drink this scentless liquid, you fade from view.

name: Elixir of Reflexes
description: You become quicker after imbibing this thin rose liquid.

name: Elixir of Speed
description: This sapphire brew crackles with energy and increases your speed.

name: Elixir of Will
description: Your mind becomes more resilient after imbibing this bubbling white liquid.

name: Elukian Clay Armor
description: Sculpted from stone found in the Elemental Chaos, this armor repels even the most severe acid.

name: Elukian Clay Weapon
description: This stone bow has surprising flexibility.

name: Elusive Action Ki Focus
description: As you practice with this blunt short sword, you mystically learn new defensive techniques.

name: Elven Battle Armor
description: There's no mistaking the forest motif woven into elven battle armor.

info.Description: Starleather armor is infused with the raw spiritual matter of the Astral Sea, making it light and strong.

name: Unconquered Standard of Arkhosia
description: In one of the last great battles between Arkhosia and Bael Turath, a single dragonborn regiment held a fortress against multiple legions of tieflings and their diabolic allies. When the battle was over, every demon had fallen, every tiefling—and every dragonborn but one. Wounded, he still lifted his commander's tattered standard before he set out for home. His people kept the banner as a sign of the victory. It disappeared with the fall of Arkhosia, but has reappeared throughout the centuries, infused with powers that bolster the righteous in their battle against evil. The Standard is a banner flying atop a pole of oak. The flag boasts the symbol of a golden dragon on a deep blue field.
special:: You and your allies still gain the artifact's fire resistance and bonus to death saving throws. None of its other powers function for you or your allies.

name: Emblem of Dol Dorn
description: A red shield crossed by a silver sword embodies Dol Dorn's demand that his followers endure any suffering necessary to accomplish what is right.
critical:: +1d8 damage per plus, or +1d10 damage per plus while bloodied
requirement:: You must worship dol dorn or the sovereign host to use this holy symbol.

name: Emerald Flame Ki Focus
description: A flickering, yellow flame dances within this green gem's facets, hinting at the magic that can be unleashed only by one with the focus needed to study the flame's secrets.

name: Emerald FrogEmerald Frog
description: : Portraits depicting Khyaran the Profound all share one odd feature. In every painting, the artist included an inch-long emerald frog. Many at first believed the inclusion of the frog to be an affectation of the artist—Khyaran relied on the great talent of Ruobald Kent, whose talent with the brush exceeded all his contemporaries. Later, most rejected the theory because the frog never appeared in any of Kent’s other works. The frog then remained a mystery until an adventuring group located the Profound’s tomb and recovered the frog, learning of its unusual magical properties.               Since the emerald frog’s rediscovery, many artificers and alchemists have sought to reproduce its curious magic to create new figurines modeled after the first. These copies are worthwhile, but none of them come close to matching the original’s power. Some say the frog, despite its modest size, could swallow a dragon whole, though the methods by which it achieved this are thus far beyond any artisan’s understanding.
hopping_escape: (immediate reaction, when the frog is missed by a melee attack; at-will)

name: Empathic Mind
description: You experience others' emotions and can make their pain into a balm for your wounds.

name: Empyreal Breastplate
description: The most interesting component in this full suit of armor is the breastplate which bears the likeness of trumpeting angels and vanquished demons.

name: Enchanted Reins
description: These well-made silver and leather reins make any beast you wish to control more manageable.

name: Endless Canteen
description: This mundane-looking canteen pours forth water in a seemingly limitless stream.

name: Endless Quiver
description: Each time you slip your hand inside this quiver, you find the ammunition you need waiting for you.

name: Jet Black Ioun Stone
description: A unique and powerful Ioun stone, this artifact appears as a pure black void, forever traveling in a slow, patient orbit.
special:: You cannot choose to knock an enemy unconscious or use the Intimidate skill to force a bloodied enemy to surrender. You must fight to the death.

name: Endless Quiver - Kamestiri Uniform
description: This elven-styled quiver can create an endless supply of normal arrows or bolts.

name: Enduring Beast Armor
description: The spirit within this glistening armor grants you the fortitude to replenish your energy even after the most grievous wounds.

name: Enduring Spirit Vestments
description: The divine power imbued in these vestments inures you to damage.

name: Enshrouding Candle
description: This everburning candle creates a dim corona of light that helps conceal you from foes.

name: Entrapping Weapon
description: An arrow fired from this weapon keeps your enemy from wandering off.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or the target is restrained until the end of your next turn.

name: Entreri's Jeweled Dagger
description: This exquisitely wrought dagger is set with large emeralds.
critical:: +5d6 necrotic and psychic damage, and you regain 1 healing surge.

name: Envenomed Ki Focus
description: This item looks like a bracelet made of green-tinted steel, in the shape of a thorny vine. Etched into the surface of the bracelet are magical teachings that fill your ki with venom.

name: Erathis's Beacon
description: The first cities were carved from the wilderness in the name of Erathis. With her boon, the same sense of teamwork allows you and your allies to overcome any obstacle.

name: Eremann, Speaker of the Dead (Shadowfell Gloves)
description: These supple black gloves, woven with Shadowfell thread, are adorned with the bones of a humanoid's hand, which are stitched onto the backs of the gloves with red thread.          When you look at the gloves, they beckon you.

name: Escape Tattoo
description: Broken chains and skeleton keys are popular images for this tattoo.

name: Mirror of Secrets
description: This large platinum hand mirror is inlaid with jade and onyx. It functions as a portal to a magic fortress in the Shadowfell that serves as Trebarra Kan's prison.

name: Essence of the Scout
description: By installing this metal disk in your chest, your movements make scarcely a sound.
requirement:: You must have the living construct racial trait to use this item.

name: Essence of the Wisp
description: A glowing ball of light buzzes around your head, drawing in foes that attack you from a distance.

name: Eternal Chalk
description: The marks left by this chalk glow briefly as you scribe them, remaining in place to guide you until you choose to erase them.

name: Ever-Fading Armor
description: This armor is inlaid with leaf patterns and seems to fade in and out of existence, like the camouflage of a magical beast.

name: Everlasting Provisions
description: This plain basket radiates delicious smells.

name: Evil Eye Fetish
description: The vile bloodshot eye attached to this rawhide collar punishes those who seek to take advantage of you.

name: Evoke the Gold Dragon
description: You have woken the spirit of Ayunken-vanzen, which sleeps within the ancient lands surrounding Nerath. Its fiery presence is now manifested in your powers.

name: Exalted Armor
description: Clerics and warlords often seek out exalted armor because of its properties that improve their healing powers.

name: Exchequer's Ledger
description: A simple wooden desk supports a book filled with ever-changing mystical entries.

name: Executioner's Bracers
description: These ornamental gold bracers help you to hit harder.

name: Orb of Light
description: The Orb of Light appears to be a large and faintly glowing white pearl. When worn or wielded by a character capable of using a holy symbol as an implement, its surface shows the image of that character's deity.
critical:: +2d6 radiant damage, or +2d10 radiant damage against undead creatures
special:: Once per day, at the start of an encounter including undead enemies, the Orb teleports you to a space within 10 squares that is adjacent to the greatest number of undead. This penalty applies whether you are using or even holding the Orb.

name: Exodus Knife
description: This insubstantial silver blade appears to cut through solid walls.

name: Exsiccating Weapon
description: Glowing with crimson light, this weapon leeches moisture from the air around you.
critical:: +1d6 fire and necrotic damage per plus

name: Eye of Basilisk
description: This burnished silver eye patch turns aside gaze attacks.

name: Eye of Deception
description: This copper circlet is set with a mummified eye and aids you in the ways of deception.

name: Eye of Discernment
description: Little escapes your notice when this astral diamond-studded velvet patch covers one eye.

name: Eye of Ioun
description: A holy symbol shaped like an eye, this icon of Ioun allows you to tap into the power of prophecy to avoid future danger.
requirement:: To use this symbol, You must worship ioun.

name: Eye of Prophecy
description: This large crystal is actually a mineralized eye from the legendary Beast of Talgora.

name: Eye of Watchfulness
description: This eye patch hides potent magic that makes you more perceptive than you appear to be.

name: Silver Mask of Kas
description: This solid silver mask is fashioned in the form of a fanged skull. It was originally forged for the exarch Kas by his overlord Vecna.
special:: The artifact's item bonus to Diplomacy and Intimidate checks against undead creatures decreases to +2. The character cannot use the daily power that allows a secondary attack.

name: Eye of the Earthmother
description: A knothole resembling an eye peers out of this fist-sized tangle of roots, which floats near your head.

name: Eyes of the Deep Dwarf
description: These heavy goggles gleam faintly with psionic energy, helping you see what lurks in the darkness.

name: Eyes of the Dragon
description: These black goggles with crystal lenses fit snugly over your face.

name: Eyesting
description: The fine black powder has a bitter smell and burns the skin.

name: Face-Stealing Ring
description: This wearer of this ivory ring sees the faces of others as potential disguises.

name: Factotum Helm
description: With this elaborately etched helm, you gain skill mastery beyond you previously.

name: False Blood Amulet
description: This silver necklace bears a pendant of polished opal. It signifies changeability.

name: Familiar's Baldric
description: This jeweled collar or harness identifies your familiar as belonging to you and extends your protection to it.

name: Familiar's Cowl
description: While cloaked in this dark velvet garment, your familiar avoids the notice of larger enemies.
requirement:: Your familiar must be in active mode.

name: Fan of the Four Winds
description: A wave of this fan sends a blast of air against a foe.

name: Soul Sword
description: This artifact is a flawlessly crafted, weighty two-handed weapon that shines with its own internal light. The opal pommel stone shines or grows dull depending on the sword's mood.
special:: The Sword importunes any of your allies it feels would be better owners. It might solicit strangers as well.

name: Far Hand Gloves
description: These black leather gloves have oddly long fingers.

name: Far-Step Amulet
description: This amulet appears to be the frame and shattered glass of a scrying mirror. Its magic focuses your teleportation powers.

name: Farbond Spellblade
description: When bonded to you, this spellblade returns to your hand faster and from farther distances.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d8 per plus when used as an implement for an arcane power

name: Farndak's Glittering Ring
description: This gem-studded ring lets you draw vigor from your allies even as it pulls a foe into your grasp.

name: Farslayer Weapon
description: As you swing this weapon through the air, wounds magically appear on enemies beyond your normal reach.

name: Fearsome Reputation
description: Even the most intrepid gladiators pause when they learn that you are to be their next opponent.

name: Feast Table
description: This magnificent round oak table seats twelve and provides a magnificent banquet for all present.

name: Feather Boat
description: The secrets of the feather boat, first created by noble eladrin explorers, have long since passed on to other races.

name: Feedback Armor
description: Crackling psychic energy cascades around you, flaring outward when you make a mental assault on a foe.

name: Feinting Gloves
description: These black silk gloves help you misdirect your opponent's attention.

name: Sword of Kas
description: The Sword of Kas was created by Vecna for his lieutenant. Kas rewarded his former master by using it to cut off Vecna's hand and gouge out his eye. The Sword offers great power to any who grasp it, but wielders end up betraying what they love most.
special:: Each time you miss an enemy with the Sword, make a melee basic attack as a free action with the Sword against a randomly chosen adjacent ally.

name: Fell Beast Totem
description: This totem is infused with venom extracted from corrupt predators of the swamp.

name: Feral Armor
description: This armor causes its wearer to develop a ferocious streak, like that of the predator that once wore the same skin.

name: Feral Glory Tattoo
description: The great predator or mighty weapon you' ve chosen as the subject of this tattoo of blood shifts across your skin an inch or two each time you use it, flowing around your body over the course of the years.

name: Feral Spirit Totem
description: When the wild spirits stream forth from their homes to hunt, they won't be satisfied with only one victim.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus to the target or to one enemy adjacent to your spirit companion

name: Fey Flute
description: Made from lustrous reeds from the Feywild, this set of pipes fortifies the mind against the wiles common among the fey.

name: Fey Step Potion
description: Encapsulated in a tiny carafe of white porcelain, this murky blue liquid froths when uncorked and releases a silvery fog. Drinking the sour stuff grants the power to teleport.

name: Fey Strike Weapon
description: Even distant foes must fear a blow from a warrior with this gleaming weapon in hand.

name: Fey Warrior's Boots
description: Step in and out the Feywild with this leaf-weight footwear.

name: Fey-Blessed Circlet
description: This slender silver and moonstone circlet grants you a small measure of fey grace.

name: Feybread Biscuit
description: This hard but tasty biscuit enhances your recuperative powers for the rest of the day.

name: Tome of Shadow
description: This thick volume is bound in a dark hide etched with elaborate silver symbols. The stretched-skin pages and tightly scrawled writing are bathed in shadow, even under the brightest light.

name: Feyleaf Sandals
description: This delicate footgear incorporates Feywild leaves into its design.

name: Feyleaf Vambraces
description: A bright blue glow erupts from these tough bark guards, and the world shifts around you.

name: Feymind Armor
description: Motes of silvery light dance around the head of one who dares attack you.

name: Feyrod
description: The capricious arcane power of the fey can be channeled into this rod, allowing you to temporarily gain the benefits of the fey pact.

name: Feyshard Wand
description: This slender mirrored shard reflects the ghostly image of eladrin battle mages and replenishes the arcane power within you.

name: Feyslaughter Weapon
description: A bane of fey and teleporting creatures, this blackened weapon is favored by many hunters.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, +1d10 damage per plus against fey creatures.

name: Feystep Lacings
description: Cords spun from enchanted fey wool teleport you out of—or into—harm's way.

name: Feystride Boots
description: These supple gray boots help you close the distance across the battlefield.

name: Feyswarm Staff
description: This staff seems to have burrowing insects moving under its surface. When used to attack, it can unleash these magical pests on your enemies.
critical:: The target is dazed by stinging magical insects until the end of your next turn

name: Feytouched Armor
description: Materials from the Feywild are worked into this armor, improving your reflexes and allowing you to disappear briefly.

name: Von Zarovich Family Sword
description: Commissioned by Count Strahd, this weapon is the family sword of the von Zarovich clan, symbol of its sovereign rule over Barovia.
special:: At the end of each round in which an attack is knowingly made with it against a member of the von Zarovich family, the weapon burns with sudden intensity, dealing 30 fire damage to its owner.

name: Fickle Twilight Totem
description: This gray bone, ever shrouded in shadow, symbolizes the ancient truce between the fey and the druids of the Eldeen Reaches.

name: Fighting Shield
description: This shield quivers on your arm, eager to taste blood with its sharpened edge.

name: Final Messenger
description: This warforged communication device is built to resemble a small winged animal, yet it is an intricate assembly of clockwork pieces.
requirement:: You must have the living construct racial trait to use this item.

name: Final Sleep Ki Focus
description: This small manual's plain, black leather covers contain illustrations of the vulnerable points on a variety of creatures. The contents change each time you open the book, and as you flip from page to page you never seem to reach the book's end.

name: Final Word Weapon
description: Etched into the weapon's blade are profound curses and dire threats.

name: Fire Beetle Potion
description: Your eyes glow faintly and your skin darkens and takes on a chitinous texture when you imbibe this red, smoky potion.

name: Fire Horn
description: This brass horn is warm to the touch. Fire symbols are carved along its length.

name: Firebird
description: A small fiery bird orbits your shoulders, warding against flame and burning those who strike you at range.

name: Fireburst Armor
description: Eladrin master tailors magically weave threads of arcane fire into the supple cloth used to make this robe or jacket.

name: Fireburst Boots
description: Fire fuels these scorched iron boots.

name: Whelm
description: An anathema to goblins, trolls, and giants, Whelm is a war hammer of noble bearing originally crafted by dwarves. Its spirit is a born hunter, driving its wielder to slay the weapon's enemies.
critical:: +2d6 damage, or +2d10 against creatures larger than Medium size.
special:: You take a -5 penalty to attack rolls against creatures that aren't goblins, trolls, or giants. This applies whether you are using or even holding Whelm.

name: Fireflower Pendant
description: Formed from a string of fire opals, this ornament unleashes fiery retribution.

name: Fireheart Tattoo
description: As you call upon its power, flames flare and twist around the heart at the center of this tattoo.

name: Firestorm Arrow
description: The charred wood of this arrow seems to shimmer with heat.

name: Flagon of Ale Procurement
description: Sought by brewers and barflies, this ornate flagon is not one you take away from a  dwarf—even to save his or her life.

name: Flail of Winds
description: This flail's bludgeoning head is scribed with runes of elemental magic. The runes form creases and grooves along its head. When swung, it emits a whistle like a howling wind.

name: Flame Bracers
description: Flickering flames dance across your arm guards.

name: Flame Rose
description: Your fire magic is augmented by this beautiful crimson rose.

name: Flame Wand
description: Small flames become conflagrations when channeled through this wand.

name: Flamebane Bomb
description: This crystal cylinder of blue liquid quells flame when it explodes against a surface.

info.Description: Darkhide armor is a superior tiefling armor cured in fire and infused with shadow.

name: Adamantine Horse of XarnPleased Adamantine Horse of XarnSatisfied Adamantine Horse of XarnAdamantine Horse of Xarn
description: At first glance, this artifact appears as an adamantine platebarded warhorse of particularly powerful build, but further inspection reveals that the entire horse is made of metal and is powered by gears and hidden arcane devices. Due to the genius of its craftsmanship, its noble form moves naturally despite its unyielding material.

name: Flameburst Weapon
description: This ranged weapon packs a fiery surprise.

name: Flamedrinker Armor
description: This well-crafted plate armor absorbs flames, providing some protection against fire.

name: Flamedrinker Shield
description: This shield swirls with gold and ruby hues as it absorbs the jet of flame meant to burn your flesh.

name: Flameheart Totem
description: A constantly smoldering mote of flame dangles from this totem and infuses your evocations with fiery power.

name: Flameward Shield
description: Stylized golden flames adorn this deep red shield.

name: Flamewrath Cape
description: Intermittent wisps of smoke rise from this garment, which can burst into flame upon your command.

name: Flaming Weapon
description: You can will this weapon to burst into flame.

name: Flanker's Boots
description: With a mere thought, you use these rabbitskin boots to move into an advantageous position.

name: Flanking Weapon
description: Your enemies are loath to take their eyes off your weapon in battle, allowing you and your allies to catch them off guard more easily.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, +1d8 damage per plus when you are flanking an opponent.

name: Flaring Shield
description: An opponent's poorly aimed attack is met with a blinding flash of light.

name: Amulet of Passage
description: This fine silver chain is unassuming, bearing a single arrowhead-shaped jewel. While you wear this amulet, it stirs thoughts of legendary battles and heroic deeds.

name: Flash Flower
description: This flower, which is sometimes found near lightning-struck ground, contains electrical magic.

name: Flashbang Powder
description: The packet explodes with a bright flash and a sharp report, filling the area with smoke and defying multiple senses.

name: Flask of the Dragon's Breath
description: This magic flask produces one dose of a fiery elixir each day.

name: Flaying Gloves
description: These tight-fitting gloves allow you to deal bleeding wounds with a light blade.

name: Fleece of Renewal
description: This fleece cloak gives you a boost of vigor each time you charge.

name: Fleet Hero Tattoo
description: This mark often takes the form of wings tattooed on the ankles.

name: Fleetrunner Boots
description: The owner of these boots is gifted with unprecedented mobility in combat.

name: Flensing Weapon
description: Nasty serrations extend from this weapon, perfect for tearing flesh.
weapon:: Axe, light blade, heavy blade or  spear
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, +1d8 damage per plus against bloodied targets.

name: Flesh Grinder
description: This weapon screeches as its serrated edge bites through flesh, bone, and steel.

name: Flesh Seeker
description: Thinner than most weapons of its type, this weapon slips between armored plates and even magic defenses.

name: Talisman of Al'AkbarCup of Al'AkbarPotion of Al'Akbar
description: This eight-pointed star of hammered platinum hangs on a chain of gold and pearls. Each point of the star is tipped with a diamond, and elaborate patterns of gold inlay cover its surface.
level: Paragon Level           Paragon Level           Paragon Level
religion_dc 22:: The  and  are divine relics with great healing powers. Legend says that they were gifts from Pelor, given to mortals to help the world recover from a time of terrible devastation.
religion_dc 27:: After the artifacts were first used to care for the injured and sick, conflicts arose over the ownership of the  and  . Some sought to use the items for good, while others wanted to support armies of conquest, and skirmishes raged over their possession until the artifacts disappeared.
special:: You gain no benefit from drinking a  .

name: Flickersight Armor
description: Your body becomes indistinct and hazy to onlookers who must now squint to see you clearly.

name: Floating Lantern
description: You hang this lantern on the empty air, where it floats under your command.

name: Floating Shield
description: Enameled with images of ocean waves, this shield eases your way in water.

name: Floorfighter Straps
description: Scuffed and worn, these rawhide bands keep you dangerous even when on the ground.

name: Flowform Armor
description: This armor quickly adapts to changing environments, shielding you from adverse effects.
augment_1:: You gain a bonus to the saving throw equal to the armor's enhancement bonus.

name: Flute of the Dancing Satyr
description: Carved from wood and inscribed with arcane glyphs, this flute can play a tune of speed and elegance.

name: Flying Carpet
description: This 4-foot square of carpet is woven with intricate stitching and strange runes.

name: Flying Hook
description: When you toss this grappling hook into the air, it soars off under your mental command.

name: Fochlucan Bandore
description: This instrument's song imbues listeners with fervor and strength.

name: Focused Shield
description: When a foe misses you at range, the complex engravings on this shield's surface hinder the accuracy of that foe's subsequent attacks.
augment_1:: The triggering enemy takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls (save ends).

name: Emblem of Ossandrya
description: This medallion, shaped like a shield and glowing with soft golden light, bears Corellon's star symbol in its center.
history_dc 22:: The legendary eladrin Ossandrya wore this emblem during the Last Battle of the Spiral Tower, when forces loyal to Corellon drove the wicked drow from the Feywild. Since then, it has appeared in times of great crisis, when good must stand strong against the powers of treachery and evil.
history_dc 27:: The Emblem of Ossandrya is far more devoted to the cause of justice and good than even Corellon. It drives its owner to pursue the highest ideals of heroic valor.

name: Foe Binder Ring
description: This hefty iron ring earns you greater enmity from all whom you challenge. Such a burden falls heavy on all but the stoutest heart.

name: Foe Caller Gauntlets
description: No enemy can escape your challenge when you point the foe out while wearing these gauntlets.

name: Foe Chaser Boots
description: Those you' ve chosen to fight find escape less likely when you wear these boots.

name: Foe Stone
description: This lodestone is set into a chain, and when aimed toward an enemy, it grants you understanding of your foes' weaknesses.

name: Foe-Seeking Bow
description: You feel the bow's hate for cowardly and furtive opponents.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d10 damage per plus against targets granting combat advantage

name: Folding Astral Skiff
description: This small metallic cube expands into a full-sized astral skiff.

name: Folding Sand Skiff
description: Whittled from hard wood, this miniature sand skiff transforms on command. In its full-sized form, the skiff can sail on any desert terrain.

name: Rash and Reckless
description: These broad-cuffed black boots suggest an attitude of daring and panache. The two pairs are identical in every detail.
history_dc 22:: Rash and Reckless are the individual names of two artifacts, each a pair of boots, meant to be worn by two allies. They originally belonged to a pair of scoundrels who spent their lives in revelry and adventure in the capital city of Nerath years ago. The artifacts allow their owners to work in concert to perform masterful feats of acrobatics and athleticism.
history_dc 27:: The original owners of Rash and Reckless were an inseparable pair of adventurers who began their professional life as acrobats in a traveling carnival. They extended the acrobatic training, teamwork, and entertainer's panache that they learned from the sideshows to their adventuring career. Everything else about this duo's life is a matter of conjecture, legend, and tall tale. To this day, no one is sure of their gender or race, where they were born, or the details of their adventuring career. Even their names are lost to history, replaced by the names of the artifacts they left behind as their legacy.

name: Footpad's Friend
description: When you catch an enemy unaware, this blade is as sharp as your smile.

name: Forbiddance Bolt
description: Teleportation becomes more difficult when this bolt strikes its mark.

name: Forbidding Weapon
description: A creature you strike with this weapon cannot teleport.

name: Force Shield
description: This large shield appears to be composed entirely of force. It protects you until you're struck by an attack.

name: Force Staff
description: Use this staff to knock down your enemies and drag them across the ground.

name: Force Wand
description: With this wand, your force powers pack a bigger punch.

name: Force Weapon
description: The business end of this weapon shimmers. With a single attack, the wielder can trap an enemy with bands of force.

name: Forester's Axe
description: This normal looking axe cuts a swath though plant life of all sorts.
critical:: +1d8 damage per plus, or +1d10 damage per plus against plant creatures

name: Forgemaster's Gloves
description: These blacksmith's gloves are studded with dragonshards and emblazoned with a hammer and anvil.

name: Rod of Seven Parts
description: This short segment of lusterless black metal looks like a single part of a larger whole.
critical:: +1d6 damage per segment, or +1d10 damage per segment against elemental creatures
religion_dc 28:: The Rod of Seven Parts was forged during the Dawn War that raged at the beginning of time between the gods and the primordials. It was crafted by the Wind Dukes of Aaqa, a group of seven angels that served Bahamut, with the assistance of one of Moradin's exarchs. Forged for use against Miska the Wolf-Spider, a demonic primordial of terrible power, it was ultimately driven through Miska's body, shattering into seven parts as it came into contact with the Wolf-Spider's chaotic energy.
religion_dc 33:: As the Rod shattered, Miska was cast through a planar breach (see page 185) and lost on an unknown plane, and the seven fragments of the Rod were scattered throughout the cosmos. The Rod hasn't been reassembled since, despite the best efforts of forces aligned with both sides of the cosmic war.

name: Forked Lightning Ki Focus
description: Crackling lightning illuminates you as it forks toward your enemy.

name: Formidable Armor
description: When you activate this armor, even the mightiest blow can do little more than scratch your skin.

name: Fortification Armor
description: Dragonborn are no strangers to battle, and they developed this armor to deflect the deadliest enemy attacks.

name: Fortified Armor
description: This armor is of dwarven make and bears runes of strength and power.

name: Fortune's Nod
description: Lidda's luck was uncanny. When all hope seemed lost and she was sighing her last breath, fortune smiled on her. She rose to her feet, drove her sword into the young dragon's eye, and smiled.

name: Four Winds Ki Focus
description: Channeling the power of air and sky, you command the four winds to speed your strikes and whisk you to safety.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, and you slide the target 1 square per plus

name: Fragrance of Authority
description: This opaque alabaster bottle periodically renews a subtle perfume that can influence the reactions of others.

name: Freezing Arrow
description: The shaft of this arrow is shaved from unmelting ice.

name: Friend's Gift
description: Your companion wears this crimson badge on its chest as a sign of friendship.

name: Frightful Weapon
description: The blade of this axe is a terror to behold, as are the jagged wounds it causes.

name: Standard of Eternal Battle
description: This tattered standard bears the evidence of a dozen great wars and a thousand battles. Dedicated to the spirit of warfare, the banner patiently waits for worthy owners to carry it into combat.
history_dc 22:: A gift from the god Bane to an ancient hobgoblin conqueror, the Standard of Eternal Battle has flown over countless battlefields in every era of mortal history. It shares its creator's love for war, regardless of the cause or purpose of the conflict.
history_dc 27:: According to legend, the Standard can change hands only through violence—it must be won and claimed as a prize in battle.

name: Frost Charger Bracers
description: These metal and leather bracers have a constant sheen of frost.

name: Frost Fury Weapon
description: When this weapon's wielder is bloodied, the axe blade becomes icy and promises a cold death with each swing.
critical:: +1d6 cold damage per plus, or +1d10 cold damage per plus while you’re bloodied

name: Frost Gauntlets
description: When you pick up your weapon, the ice crystal patterns etched into these gauntlets flare, coating the weapon in a thin sheet of frost.

name: Frost Weapon
description: A thin layer of frost coats the business end of this weapon.

name: Frostburn Armor
description: A fine layer of ice coats the plates of this armor, protecting you or an ally against extreme cold and heat.

name: Frostwolf Pelt
description: The icy white fur of this cloak protects you against frost.

name: Frozen Armor
description: Motes of frost float around this armor, yet a wearer remains warm and resistant to the cold.

name: Frozen Tome
description: The cover of this thick tome appears to be made from solid ice. It's cool to the touch but doesn't melt.

name: Frozen Whetstone
description: A weapon honed with this blue-white crystalline whetstone becomes icy cold to the touch.

name: Fruit of Life
description: Vibrant green and veined in crimson, this fist-sized fruit subtly vibrates with barely contained life force.

name: Blood of Io
description: This dragon-shaped crystal vessel contains droplets of blood spilled when a primordial's axe divided Io into the twin deities Bahamut and Tiamat. The user of this ichor taps into Io's ancient strength.
special:: The Blood places you in harm's way. While marked by any creature, you grant combat advantage to all attackers.

name: Fundamental Ice
description: Immobilize your enemies with powers enhanced by this unmelting ice from the Elemental Chaos.

name: Gadgeteer's Goggles
description: The residuum suspended in these lenses helps you see through the complexities of the deadliest traps.

name: Gaj Headdress
description: A few gaj antennae are included in this luxurious feather headdress. This creates a feedback loop which channels psychic pain into vigor.

name: Gallant Armor
description: This magnificent suit of plate mail rewards you for selflessly tending your companions.

name: Gambit Armor
description: Made for those who like to take chances in battle, this armor lets you risk your own safety for a better chance to harm your foes.

name: Gambler's Suit
description: Luck is fickle, and this stylish set of leathers plays both sides of the coin.

name: Gambler's Weapon
description: Favored by scoundrels and rogues, this unpredictable blade is not for the faint of heart.

name: Gargoyle Ring
description: Wearing this ring of rough stone allows you to adopt a rocky form.

name: Gauntlets of Arcane Might
description: When a foe you have challenged reels from your arcane power, these gauntlets grant you increased vigor.

name: Gauntlets of Blood
description: The blood of wounded foes streams along the joints of these rusty-looking steel gauntlets.

name: Seal of the LawbringerDragon Claw StrikePlatinum Presence
description: This round, platinum medallion features the holy symbol of Bahamut surrounded by seven stylized golden canaries. A fine platinum chain allows its owner to wear it as a pendant.
effect:: Make two melee basic attacks, each of which deals 1d10 + Strength modifier damage.               2d10 + Strength modifier damage.
hit: : The target is stunned (save ends).          : The target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls (save ends).
special:: Once per day during combat, the Seal can make you attack a target within 5 squares of you. Roll a d20 + your level vs. Will; if the attack hits, you mark the target until the end of your next turn, slide 5 squares to a space adjacent to the target, and are dazed (save ends).

name: Gauntlets of Brilliance
description: With a thought, you cause these gold-burnished gauntlets to illuminate.

name: Gauntlets of Brutality
description: Rust and bloodstains mark these leather and steel gauntlets, which strengthen your attacks against fallen foes.

name: Gauntlets of Destruction
description: These armored gloves enable you to deal more than minimum damage when you make a melee attack.

name: Gauntlets of Discontinuity
description: Arcane energy crackles over these gauntlets, disrupting teleportation.

name: Gauntlets of Magical Interchange
description: These gauntlets magically extrude a variety of useful tools and allow you to restore the magic of other items in the thick of combat.

name: Gauntlets of Ogre Power
description: These oversized armored gloves increase your strength and can be activated to increase your damage.

name: Gauntlets of Blinding Strikes
description: These sleek gauntlets speed your strikes for a limited time.

name: Gauntlets of the Blood War
description: These gauntlets are perpetually stained with blood and were originally crafted by elementals to help slay immortals.

name: Gauntlets of the Ram
description: These armored gloves bear the symbol of a ram's head.

name: Gem of Auditory Recollection
description: This smooth gem records the sounds around it, allowing you to listen to the voices of the past when you wish.

name: Plastron of Tziphal
description: This ceremonial breastplate is fashioned from dark stone. The surface is chipped and the edges jagged from the chisel that fashioned it. When worn, it merges with its wearer's flesh, turning skin to a rocky armor as hard as plate.
arcana_dc 20:: The Plastron was carved from the rocky flesh of Tziphal the Mountain Builder, said to be the progenitor of creatures that petrify. The armor retains a bit of the primordial's power, as well as his hatred for the divine order that cast him down.
special:: The first time each day that a critical hit is scored against an ally you can see, that ally is immobilized (save ends).          The ally is restrained (save ends).          The ally is petrified (save ends).          The ally is petrified (no save).

name: Gem of Colloquy
description: This jewel hovers near your head, sharpening your wit and expanding your knowledge of languages.

name: Gem-Studded Idol
description: This golden statue of a rampant dragon has sockets where its eyes would be and at the ends of its horns and claws.

name: Genasi Soul Armor
description: Elemental energies ripple through this armor, said to contain the life energy of a genasi.

name: General's Belt
description: The buckle of this leather belt is a golden shield whose magic revitalizes you when you help your allies heal.

name: General's Weapon
description: A foe lurking out of reach will feel the magical bite of this gilded polearm.

name: Ghost Bridle
description: This bridle gives a mount a phantasmal appearance and the ability to slip through solid objects.

name: Ghost Chain Weapon
description: Ghostly chains bind creatures you strike with this weapon and pull them toward you.

name: Ghost Dance Weapon
description: You react to an enemy's attack with a lightning-fast strike, then slip away within a shroud of shadow.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d10 damage per plus with opportunity attacks
