name: Ghost Mask Ki Focus
description: You focus your ki and can grasp the immaterial terror mask. When you hold the transparent and horrific visage to your own face, it vanishes within you, ready to emerge at your call.

info.Description: Elderhide armor involves scouring with elemental forces.

name: Crystal of Ebon FlameConsumption of the Ebon Flame
description: This fist-sized, black, flame-shaped crystal whispers menacingly when grasped. It offers power but warns of corruption.
critical:: +1d10 damage, and the target takes ongoing 10 fire and necrotic damage and is weakened (save ends both)
arcana_dc 26:: Some researchers claim this artifact is a tear from Tharizdun, the Chained God, cast forth when the deities confined him in a secret prison. Other scholars believe it is a seed of evil he planted in the Elemental Chaos before his imprisonment, one that works even now to win his escape.
arcana_dc 31:: This artifact is the object of desire for depraved worshipers of the Elder Elemental Eye, and a burden for any adventurer chosen to keep it from them. A group of gods once tried—and failed—to destroy it. Instead, they placed a powerful divine curse on it, forcing it to move from owner to owner. The Crystal's current wielder is tasked with containing it, while the artifact tempts him or her to use its powers and serve its master, the Chained God.
trigger: : You reduce a creature within 10 squares of you to 0 hit points.
effect: : You can spend a healing surge. The triggering creature is utterly destroyed. It crumbles to dust and cannot be raised using the Raise Dead ritual. (Epic destiny powers that allow a return from death, and other magic of similar potency, still function.)

name: Ghostlight Candle
description: This plain white wax candle can burn every day without diminishing.

name: Ghostphase Armor
description: This thin white-and-gray mantle fades away near the bottom.

name: Ghoststride Boots
description: These tattered gray boots have a haunting aspect, granting you the elusiveness of a ghost when you need it.

name: Ghoststrike Oil
description: A weapon coated with this murky oil exudes a ghostly yellow mist.

name: Ghostwalk Tattoo
description: Artists paint this tattoo using vague or amorphous designs and avoiding color.

name: Giant Gloves
description: Though they make your hands appear larger, these thick leather wraps fit comfortably and give you an impressive grip.

name: Giantdodger Armor
description: This armor protects against the attacks of larger creatures.

name: Giantkind Gloves
description: The leather of these gloves was harvested from hide- bearing natural beasts of giant size.

name: Gibbering Lump
description: This tiny hunk of mottled flesh warps constantly, growing and losing eyes and mouths as it sits atop your head.

name: Gift of Fire
description: Your complexion assumes a ruddy hue, reflecting your inner fire.

name: Wave
description: This trident is ornately decorated with aquatic images. When grasped, it emanates a divine fervor, urging its bearer to follow its lead.
critical:: +2d6 damage, or +2d10 damage against aquatic or elemental creatures.
arcana_dc 18:: This trident was crafted by giants who were imprisoned by aquatic enemies and turned away from their primordial masters, becoming devout followers of Sekolah, exarch of Melora.
special:: You do not gain a swim speed.

name: Gift of Rain
description: You drink your fill from a tranquil oasis, and healing pours from you.

name: Gift of Thirsting Salt
description: Eerie white crystals suspended within your body surface to absorb the blood you spill in combat, then heal you.

name: Giggle Gas
description: A great green cloud erupts from the shattered glass sphere and sets everyone in the area into convulsive laughter.

name: Gilded Cage
description: This gleaming wall is lined with a fine lattice of gold.

name: Girdle of the Dragon
description: The translucent visage of a young dragon surrounds your body as you unleash the draconic spirit embodied in this magic item.

name: Girdle of the Oxen
description: With this belt, you can bull rush enemies farther than normal.

name: Girdle of the Resolute Body
description: This wide leather belt augments your stamina and natural resilience.

name: Girdle of the Umber Hulk
description: This belt, cut from the carapace of an umber hulk, grants you the power to tunnel through the ground.

name: Gith Orb of Illithid's Bane
description: This silvery orb emits tendrils of psychic interference, piercing the minds of those who wield mental powers.

name: Githyanki Silver Weapon
description: The rune-engraved weapon assaults a creature's mind and has the power to banish it to another plane.

name: Giving Spirit Soulfang
description: A nimbus of white energy around this fang pulses in time with your heartbeat, channeling your life energy into your healing powers.

name: Glass Eye
description: Conceal this glass replica of a bloodshot eye so you can scry the location later.

name: Glassteel Shard
description: Strong as steel, this tempered glass shard enhances the force with which a power strikes.

name: Gleaming Armor
description: When you're wounded, the energy infusing this crystalline armor flares, momentarily dazzling your enemies.
augment_1:: You regain the use of this power.

name: Gloaming Shroud
description: This billowing cloak drinks in the light around it.

name: Globe of Projection
description: The image of a roaring dragon is visible in the depths of this blood-red crystal orb.

name: Gloves of Accuracy
description: While wearing these fingerless deerskin gloves, your shots bypass obstacles.

name: Gloves of Agility
description: As you strap on these tight-fitting, fingerless gloves, your digits tingle with magic.

name: Gloves of Camaraderie
description: These cashmere gloves draw an ailing ally's condition onto you.

name: Gloves of Dimensional Grasp
description: With these skin-tight gloves you can create a small portal through which to manipulate objects.

name: The Deck of Many ThingsShelter of FateMark of the StarVision of the Vizier
description: This ornate deck of twenty-two cards is a tool of the forces of chaos and anarchy. It frequently appears when the world has grown too calm, or when someone has grown too powerful, and it sows chaos wherever it lands.

info.major_quest: recovering the prison: The adventurers must find the object in which your psyche is imprisoned. The prison is on another plane, and the adventurers must journey to that plane, find the object containing your psyche and recover it, and then break the object to release your psyche. Once the prison object is broken, you are no longer unconscious.

name: Gloves of Dimensional Repulsion
description: Strange, eldritch glyphs swirl on these fine brocade coverings.

name: Gloves of Eldritch Admixture
description: You funnel the energy granted by your pact through these gloves, amplifying your power.
requirement:: Warlock

name: Gloves of Grace
description: While wearing these gloves, you help a companion recover quickly with but a touch.

name: Gloves of Ice
description: Encrusted with elemental ice, these gloves don't freeze your hands while worn.

name: Gloves of Missile Avoidance
description: These black leather gloves are limned with an aura of force that shatters or deflects projectiles aimed at you.

name: Gloves of Missile Deflection
description: Made of muslin covered with small shield-shaped buttons, these gloves help turn away projectiles.

name: Gloves of Piercing
description: These enchanted gloves can be activated to ignore an opponent's resistances for a short time.

name: Gloves of Recovery
description: When you fumble in combat, these gloves allow you to recover and strike again.

name: Gloves of Storing
description: Though these ornate chamois gloves fit snugly, your fingertips always seem just short of touching something within them.

name: Gloves of Transference
description: You can bestow powers upon others with these gossamer gloves.

name: The Deck of Many ThingsShelter of FateMark of the StarVision of the Vizier
description: This ornate deck of 22 cards is a tool of the forces of chaos and anarchy. It frequently appears when the world has grown too calm, or when someone has grown too powerful, sowing chaos wherever it lands.
quest_xp:: The characters must find the location of your imprisonment. The prison is deep beneath the earth (possibly within a dungeon, or in a drow citadel in the Underdark). The characters must journey to that location, find your imprisoned body, and use the Remove Affliction ritual to free you from the prison.               16,000 XP

info.major_quest: recovering the prison: The characters must find the object in which your psyche is imprisoned. The prison is on another plane, and the characters must journey to that plane, find the object containing your psyche and recover it, and then break the object to release your psyche. Once the prison object is broken, you are no longer unconscious.

name: Gloves of Venom
description: Constructed of lightweight spidersilk, these gloves fit like a second skin.

name: Gloves of the Bounty Hunter
description: These hide garments are weighted along the knuckles.

name: Gloves of the Healer
description: Your healing is enhanced by this elegant handwear.

name: Gloves of the Wandering Star
description: The magic of these supple gloves sends forth a burst of starlight to blind your foes.

name: Glowstone
description: This fist-sized stone glows faintly and can be used to create a bright burst of radiant light that harms undead creatures.

name: Goblin Stompers
description: These cured hide boots shift you safely away from an inaccurate attacker.

name: Goggles of Aura Sight
description: These goggles aid in diagnosis and healing.

name: Goggles of Night
description: This eyewear provides you with darkvision.

name: Goggles of the Bone Collector
description: The bones of various creatures are woven into this eyewear.

name: The Deluvian Hourglass
description: This roughly shaped hourglass is festooned with jewels that glow with inner elemental light. Its metal parts are dull silver, but they shift as if they were mercury. Inside the hourglass is a small mound of black sand.

name: Goggles of the Hawk
description: These goggles greatly extend your vision.

name: Golden Crown of Battle Command
description: When you direct an ally's attack, the power of this simple circlet of beaten gold helps guide his hand.

name: Golden LionGolden Lion
description: : When you activate a figurine, the conjured creature appears in a space adjacent to you, provided the space is large enough to contain the creature without squeezing. The creature obeys only you, responding to commands spoken in any language. The creature remains for up to 8 hours or until you use a minor action to dismiss it. The conjured creature acts on the same initiative count as you. Every action it takes costs you a minor action (which you use to issue commands), and a conjured creature cannot exceed its normal allotment of actions (a standard, a move, and a minor action) during its turn. If you spend no minor actions on your turn to command the creature, it remains where it is without taking any actions on its turn.          A conjured creature has hit points, defenses, and attacks as indicated in its statistics block. It has no healing surges and cannot be healed, though it can still benefit from temporary hit points. When reduced to 0 hit points or fewer, the conjured creature disappears and cannot be conjured again until after you’ve taken an extended rest. Conjured creatures lack basic attacks and therefore cannot make opportunity attacks.          Mount: If the conjured creature has the mount keyword, you can ride the creature and are considered to have the Mounted Combat feat while mounted on it. While mounted, you can command the creature using free actions, though the mount is still limited to its normal allotment of actions. You can choose to be mounted on the creature when it appears.

name: Golden Ring of Teros
description: The magic of this golden ring protects your physical perfection from harm.

name: Golden Spade
description: This magic shovel instantly clears away a section of earth, ice, or sand to create a deep trench.

name: Goliath's Belt
description: This hide belt makes it easier for you to push people around.

name: Goodnight Tincture
description: This odorless, tasteless elixir can incapacitate a foe without harming it.

name: Gorget of Reciprocity
description: Runic symbols meaning “an eye for an eye” adorn this decorative platinum neck armor.

name: Gorgonblood Mortar
description: Integrating this special mortar into your wall grants it a metaphysical denseness.

name: Gorilla Gloves
description: You possess the might to hoist opponents above your head and hurl them out of your way.

name: Seed of Winter
description: This outsized, pearlescent acorn is one of the fabled artifacts of the Winter Court of the Feywild. It is a potent reminder of the power the fey can hold over the environment.
critical:: +2d6 cold damage, or +2d10 cold damage against creatures with the fire keyword
special:: Whenever you would be slowed, you are immobilized instead.

name: Goring Weapon
description: Scored and scratched as it is, the weapon remains serviceable.

name: Gossamer Tome
description: This tome is covered in webs infested by myriad tiny spiders that swarm over your hands but never bite.

name: Grace Ring of Lightning
description: The gold and silver weave of this ring is cut with sparkling channels. Lightning arcs from it to protect you when you're incapacitated.

name: Grace Ring of Prowess
description: The magic within this ring is visible as a gold and silver spiral, swirling around your hand until it's released.

name: Grace Ring of Salvation
description: When hope has fled, this ring's pulsing blue sapphire might recapture it.

name: Grace Ward Ring
description: This understated gold and silver weave holds a sliver of ivory carved into a ram's head.

name: Graefling
description: Inky black tendrils spill from the blade, which promises an agonizing end for those who feel its bite.

name: Grasping Weapon
description: This malleable weapon not only strikes at enemies but also grasps and holds them in place.

name: Arrow of Fate
description: An ancient shard of the fallen dragon god Io's physical form, the Arrow of Fate is a powerful weapon against the primordials and their servants. As a fragment of a greater god, the artifact is equally effective against the divine, for what better to harm a god with than a piece of another? The Arrow, created from the essence of the one that gave rise to them, also holds great power over the children of Io.
critical:: +6d8 damage, or +6d12 damage against dragons and creatures with the elemental or immortal origin
special:: Whenever you move away from an enemy without ending closer to another or making an attack that round, the Arrow makes the following attack against you as an immediate interrupt: Constitution +6 vs. Will; the target is slowed until the start of its next turn.

name: Grayflower Perfume
description: You spray the perfume into the air and for a moment, the blind creature can't locate you.

name: Great Cat Armor
description: In this sleek suit of hide armor, you bound around the battlefield like a powerful feline.

name: Great Hero's Gauntlets
description: These heavy steel gauntlets reward great risk and heroism.

name: Great Hunger Weapon
description: This weapon's normal low keening tones build into a great howl when it engages in battle.

name: Greater Ring of Invisibility
description: This onyx band makes it easier for you to conceal your comings and goings.

name: Greatreach Gauntlets
description: These gauntlets are fitted with extendable steel rods that are braced to your forearms.

name: Greatsword of Impiltur
description: This greatsword is forged of black iron engraved with dead and wailing demons. Its dark pommel and guard look like a balor  impaled on the sword's blade. Dark energy plays like lightning over the weapon.

name: Greatwing Tattoo
description: A wing, a feather, or any winged creature—dragons or couatls are popular—will do for this tattoo.

name: Greaves of Fortunate Falling
description: These plain gray bands guide your landing when you topple.

name: Greaves of Maldeen
description: Wolf fur rings this enchanted leg armor, which allows you to hunt down evil foes with ease.

name: Faarlung's Algorithm
description: Created by the archwizard Faarlung, the Algorithm consists of an ever-shifting, mathematically derived arcane formula which contains the power to unravel the fabric of reality. It appears as a metal orb covered with nearly invisible sliding mechanisms and plates. The surface of the orb is inscribed with runes and arcane geometric diagrams that glow as the Algorithm is solved.
special:: Once per encounter when you make an attack roll, skill check, or ability check, the Algorithm can warp your subconscious understanding of reality and cause an action to fail, subtracting 1d10 from the triggering roll.

name: Green Orb of Dragonkind
description: This heavy globe of green glass contains a swirling cloud of gas. It has the power to control green dragons.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d10 damage per plus against green dragons.

name: Green Thumbs
description: These bright green, wooden thimbles fit snugly over naked skin or mundane hand coverings.

name: Greenbane
description: This stick of fast-burning incense creates a haze of smoke that keeps plant creatures from closing on the user.

name: Greenblood Oil
description: This thick, green oil has the consistency of blood and makes enemies more susceptible to grievous injuries.

name: Greenstone Amulet
description: Extracted from burning realms within the Nine Hells, greenstone is valued by archdevils for its bestowed resistance to psychic effects and scrying.

name: Grimlock Helm
description: An opaque visor lowers to cover your eyes, yet this helm allows you to sense your surroundings regardless.

name: Guardian Shield
description: Activate the power of this shield to defend an ally from attack.

name: Guardian's Armor
description: This heavy armor protects you well enough, but it achieves its full potential only when used in the defense of another.
augment_1:: The bonus increases to 2 + the armor's enhancement bonus.

name: Guardian's Brand
description: This weapon burns white with hatred when it's near a warden's marked enemy.
critical:: +1d6 fire damage per plus, or +1d10 fire damage per plus while you’re in a guardian form

name: Dreamheart
description: This oblong chunk of stone usually appears unimpressive to the eye. But on the plane of the mind, the Dreamheart is a scintillating font of color, dreams, and endless possibilities. It is a beacon of power and a literal promise of incredible knowledge and dominance to any willing to listen. When the relic's most potent power is channeled, a seam along the stone splits and an eye blinks open. Through it, the Eldest aboleth looks out.

name: Guardian's Call
description: Decorated with the sigils of the wind and the oak, this weapon increases your defenses while you're in your guardian form.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d10 damage per plus while you’re in a guardian form

name: Guardian's Cape
description: This dark blue cape can be activated to allow you to teleport and switch places with an ally.

name: Guardian's Circlets
description: The bodyguards of House Deneith relish these paired necklaces to keep their clients safer from harm.

name: Guardian's Collar
description: The three small gemstones set in this collar resemble eyes and help your companion perceive its surroundings.

name: Guarding Weapon
description: This weapon, covered with imagery of shields, lets you make enemies pay dearly when they ignore you and attack your friends.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d12 damage per plus with opportunity attacks
augment_4:: The enemy is stunned until the end of your next turn, instead of dazed.

name: GuenhwyvarGuenhwyvar
description: This onyx figurine is a ferocious panther.

name: Guildmaster's Gloves
description: These stylish black gloves greatly improve your thievery skills.

name: Gutting Weapon
description: This blade slides easily past armor and through the thickest hide. Pulling it out is not so easy—on the target.

name: Haggaron's Ring of Control
description: This beautiful fey-styled ring sharpens your ability to soothe others and grants you control of their minds in combat.

name: Halo of Fallen Stars
description: Tiny motes of sparkling light circle around your head like orbiting stars, enhancing your healing, nature, and religion skills.

info.Description: Forgemail armor is made with superior metallurgy and a chain-making technique mastered by dwarves.

name: Heartwood Spear
description: This wood-shafted spear has wicked, pointed heads at both ends.
enhancement:: +4 to attack rolls and damage rolls

name: Hamanu's Terrible Roar
description: When you speak with the voice of the King of the World, all creatures around you tremble.

name: Hammer Shield
description: The hammer sigil emblazoned on this steel shield strengthens the arm that wields a hammer in battle.

name: Hammer of Victory
description: This hammer's striking head is carved with an intricate scene depicting dwarven warriors cleaving through a goblin horde.

name: Hands of Hadar
description: Fire opals speckle these black gloves, which focus the power of your Warlock's Curse.

name: Handy Haversack
description: This ordinary-looking backpack is surprisingly light.

name: Harmonic Songblade
description: As well as channeling your bard spells, this blade gives off music that swirls away to encircle and empower one of your allies.

name: Harmonious Harp
description: The melodious tones of this harp fortify your senses and your mind.

name: Harmony Blade
description: Though you wield it as your primary weapon, this blade lends its power to your off-hand attacks.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, and you can make a melee basic attack with your off-hand weapon.

name: Harp of Deeper Slumber
description: A single tone from this small harp leaves creatures briefly inattentive.

name: Harper Pin
description: This pin, depicting a crescent moon and a harp, bears the blessing of three goddesses.
requirement:: You must have the harper agent theme.

name: Orb of Kalid-Ma
description: This obsidian sphere's reflective surface sometimes shows scenes of draconic transformations or images of the current location of others of its kind.
enhancement:: +4 to attack rolls and damage rolls

name: Harsh Songblade
description: As this blade channels your bardic magic, the blade unleashes a wail that leaves your foes senseless.

name: Harvester's Staff
description: This bone staff converts the life energy of your comrades into psionic energy.

name: Hat of Disguise
description: This chapeau appears as you wish, changing you and your equipment as it transforms.

name: Haunted Armor
description: At first glance, this looks like a standard suit of armor. Still, you sense a strange, disquieting presence about it.

name: Haunting Presence Ki Focus
description: By calling on the magic in your gossamer focus, you become ghostlike—ephemeral and impossible to pin down.

name: Hawk's Talon Ki Focus
description: This small, blunt dagger is made of a soft, malleable metal. It shivers and flutters in your grasp, like a captive bird. When you practice with it, you unlock the secret of the swooping hawk's tactics.

name: Hawthorn Wand
description: This pale wand harnesses fate and makes it your servant.

name: Head-Taker's Belt
description: This plain leather belt is set with skull-shaped steel studs, with a new one appearing each time you slay a foe.

name: Headband of Insight
description: This unremarkable-looking headband allows you to see through another's lies.

name: Headband of Intellect
description: This ornamental silk cord strengthens your mental retention, recall, and powers.

name: NightbringerNightbringer
description: Each of the lesser courtiers of Orcus, the first exarchs he forged in his great battles against the gods, received one mighty artifact. The Lord of Zombies received Nightbringer, a weapon supposedly forged from a single drop of blood shed by the Chained God when he cut himself on the mote of absolute evil that formed the Abyss.
vicious_rebuke: (immediate reaction, when hit by a melee attack, at-will)

name: Headband of Perception
description: This chiffon headwrap is stitched with eye-shaped patterns, which heighten your senses.

name: Headband of Psychic Attack
description: This leather headband has crystal shards stitched into it.

name: Healer's Armor
description: This sturdy armor enhances your ability to heal your allies.

name: Healer's Brooch
description: This innocuous adornment boosts your healing powers.

name: Healer's Sash
description: This magic sash resists staining by blood or gore—a testament to its latent restorative power.

name: Healer's Shield
description: This shield shores healing powers as well as blocks enemy blows.

name: Healing Weapon
description: This bow is strung with what looks like healer's stitch thread, and the wielder can send a arrow of glowing white energy at an ally to heal him or her.

name: Heart-Touch Bracelets
description: These elegant gold bracelets feel warm to the touch. As soon as you don one, you feel the vacancy of the other until it too is worn and your bracelet beats with the pulse of another heart.

name: Heartblood of Festergrim
description: Bathing in the blood of the slayer of King Algus and ravager of the forest of Lorem might not make you immune to fire, but it helps.

name: Heartening Armor
description: Your spirits never fail while you wear this armor.

name: Head of Vyrellis
description: This orb of darkest obsidian easily fits in the palm of your hand. As you stare into its inky depths, the severed head of an eladrin princess floats into view and you hear her sing-song voice, "I am Vyrellis, and I offer my assistance to whoever carries this orb."
special:: You take a -2 penalty to Will defense.

name: Heartflow
description: The target's eyes glaze as a smile spreads across his face.

name: Hearth of Boldrei
description: Brandishing this orange and gray octogram, you shelter your ally from harm by scattering his enemies.
requirement:: You must worship boldrei or the sovereign host to use this holy symbol.

name: Hedge Wizard's Gloves
description: With a wave of these patched gloves, you can perform magic tricks.

name: Hellfire Staff
description: This imposing staff of flame and bone burns the flesh and soul of your enemies.
critical:: Regain an encounter power with the fire or fear keyword that you have expended in this encounter.

name: Hellfire Wand
description: Your fires burn with the fury of the Nine Hells when wielding this wand.

name: Hellrod
description: This rod draws upon infernal power, granting you the benefits of a warlock trained in manipulating such forces.

name: Hellthorn Weapon
description: The weapon is forged of red iron, and it appears to radiate a palpable aura of devilish glee.
weapon:: Flail, heavy blade, spear or  staff
critical:: +1d6 fire damage per plus, and ongoing 10 fire damage (save ends)          Level 25 or 30: Ongoing 20 fire damage (save ends)

name: Helm of Able Defense
description: Lifelike crystal eyes in the back of this helmet focus your will and bolster your defenses.

name: Helm of Battle
description: This simple helmet enhances the initiative of you and your allies.

name: Helm of Exemplary Defense
description: The power of this helm grants you and your allies an advantage against foes who leave themselves open.

name: Skull of Sartine
description: A relic left behind by Sartine when she discarded her mortal shell to enter the Shadowfell in search of the Raven Queen, the artifact is a burned, black skull that constantly emits dark smoke. It is warm to the touch.
special:: You take a -5 penalty to attack rolls and damage rolls against creatures other than demons or those that serve Orcus. This applies whether or not you are using or even holding the Skull.

name: Helm of Ghostly Defense
description: This misty helmet allows you to resist some necrotic damage and can be activated to turn you insubstantial for a short time.

name: Helm of Heroes
description: This ornate helmet makes you and your allies less susceptible to fear effects and can be activated to improve an ally's attack.

name: Helm of Hidden Horrors
description: This leather helm is a bane to wielders of illusions and charms.

name: Helm of Opportunity
description: This simple bronze helm allows you to strike more accurately at those who let down their guard.

name: Helm of Swift Punishment
description: Your foes soon learn the error of ignoring the threat you pose when you wear this helmet.

name: Helm of Vigilant Awareness
description: The gems mounted above the ears and eyeholes of this steel helmet flash red when a deafening noise or blinding light appears.

name: Helm of Vision Unclouded
description: A band of platinum encircles this helmet, sharpening your senses and showing you things unseen.

name: Helm of the Eagle
description: This helm, carved to resemble an eagle, enhances your perception and can be activated to improve a ranged attack.

name: Helm of the Flamewarped
description: The one who wears this slightly charred copper helm can strike a devastating blow, but at a cost.

name: Helm of the Mental Juggernaut
description: A demon mask fronts this heavy helmet, its grinning visage protecting you when enemies attempt to hinder you in combat.
augment_1:: You gain a +2 power bonus to the saving throw.

name: Eye of the Old Gods
description: This mote of celestial fire races around its wearer's head. It is a remembered dream of an elder, deceased deity.
special:: You take a -5 penalty to attack rolls and damage rolls against any creatures other than elementals or primordials.

name: Helm of the Stubborn Mind
description: This helm forifies you against enchanters.

name: Herbal Poultice
description: This pack of specially prepared medicinal herbs increases one's natural recuperative ability.

name: Hero's Armor
description: This shirt of glimmering chainmail fortifies those who take bold action in battle.

name: Hero's Gauntlets
description: When you push past your limits, the magic of these gauntlets backs up the fury of your attack.

name: Hestavar Dueling Blade
description: Made with the mithral-infused shimmering steel favored by .the greatest of Hestavar sword smiths, this weapon allows its wielder to maneuver like the exalted duelists of the Bright City.

name: Hexer's Rod
description: Crafted in ancient times by goblin shamans, this rod channels their tricky, underhanded magic.

name: Hidden Weapon
description: This slender weapon cunningly adopts the characteristics of your garb when stowed.

name: Hideous Weapon
description: The only thing that looks worse than this ugly weapon is your enemy when you're done with it.

name: Holy Adversary's Armor
description: When you swear an oath against your prey, divine grace permeates this armor, protecting you against that creature's attacks.

name: Holy Avenger
description: The most prized weapon of any paladin.
critical:: +1d6 radiant damage per plus, and you can spend a healing surge
special:: A holy avenger can be used as a holy symbol. It adds its enhancement bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls and the extra damage granted by its property (if applicable) when used in this manner. You do not gain your weapon proficiency bonus to an attack roll when using a holy avenger as an implement.

name: Audaviator
description: Ghostly rings hover and shimmer around the length of this crystalline staff. Through these rings, scenes of other worlds are visible.
special:: You take a -5 penalty to attack rolls and damage rolls against creatures other than fey.

name: Holy Gauntlets
description: Highly polished and marked with holy sigils, these gauntlets help to bring cleansing light to the darkness.

name: Holy Healer's Weapon
description: Healers who wield this weapon relish combat and enjoy healing their allies while attacking their enemies.

name: Holy Radiance Armor
description: This gleaming chainmail glows with the radiance of the sun.

name: Holy Shrine
description: Minor angels attend this shrine, allowing you to refocus your divine power for other purposes.

name: Holy Water
description: Undead and demons react poorly to the touch of this liquid.

name: Homing Weapon
description: A clockwork mechanism fitted with lenses, dials, and levers helps your aim.

name: Hood of the Wolf
description: Fashioned from the head of a great gray wolf, this helm frames the wearer's face in the open maw of the beast, and it crowns them with its red eyes.

name: Horn Totem
description: The base of this straight, black horn is wrapped in leather, giving the object the semblance of a crude dagger. Holding the totem makes you feel more capable of facing even formidably sized foes.

name: Horn Tusk Armor
description: Short tusks protrude from this armor's shoulder guards. The armor gives you the resilience of a boar, allowing you to attack even as a foe drops you.

name: The Ashen CrownKarruuk's CircletAshurta's BladeZaarani's SolitaireLurtaan's CordMurkoorak's Orb
description: A gold and mithral diadem with a purple-black byeshk spike, the Ashen Crown is a powerful relic of two races.
level: Heroic Level           Heroic Level           Heroic Level           Heroic Level           Heroic Level           Heroic Level
enhancement:: +2 to attack rolls and damage rolls
critical:: +2d6 damage, or +2d10 damage if you have combat advantage
special:: The powers of the Crown fail to function.

name: Horn of Baldagyr
description: This horn is crafted from the scales of Baldagyr, an astral dragon sworn to watch over the resting place of a mighty primordial until the end of time.

name: Horn of Blasting
description: This adamantine-trimmed hunting horn unleashes a powerful blast of thunder when blown.

name: Horn of Dismissal
description: The sound of this black-studded bronze horn dispels conjurations.

name: Horn of GeryonHorned Beast
description: Carved from the horn of some monstrous beast and banded in iron, this great instrument requires both hands to lift—but conjures a massive ally.

name: Horn of Summons
description: This steel battle horn alerts even those allies you cannot see.

name: Horn of Undead Enmity
description: The haunting sound of this bone horn forces undead to turn against their own allies.

name: Horned Helm
description: This horned helmet increases the damage you deal when making a charge attack.

name: Horns of Balinor
description: These horns fashioned from blackened bone help focus attention against your prey. Through the blessing of Balinor, its death will be swift and merciful.
critical:: +1d8 damage per plus, or +1d12 damage per plus against a creature marked by you or an ally
requirement:: You must worship balinor or the sovereign host to use this holy symbol.

name: Horreb Ritual Cube
description: Arcane glyphs of unknown origin are etched upon the face of this intricate, mechanical puzzle cube.

name: Horseshoes of Speed
description: These thin steel horseshoes grant a mount increased speed.

name: Wand of Orcus
description: Orcus carries a heavy mace tipped with an enormous skull. Its haft is smooth obsidian studded with blood rubies. This weapon transforms those it slays into undead horrors.
special:: If you drop to 0 hit points or fewer and are not healed before the start of your next turn, you rise as a dread wraith under the Wand's command.

name: Howling Songbow
description: The projectiles you let fly with this weapon howl as they lance out at your foes.

name: Hrothmar's Gauntlets
description: These massive, black iron gauntlets are dotted with red metal studs. They create shock waves that hurl foes to the ground.

name: Hungry Spear
description: A roaring lion engraved on the head of this spear pins your foe in place while you close for the kill.

name: Hungry Spirits Totem
description: The appearance of this totem changes week by week, depending on which spirits are hungriest.

name: Hunter's Flint
description: A warm, bright fire quickly erupts from a single spark struck off this magical shard.

name: Hunter's Headband
description: This leather headband helps you forage for food underground and in the wilderness.

name: Hunting Beast Armor
description: This armor carries within it the spirit of a hunting beast. When you change into beast form, that spirit guides your movements.

name: Hunting Panther Ki Focus
description: These mummified eyeballs tucked inside a worn wooden box see through all your enemy's deceptions.

name: Hurricane Strike Ki Focus
description: As power swirls within this slender glass cylinder, your fast strikes knock your enemies back.

name: Hydra Armor
description: The scales of the mighty hydra are used to craft this armor.

name: Crown of Dust (First Fragment)
description: This relic is a fragment of a crown of gold, about a third of the whole. The piece is still wearable—barely. Visions of raging sandstorms warm the blood of those who wear the fragment.

name: Hypnotic Pendant
description: This pendant has the power to plant hypnotic suggestions in the minds of those around you.

name: Hypnotic Shield
description: The spiral pattern on this round shield mesmerizes unwary foes.

name: Icegloom Chart
description: This heavy slab of smoky ice is filled with a webwork of cracks and air bubbles that display a tiny world of caves.

name: Icingdeath
description: Limned in frost and diamond edged, this silver blade can slice through a steel door.
critical:: +1d6 cold damage per plus and ongoing 10 cold damage (save ends)

name: Icon of the Silver Flame
description: When you intone prayers to the Silver Flame, argent fire erupts from the flame-shaped icon around your neck.
critical:: +1d6 fire and radiant damage per plus
requirement:: You must worship the silver flame to use this holy symbol.

name: Illithid Robes
description: These robes are tight and sleek, with a crest behind the head. They partially protect you from harm if you can compel some poor fool to assist you.

name: Illusionist's Gloves
description: These shimmering gloves enhance your illusion spells and let you quickly alter an illusion that would otherwise be ineffective.

name: Immolating Armor
description: The steel components of this heavy armor are chased in red enamel, with tints of yellow and orange swirled throughout it.

name: Immovable Shaft
description: This 1-foot-long black metal rod can defy gravity, supporting weight and resisting manipulation.

info.Description: Spiritmail armor is made with techniques from the divine Dominions.

name: Book of Vile Darkness
description: A blasphemous tome whose pages are stained with unspeakable knowledge, this vile work reveals evil’s darkest secrets.
enhancement_bonus:: +3 to attack rolls and damage rolls
critical:: +3d6 damage, or +3d10 damage against non-evil creatures
attack:: Close burst 3 (creatures in the burst); your level + 5 vs. Will
hit:: If the target is non-evil, you can push it up to its speed, and it is dazed (save ends). If the target is evil, it is dominated until the end of your next turn.

name: Immunizing Armor
description: This sleek, white armor gives its wearer a sense of physical purity, as if she might resist even the deadliest poisons and diseases.

name: Immurement of Arcane Suspension
description: This chunk of earth feels as light as a feather.

name: Immurement of Baleful Gossamer
description: A tree surrounded by cobwebs is visible within this soft, clear sphere.

name: Immurement of Seething Scoria
description: You transplant a section of a great lava lake into the battlefield by shattering this hunk of obsidian.

name: Immurement of the Abandoned Throne
description: This marred bronze scepter has had the sigil of the kingdom it once represented scratched off its surface.

name: Immurement of the Blood Vine
description: When this branch from the holly tree that always bears new growth is snapped, it spawns what was once the heart of a forest.

name: Immurement of the Dragon Boneyard
description: A miniature boneyard, complete with a massive dragon skull in the center, is visible within this crystal sphere.

name: Immurement of the Jealous Keeper
description: The shell opens into a brackish-smelling cave filled with algae-slimed coins and sparking stalactites.

name: Immurement of the Mordant Hideaway
description: This hunk of stone contains a cavern interior dotted with small pools of bubbling acid that occasionally geyser.

name: Immurement of the Vengeful River
description: When you use this immurement, it spawns a roaring river that appears from an unknown source and runs off in all directions.

name: Xraunran Crown of Eyes
description: Once you are linked to this cabochon-adorned metal circlet, your mind can access the eyes and ears of any wearer and attempt to influence the wearer’s mind.

name: Impaler's Pick
description: This barbed weapon can leave a short-lived magical replica of itself in your enemy to keep it pinned down.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, and the target is restrained by a magical duplicate of this weapon (save ends).          Aftereffect: 20 damage.

name: Impaling Weapon
description: This weapon can fire clear through one creature's body and penetrate another creature behind it.

name: Impeding Ki Focus
description: This jade figurine serves as a convenient target dummy, allowing you to focus your ki on making the most of a foe's vulnerabilities.

name: Impenetrable Barding
description: Through this barding, your heroism imparts a protective aura upon your mount that protects it.

name: Imperial Oration
description: Being well practiced in the Nerathi art of debate, you emphasize subtle questioning and reason to arrive at truth.

name: Imposter's Armor
description: In the blink of an eye, this metal armor can fade into rags or robes, providing the perfect disguise for any situation.

name: Incisive Dagger
description: You cut through space as easily as you cut through flesh.

name: Indomitable Resolve Vestments
description: These embroidered vestments channel your resolve and imbue you with willpower and determination.

name: Inertial Weapon
description: When you force your foe to move against its will, the solidified energy sheathing this weapon expends itself with an echoing snap, sending other enemies stumbling away.
augment_2:: (Force): Your attack deals 1d10 extra force damage.

name: Inescapable Weapon
description: This weapon grows increasingly eager to strike those you have trouble hitting.

name: Justice’s Edge
description: This longsword, decorated with red rubies and a platinum pommel, hums with the power of the Platinum Dragon.

info.enhancement_bonus:: Justice’s Edge is a +5 holy avenger.

name: Inevitable Bow
description: Arrows loosed from this bow have a way of finding their targets.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d10 damage per plus with basic attacks

name: Infectious Flame Weapon
description: Shaped in the form of flickering flames, this devilish weapon causes fire to leap from foe to foe.

name: Inferno Oil
description: Your weapon leaves behind a faint trace of oil, but it's enough to set your enemy ablaze when it's exposed to open flame.

name: Infighting Blade
description: The closer your foes press, the more deadly this quick blade becomes.

name: Ingot Liberatis
description: An entwining runic pattern covers this heavy metal bar, which aids in freeing your allies from adverse effects.

name: Inner Warmth Armor
description: Created from the hide of elemental beasts, this armor exudes an aura of comforting warmth.

name: Inquisitives Goggles
description: These intricate goggles allow unparalleled observation.

name: Inquisitor's Helm
description: Your mind can access the secrets of another while you wear this cuir-bouilli skullcap.

name: Insanity Mist
description: This deep purple liquid swirls with milky colors that sometimes seem to resolve into disturbing images.

name: Insight of the Vault
description: The Vault teaches members to watch for even the slightest weakness in any defense and to make the best of it.

name: Crown of Whispers
description: The lost crown of the mad king Daskinor of Eldaarich is a simple metal circlet that wraps tightly around the brow of its wearer.

name: Inspiring Weapon
description: Leaders use this weapon to rally allies around them for a powerful attack.

name: Instant Campsite
description: This tightly packed satchel expands into a complete campsite that can automatically pack up again.

name: Instant Portal
description: Shattering this glass marble against a hard surface releases the short-lived portal within.

name: Intensifying Weapon
description: This weapon blazes with inner power that enhances your ongoing effects.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d10 damage per plus on attacks that deal ongoing damage

name: Invigorating Coins
description: Enchanted heaps of gold and silver coins form a deep, comfortable nest to reinvigorate the most ancient dragon.

name: Invulnerable Case
description: This smooth metal case protects its contents from all but themost devastating damage.

name: Ioun Orb
description: A favorite implement of the orb mages of the Swan Tower, this crystal orb is filled with the potent purple haze of the Meznathin Expanse, and allows the caster to extend her will and arcane power to the orb's location.

name: Ioun Stone of Adaptation
description: This clear crystal floats in the air above your head, providing you with sustenance and durability against certain adverse effects.

name: Ioun Stone of Divine Knowledge
description: This amber sphere with a red gem in its center slowly orbits your head, leaving a trail of twinkling golden lights.

name: Ioun Stone of Perfect Language
description: This white and pink rhombic prism makes you more persuasive and gives you a knack for language.

name: Staff of Fraz-Urb'luu
description: This broken staff fragment is clearly part of a larger whole, yet its well-worn sheen hints at guarded power.
arcana_dc 23:: The Staff of Fraz-Urb'luu was lost during the sack of Hollow's Heart after the demon prince was imprisoned in the natural world. Unable to destroy it, his enemies sundered it into pieces. Even individually, however, the fragments contain their creator's malicious love of deception and potent summoning ability.
arcana_dc 31:: A great deal of Fraz-Urb'luu's personal power is contained within the staff, but only when it is whole. Reassembling the staff could enable a wielder to usurp control of the 176th layer of the Abyss or potentially destroy the demon prince forever.
effect:: You become invisible until you hit or miss with an attack, or until the end of your next turn.
trigger:: You hit a target with a charm power using this item.

name: Ioun Stone of Regeneration
description: This tiny red ovoid orbits your head.

name: Ioun Stone of Steadfastness
description: This pale aquamarine hovering prism offers a constant reminder of your allies' support and loyalty.

name: Ioun Stone of Sustenance
description: This iridescent spindle lessens your need for rest and removes your body’s base needs for air and nourishment.

name: Ioun Stone of True Sight
description: This dark blue rhomboid stone floats lightly in the air, granting you darkvision and greatly enhanced insight and perception.

name: Ioun's Flame
description: A flickering violet flame darts about your head, granting you knowledge and flaring to life at your command.

name: Ioun's Parchment
description: This thin sheet of bronze, the size of a roll of parchment, is embossed with Ioun's symbol in one corner.

name: Ioun's Revelation
description: Ioun rewards study and the relentless pursuit of knowledge. Supporters who earn her favor gain the ability to master any task, no matter how daunting.

name: Ioun-Blessed Symbol
description: This symbol, blessed with Ioun's love of knowledge, is a slender length of ivory with only a suggestion of her icon.

name: Iron Armbands of Power
description: These plate armbands enhance the damage you dole out.

name: Iron Bear Totem
description: This black iron rod, bound with bear fur, empowers your spirit companion to bolster nearby allies.

name: Chromodactylic Loom
description: The loom towers over you, its threads glimmering with magic potential. Taking up the shuttle, you feel the forces of creation guide your hand.
effect:: You open an extradimensional rift that allows creatures to teleport to an unoccupied space within 10 squares of a tapestry woven on the loom. The rift remains open for 1 minute or until you take a minor action to dismiss it.

name: Iron Body Ki Focus
description: This set of weights consists of rune-scribed chunks of lead laced together with leather straps. When tied to your feet and hands, you can perform the exercises needed to master the iron body technique.

name: Iron Ring of the Dwarf Lords
description: This solid iron ring bears the geometric patterns of the dwarf lords.

name: Iron Wand
description: This thick pry bar does double duty as a weapon and an implement.

name: Iron of Spite
description: A spiked metal sphere, slightly smaller than your fist, hovers near your shoulder and gives off black sparks. It greatly enhances your arcana and intimidate skills.

name: Ironclad Armor
description: When your enemy attacks, this armor forms hardened ridges and spikes that damage your foe.

name: Ironheart Tattoo
description: Ironheart tattoos represent in symbol or image how the bearer can't be conquered.

name: Ironscar Rod
description: This heavy iron rod, shaped like two twisting serpents, scours enemies with acid.

name: Ironskin Belt
description: The first of these belts of chain links was forged by a dwarf armorsmith enslaved by fire giants. It can be activated to provide protection against weapon attacks.

name: Ironskin Soulfang
description: Once you stab this fang into your flesh, your skin turns gray and iron hard.

name: Ironwood Hound
description: This wooden statuette depicts a hunting hound dashing toward its prey.

info.Description: This kit includes a backpack, a bedroll, flint and steel, a belt pouch, two sunrods, ten days’ worth of trail rations, 50 feet of hempen rope, and a waterskin.

name: Irrefutable Armor
description: A simple suit of metal plates, this armor asserts your will as it protects your flesh.

name: Ivory Goat of TravailIvory Goat of Travail
description: : When you activate a figurine, the conjured creature appears in a space adjacent to you, provided the space is large enough to contain the creature without squeezing. The creature obeys only you, responding to commands spoken in any language. The creature remains for up to 8 hours or until you use a minor action to dismiss it. The conjured creature acts on the same initiative count as you. Every action it takes costs you a minor action (which you use to issue commands), and a conjured creature cannot exceed its normal allotment of actions (a standard, a move, and a minor action) during its turn. If you spend no minor actions on your turn to command the creature, it remains where it is without taking any actions on its turn.          A conjured creature has hit points, defenses, and attacks as indicated in its statistics block. It has no healing surges and cannot be healed, though it can still benefit from temporary hit points. When reduced to 0 hit points or fewer, the conjured creature disappears and cannot be conjured again until after you’ve taken an extended rest. Conjured creatures lack basic attacks and therefore cannot make opportunity attacks.          Mount: If the conjured creature has the mount keyword, you can ride the creature and are considered to have the Mounted Combat feat while mounted on it. While mounted, you can command the creature using free actions, though the mount is still limited to its normal allotment of actions. You can choose to be mounted on the creature when it appears.

name: Jade Horse
description: This small statuette of a horse summons a full-sized, obedient mount at your command.

name: Jade MacetailJade Macetail Behemeth
description: : When you activate a figurine, the conjured creature appears in a space adjacent to you, provided the space is large enough to contain the creature without squeezing. The creature obeys only you, responding to commands spoken in any language. The creature remains for up to 8 hours or until you use a minor action to dismiss it. The conjured creature acts on the same initiative count as you. Every action it takes costs you a minor action (which you use to issue commands), and a conjured creature cannot exceed its normal allotment of actions (a standard, a move, and a minor action) during its turn. If you spend no minor actions on your turn to command the creature, it remains where it is without taking any actions on its turn.          A conjured creature has hit points, defenses, and attacks as indicated in its statistics block. It has no healing surges and cannot be healed, though it can still benefit from temporary hit points. When reduced to 0 hit points or fewer, the conjured creature disappears and cannot be conjured again until after you’ve taken an extended rest. Conjured creatures lack basic attacks and therefore cannot make opportunity attacks.          Mount: If the conjured creature has the mount keyword, you can ride the creature and are considered to have the Mounted Combat feat while mounted on it. While mounted, you can command the creature using free actions, though the mount is still limited to its normal allotment of actions. You can choose to be mounted on the creature when it appears.

name: Jade Sea SnakeJade Sea Snake
description: This coiled serpent of jade can become a mount for several riders and carry them on land and sea.

name: Jagged Weapon
description: This weapon is pitted, scarred, and unadorned, but it deals grievous wounds.
weapon:: Axe, heavy blade or  light blade
critical:: Ongoing 10 damage (save ends)          Level 22 and 27: Ongoing 20 damage (save ends)

name: Jar of Steam
description: This clay jar is warm to the touch. When opened, it creates a cloud of steam that fills the area around it.

name: Jarlaxle's Eye Patch
description: This black felt eye patch fits over either eye and does not hinder your vision.

name: Jarlaxle's Rapid Throw
description: Jarlaxle always has a trick up his magic sleeves, including daggers aplenty.

name: Jarring Weapon
description: This weapon smashes through your enemy's defenses, leaving them rattled from the severe blow of the attack.

name: Jester Shoes
description: These colorful, pointed shoes help you stand out—but not stand up—in a crowd.

name: Jolt Flask
description: When it bursts, this flask creates a concussive wave that dazes your enemies.

name: Jolting Guard Weapon
description: You deflect the enemy's attack with a deft parry so forceful that it numbs the foe.

name: Jousting Shield
description: This grooved and angled shield acts as a bulwark against all attempts to alter a charger's course.

name: Joyous Armor
description: Silver filigree on this armor shines when you heal yourself, renewing your allies' vigor.
augment_1:: The number of temporary hit points equals three times the armor's enhancement bonus.

name: Kalak's Echo
description: Kalak's sway was not extinguished with his death in free Tyr. Strength can be grasped by those who serve his memory.

name: Kamesti Crossbow
description: This exceptionally crafted crossbow can target even the farthest foes.

name: Karrak-dur, the Overmind (Circlet of Mental Onslaught)
description: Your mental attacks strike more true while you wear this slender circlet.          A thundering, haughty voice fills your head as you approach this item, calling itself Karrak-dur, the Overmind.

name: Karruuk's Circlet
description: This mithral and gold headband enhances your knowledge and forges an unseen link between the scattered fragments of the Ashen Crown.

name: Kartan's Void Ring
description: The shifting form of this black ring allows you to draw off your enemies' vigor when one of their nearby allies drops.

info.Description: Using a nonmagical implement confers no benefit. You can purchase a magic implement to gain an enhancement bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with your arcane powers.

name: Keen Bite Wand
description: Artifices you create with this wand have a vicious bite.

name: Keen Oil
description: The sword sweeps through your enemy, cutting through its armor and flesh in one deadly arc.

name: Keeper's Shield
description: This black iron shield with gilt edges allows your allies to make long-range attacks with less risk.

name: Keicha's Amulet
description: The gemstone scales of this amulet grant you resistance against your enemies' harshest attacks.

name: Kemstone Armor
description: Fashioned with the strong but light kemras stone found in various dominions of the Astral Sea, this armor stabilizes its wearer's essence.

name: Keoghtom's Ointment
description: This tiny jar magically creates a dollop of potent healing unguent each day.

name: Khazid'hea
description: This thin, sharp longsword bears a stylized unicorn pommel of the goddess Mielikki.
critical:: +1d12 damage per plus, and ongoing 10 damage (save ends)

name: Khyber Shard of Death's Embrace
description: When you affix this sinister deep blue dragon shard, your weapon blackens and exudes a deathly aura.

name: Khyber Shard of Life Drinking
description: This cerulean dragon shard drinks deep the blood you draw with your weapon.

name: Khyber Shard of the Fiery Depth
description: This cobalt dragon shard has a molten core and is hot to the touch.

name: Ki Weapon
description: This weapon seems to become one with your body, allowing you to deal more damage when you strike with multiple blows.

name: Kinetic Oil
description: The thick oil sticks to your weapon, marring its surface with rainbow swirls.

name: Kingslayer's Curse - Face Me, Cowards
description: Your name and reputation are feared wherever you go. You embrace this reputation, embody it, and make use of the terror it inspires.

name: Kingslayer's Curse - Fearsome Reputation
description: Your name and reputation are feared wherever you go. You embrace this reputation, embody it, and make use of the terror it inspires.

name: Kingslayer's Curse - God Hunter
description: Your name and reputation are feared wherever you go. You embrace this reputation, embody it, and make use of the terror it inspires.

name: Kingslayer's Curse - Outlaw's Fortitude
description: Your name and reputation are feared wherever you go. You embrace this reputation, embody it, and make use of the terror it inspires.

name: Kingslayer's Curse - Rage of the Persecuted
description: Your name and reputation are feared wherever you go. You embrace this reputation, embody it, and make use of the terror it inspires.

name: Kingslayer's Curse - Unconquerable
description: Your name and reputation are feared wherever you go. You embrace this reputation, embody it, and make use of the terror it inspires.

name: Knifethrower's Gloves
description: Knives become even more deadly when you hands are wrapped in these fingerless, suede sheaths.

name: Knockback Weapon
description: This massive hammer can push your enemies back or knock them down—hard.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, and push the target a number of squares equal to the weapon’s enhancement bonus.

info.Description: Wyrmscale is made using ancient techniques the dragonborn invented to mimic the strength of overlapping dragon scales.

name: Kord's Mighty Strength
description: Kord lends his strength to followers who prove their mettle in battle against his enemies.

name: Kord's Relentlessness
description: Kord marks you, who have survived deadly combat through strength and fortitude alone, rendering you indomitable in battle.

name: Kordium Weapon
description: The blood-red, scarlet and black swirling throughout this stronger-than-steel dwarven weapon are mute reminders of the wrath of Kord that seethes within.
critical:: +1d8 fire and thunder damage per plus

name: Kruthik Potion
description: This foul concoction bestows a burst of health and coats you in fine, silvery plates that protect against acid.

name: Lalali-Puy's Blessing
description: Those who please the Oba find that her blessing affords them protection from their enemies.

name: Lamp of Discerning
description: This plain-looking lantern grants those in its light the ability to see through deception.

name: Lancing Gloves
description: These supple brown leather riding gloves grip well and true.

name: Lantern of Revelation
description: Light from this lantern reveals even the most well-hidden foes.

name: Laughing Death Armor
description: The wearer of this armor scoffs at necrotic powers and can unleash a blast of withering black energy upon adversaries.

name: Laurel Circlet
description: Your social graces and force of personality are amplified while you wear this thin coronet.

name: Leader's Helm
description: This head gear glows with silver energy

name: Learning Weapon
description: This weapon learns as you fight a specific foe, helping you to hit and strike vital spots repeatedly.

name: Legacy Undying
description: So long as the Flame Imperishable exists, the soul of Nerath is kindled. Your faith in that inspires you and your allies to greatness.

name: Legendary Weapon
description: Legends are made when heroes do incredible things, and this weapon gives them a few more opportunities.

name: Legendmaker Armor
description: Wearing this impressive armor, you can inspire your allies to help create the stuff of legends.

name: Legionary Discipline
description: By organizing your allies using tactics handed down from the legion, you prepare them for any foe.

name: Lens of Discernment
description: When you look through this lens at an unknown creature, the truth about the creature is suddenly clear to you.

name: Lens of Reading
description: Holding this lens to your eye allows you to read even the most complex scripts and obscure languages.

name: Lenses of the Luminary
description: These varicolored lenses orbit around your head at eye level, improving your vision as needed.

info.Description: This minor magic item sheds bright light to a radius of 20 squares for 4 hours before burning out.

name: Lesser Elixir of Invisibility
description: When you sip this elixir, your form fades from sight.

name: Liar's Trinket
description: No two of these adornments look alike, but all appear to be mundane necklaces of little value.

name: Lich Dust
description: This white powder looks to be the residue of ground-up bones.

name: Life Charm
description: This small, heart-shaped pendant beats softly after you fall in battle, drawing your fleeting spirit back from death's door.

name: Life Force Amulet
description: This beautifully crafted amulet of fomorian make uses the life force of your slain foes to heal your allies.

name: Life River Totem
description: While you're armed with this green wood totem, your group enjoys great vitality even in the face of deadly adversity.

name: Life Shroud
description: This clean linen wrap protects a corpse from the ravages of time and the blasphemies of necromancers.

name: Life Vine Armor
description: This armor is woven with an intricate lattice of living vines that form a symbiotic relationship with the wearer.

name: Lifebane Weapon
description: This weapon creates a conduit, funneling your foe's weakness into your own strength.
weapon:: Heavy blade, light blade, pick or  spear
critical:: The target is weakened until the end of your next turn, and you gain 15 temporary hit points. If those temporary hit points haven’t already been used, you lose them at the end of your next turn.

name: Lifeblood Armor
description: This armor is infused with primal spirits that sustain and shield you from your enemies' attacks.

name: Lifedrinker Weapon
description: This weapon transfers an enemy's vitality to you.

name: Lifefont Armor
description: Embedded with ancient and powerful primal symbols, this armor has saved the life of more than one warden.

name: Lifegiving Armor
description: Protecting you against necrotic energy, this armor also brings you extended health when you need it.

name: Lifesapper Rod
description: This rod lets you drain the life from your enemies and transfer it to your allies or yourself.

name: Lifesaving Brooch
description: This small white and red pin helps those who seek to aid you.

name: Lightning Arrow
description: This arrow's blue and white streaks thrum with energy.

name: Lightning Reflex Gloves
description: These tight, black gloves grip your arms, making you twitch with nervous energy.

name: Lightning Strike Bow
description: This weapon appears to be formed out of a solidified silver bolt of lightning.
critical:: +1d10 lightning damage per plus and the target falls prone

name: Lightning Wand
description: With this wand, your lightning powers crackle with extra energy.

name: Lightning Weapon
description: This weapon crackles with dancing lightning.

name: Lightstep Slippers
description: These doeskin coverings cushion your step.

name: Lilting Songblade
description: When swung in an arc, this blade unleashes an inspiring ode to victory that increases in intensity with each defeated enemy.

name: Link to the Pillars
description: You have a divine connection to the Pillars of Ioun and can leverage their might.

name: Lion's Claw Gauntlets
description: These gauntlets, crafted from a lion's paws, help overcome the toughest adversaries.

name: Lion's Heart Hammer
description: When you wield this hammer, an attack that bloodies you sends your foes stumbling back in fear.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, and each ally within 5 squares of you gains 15 temporary hit points.

name: Liria Valthorin's Blinding Blade
description: Your blade pulses with eldritch power, and your opponent's sight is lost to the aching beauty of the Feywild.

name: Liria Valthorin's Silverlight Riposte
description: Your guard never falters, foiling the blades of sneaks and assassins.

name: Liria Valthorin's Unshakable Pursuit
description: Walls and ceilings prove no refuge as you learn to take the battle to your enemy.

name: Loadstone Statue
description: This statue usually takes the form of a dwarf paladin crouched in a defensive stance.

name: Loadstone Vault
description: This treasure chamber makes a would-be thief work much harder for that haul.

name: Loadstone of the Planes
description: This arrow-shaped piece of magnetite bound in electrum whirls in the air, directing you to a portal you're looking for.

name: Loamweave Armor
description: Made by the elves using a secret technique that involves spinning soil into fabric, these soft cloth vestments give the wearer a degree of control over earth and plants.

name: Lockburst Chalk
description: When fitted within a keyhole, this thin stick of gray chalk can force open the most complicated locks.

name: Lodret Leaf
description: Chewing on the infused leaf provides added insurance against disease.

name: Long Battle Tattoo
description: This tattoo is often depicted as a shield surrounded by weapons.

name: Longshot Gloves
description: Long range shots are eased by these fingerless gloves.

name: Luckbender Gloves
description: Avandra favors the wearer of these gloves, each of which has a golden shamrock stitched on the back.

name: Luckblade
description: Luck favors the bold—and the wielder of this blade.

name: Lucklender
description: This weapon can turn bad luck into good fortune.

name: Lucky Charm
description: Monkey's paw or rabbit's foot, this lucky charm helps you snatch victory from the jaws of defeat.

info.Description: Arrows come in a quiver that holds thirty arrows. Ammunition is  used up when you fire it from a projectile weapon.

name: Lucky Charm (Familiar)
description: Your familiar is blessed by good luck to get out of dangerous situations.

name: Lucky Halfling's Weapon
description: The reeds that wrap this weapon's handgrip are woven in a pattern kept secret by halfling tribes.

name: Lullaby Weapon
description: With a swing of this weapon, your enemy becomes lethargic, moving slower until finally collapsing into a snoring heap.

name: Luminary Ring
description: You are more able to aid your allies with this gold ring, which bears a faintly glowing sigil signifying your ideals.

name: Lunia's Bracelet
description: This silver bracelet contains charms of stars and moons that hold power against lycanthropes.

name: Luring Withdrawal Armor
description: Crafted from the essence of wind elementals, this armor allows you to withdraw from a foe and lure it into a trap.

name: Lurtaan's Cord
description: Fashioned of braided mithral and gold, this belt grants protection against supernaturally charged attacks.

name: Lyre of Supplication
description: This beautiful lyre is said to produce music so appealing that it could bend the wills of the gods.

name: Mac-Fuirmidh Cittern
description: The music of this magic lute lingers in the mind, providing vigor long after its tones have ceased.

name: Madeth's Magicial Musician
description: This tiny, well-carved wooden box holds a small fiddle bow. With a touch, it produces delightful, mesmerizing music.

info.Description: Using a nonmagical implement confers no benefit. You can purchase a magic implement to gain an enhancement bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with your arcane powers.

name: Madstone
description: This dully glowing lump of metal has a strange, oily texture. It heals wounds but leaves a strange lassitude.

name: Mage's Weapon
description: Some spellcasters choose this blade for its ability to convert a spell's power into accuracy in melee.

name: Magic Armor
description: A set of basic yet effective enchanted armor.

name: Magic Drawbridge
description: This iron-banded drawbridge resizes to fit the portal it's placed in, then raises or lowers with a single word.

name: Magic Holy Symbol
description: A holy symbol of your god, enchanted with magical power.

name: Magic Ki Focus
description: A minor focus, enchanted to help channel mystical power.

name: Magic Orb
description: A standard crystal orb, enchanted to channel arcane energy.

name: Magic Rod
description: A standard rod, enchanted so as to channel arcane energy.

name: Magic Staff
description: A basic staff, enchanted to channel arcane energy.

name: Magic Tome
description: An enchanted tome, filled with elementary magical lore.

info.Description: Using a nonmagical implement confers no benefit. You can purchase a magical implement to gain an enhancement bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with your arcane powers. A staff implement can also function as a magic quarterstaff.

name: Magic Totem
description: This item is a simple totem that channels primal energy.

name: Magic Wand
description: A basic wand, enchanted so as to channel arcane energy.

name: Magic Weapon
description: A basic enchanted weapon.

name: Magic Weapon Rack
description: This heavy oak weapon rack recharges weapons and implements stored on it.

name: Magician's Ring
description: Tricksters and hedge wizards everywhere love this cheap-looking gold ring.

name: Magnetic Armor
description: Studded with lodestones, this heavy armor pulls creatures into your reach.

name: Magnificent Tapestry
description: The scenes depicted in this richly embroidered wall hanging seem uncannily realistic.

name: Magnificent Tsor's Brutal Finish
description: You hack down the enemy with such brutal ferocity, your foes' courage flees them.

name: Magnificent Tsor's Punishing Retort
description: The bite from a strike serves only to spark your wrath, a fury manifesting as a brutal strike of your own.

info.Description: Using an ordinary implement confers no benefit, but you can purchase an enchanted implement to gain an enhancement bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with your arcane powers.

name: Magnificent Tsor's Unrelenting Fury
description: You turn an appalling injury into the momentum you need to overcome your enemy.

name: Magrathar's Ring
description: This platinum band, inset with six small diamonds, has a single word etched into its inside surface over and over in a variety of languages—”soul.” When worn, the ring alternates between being extremely warm when the wearer is healthy and icy cold when the wearer is sick or injured.

name: Malaeura, the Emerald-Eyed (Poisoned Weapon)
description: This wooden blow is covered with a pattern resembling a snake's scales. Two staring eyes are carved near the hand grip, and the pupils are set with emeralds. The emeralds flash with a spark of sentience.

name: Manifester Weapon
description: By focusing your mind on the psionic energy stored in this weapon, you can extract a measure of its power.

name: Manticore Shield
description: Emblazoned with the emblem of a snarling manticore, this shield releases a volley of needles at your command.

name: Mantle of Faith
description: Woven of celestial thread, these vestments carry the boon of divine protection.

name: Mantle of Regrets
description: This somber mantle bestows a crippling weight on your enemies.

name: Mantle of the Golden General
description: The aid you give an ally is strengthened by the power of this fur-lined amber cloak.

name: Mantle of the Seventh Wind
description: This enchanted robe or jacket catches the fickle wind to bear you aloft.

name: Manual of the Planes
description: The pages of this tome display complex diagrams of planar destinations and provide insight into the portals connecting various locations within the planes.

info.Description: Elderscale is a scale armor scoured with elemental forces
Crossbow bolts come in a case that holds twenty. Ammunition is used up when you fire it from a projectile weapon.

name: Many-Fingered Gloves
description: You seem to have more than the normal allotment of fingers while wearing these simple gloves.

name: Map of Orienteering
description: As you unfold this sheet of parchment, sepia ink spreads across its surface to depict your immediate surroundings.

name: Map of Unseen Lands
description: Unseen images glimmer within this mundane-looking sheet of vellum, which erupts with detail as it creates complex maps at your command.

name: Marauder's Armor
description: This heavy, fur-lined armor is favored by barbarian pirates who rush into the fray.

name: Marble ElephantMarble Elephant
description: : When you activate a figurine, the conjured creature appears in a space adjacent to you, provided the space is large enough to contain the creature without squeezing. The creature obeys only you, responding to commands spoken in any language. The creature remains for up to 8 hours or until you use a minor action to dismiss it. The conjured creature acts on the same initiative count as you. Every action it takes costs you a minor action (which you use to issue commands), and a conjured creature cannot exceed its normal allotment of actions (a standard, a move, and a minor action) during its turn. If you spend no minor actions on your turn to command the creature, it remains where it is without taking any actions on its turn.          A conjured creature has hit points, defenses, and attacks as indicated in its statistics block. It has no healing surges and cannot be healed, though it can still benefit from temporary hit points. When reduced to 0 hit points or fewer, the conjured creature disappears and cannot be conjured again until after you’ve taken an extended rest. Conjured creatures lack basic attacks and therefore cannot make opportunity attacks.          Mount: If the conjured creature has the mount keyword, you can ride the creature and are considered to have the Mounted Combat feat while mounted on it. While mounted, you can command the creature using free actions, though the mount is still limited to its normal allotment of actions. You can choose to be mounted on the creature when it appears.

name: Mark of Six Fingers
description: Your skin bears the six-fingered sign, a brand showing a hand with six splayed fingers.

name: Mark of the Star
description: The symbol of the star card from the Deck of Many Things is permanently emblazoned upon your body.

name: Mark of the Tembo
description: A tembo has had you in its dreadful fangs, and you yet live.

name: Martyr's Armor
description: This crimson-tinted armor empowers its wearer to protect allies even at the expense of his or her own health.

name: Martyr's Saddle
description: Those who seek to protect their mounts at any cost favor this saddle.

info.Description: Sling bullets come in a pouch that holds twenty. Ammunition is  used up when you fire it from a projectile weapon.

name: Mask of Fear
description: This mask is little more than a carefully preserved skull, refined with metal joints to allow it to fit over its wearer’s head. Black runes cover its stark, white surface.

name: Mask of Melora
description: Shaped as a leaf or seashell, this symbol channels your faith to bolster your conviction against unnatural creatures.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, +1d10 damage per plus against aberrant creatures.
requirement:: To use this symbol, You must worship melora.

name: Mask of Slithering
description: This serpentine mask allows you to slink out of harm's way and cause another to suffer in your stead.

name: Mask of Tears
description: This bone mask captures the image of a grieving figure whose tears become a balm to you or an ally.

name: Mask of Terror
description: This frightful, demonic mask is formed from charred flesh and adorned with horns and fangs.

name: Mask of Terrors
description: This green metal mask has a strip of studs that run down the center and end just above the nose.

name: Mask of the Eye Leech
description: The countenance of this full-face mask changes from expressionless to maniacal when activated.

name: Mask of the Impish Grin
description: This steel mask bears the likeness of an imp's infectious smile and allows its wearer to temporarily disappear from view.

name: Mask of the Matriarch
description: An obsidian mask, it is carved to resemble the features of a beautiful drow woman.

name: Mask of the Vengeful Spirit
description: This wooden mask takes on the appearance of a snarling beast, causing a selected foe to be overcome by fear.

name: Master's Blade
description: Seemingly impossible feats are possible for master warriors, and for those who wield this perfectly designed weapon.

name: Master's Wand of Cloud of Daggers
description: Your cloud of daggers strikes with deadly accuracy.

name: Master's Wand of Dire Radiance
description: Your dire radiance presses against foes with an invisible force.

name: Master's Wand of Eldritch Blast
description: Your eldritch blast viciously scours your enemies.

name: Master's Wand of Eyebite
description: Your eyebite spell occludes you just a moment longer than normal.

name: Master's Wand of Eyes of the Vestige
description: This ebony wand strikes your targets with devastating power.

name: Master's Wand of Hellish Rebuke
description: Your hellish rebuke consumes your attacker and its nearby allies.

name: Master's Wand of Illusory Ambush
description: With this red palm wand, your phantoms continue to harass your enemies.

name: Master's Wand of Magic Missile
description: Your magic missiles impact a foe with the force of a bull rush.

name: Master's Wand of Misdirected Mark
