name: Nolzur's Inkwell
description: This glass inkwell is stained and battered, as if it has seen much use.

name: Pearl of Power
description: This pearl grows warm to the touch each time you attack, ready to overcome your enemies’ best attempts to thwart you.

name: True Portable Hole
description: This slip of black cloth lets you safely store items in a hidden space when you unfold it.

name: Elixir of Chameleon Power
description: Once consumed, this clear liquid lets you blend in with your surroundings.

name: Elixir of Clairvoyance
description: As you consume this elixir, a haze of ghostly images fills your sight, focusing finally on the single vision you seek.

name: Elixir of Climbing
description: This draught smells of clear air and mountain wildflowers. Consuming it allows you to easily move along walls and other sheer surfaces.

name: Elixir of Defense
description: A flood of protective energy fills you when you drink this bitter draught.
special:: When this elixir is created, the crafter chooses a defense: Fortitude, Reflex, or Will.

name: Elixir of Gaseous Form
description: When you drink this elixir, you feel momentarily lightheaded as your body fades to vapor.

name: Elixir of Giant Strength
description: When you consume this draught, your muscles begin to spasm, but that discomfort ends quickly as you feel great strength rush through your body.

name: Elixir of Levitation
description: Drinking this frothy elixir allows you to rise up into the air, in addition to making your feet and hands tingle.

info.Description: This leather case holds a blank journal, loose sheets of parchment, an ink stone and ink brushes, a blotter, quills, and penknives.

name: Elixir of Luck
description: The red-gold liquid contained within this vial shines with its own dim light. When you drink it, you feel as though nothing could go wrong.

name: Elixir of Phasing
description: This brackish gray liquid seems to appear and disappear within its vial at short intervals. The effect carries over to you when you consume it.

name: Elixir of Protection from Evil
description: The pearly white liquid of this potion leaves you with a feeling of righteous zeal against those who would do evil.

name: Elixir of Treasure Finding
description: A hint of exotic spices fills your senses as you drink this draught, which produces a faint tingling in the back of your mind when treasure is close by.

name: Elixir of Water Breathing
description: The shortness of breath you feel when quaffing this potion is offset by its ability to allow you to breathe easily underwater.

name: Lesser Elixir of Dragon Breath
description: You drink this syrupy elixir, and a surge of energy courses through your body, waiting to be released in an explosion of breath.
special:: When this elixir is created, the crafter chooses acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. The elixir gains that keyword, and all damage dealt by it is of that damage type.

name: Lesser Elixir of Speed
description: Your heartbeat races as you drink this elixir, which sends energy surging through your nerves and limbs.

name: Potion of Cure Critical Wounds
description: This potion covers your deep wounds in bright silver light, causing them to mend.

name: Potion of Cure Light Wounds
description: This potion covers your small cuts and minor bruises in dim silver light, causing them to heal over.

name: Potion of Cure Moderate Wounds
description: This potion covers your wounds in silver light, helping them heal.

info.Description: Wearing these furs gives you a +2 bonus to Endurance checks against cold weather. Wearing the snowshoes included in this gear allows you to ignore difficult terrain caused by snow and ice, but reduces your speed by 2.

name: Potion of Heal
description: This potion covers your most grievous wounds in brilliant silver light, restoring your body.

name: Potion of Heroism
description: This bitter potion gives you a surge of vitality and resilience.

name: Potion of Invulnerability
description: A sense of unyielding resolve floods through you when you drink this sweet draught.

name: Potion of Lesser Haste
description: When you consume the silvery liquid of this elixir, your body begins to blur as your movement quickens.

name: Potion of Shadow's Essence
description: The liquid in this vial is black and viscous, absorbing the light around it.

name: Bead of Force
description: This lusterless black pearl seems mundane, but as you grasp it you feel the force magic contained within it reverberate up and down your arm.

name: Dust of Disappearance
description: When you sprinkle this dust over yourself, you disappear from sight until you do something to shake it loose.

name: Nolzur's Marvelous Pigments
description: You smear a glob of this paint on a wall or floor, creating any object you desire.

name: Oil of Lasting Flame
description: A vial of this oil provides heat and flame for a long time.

name: Oil of Red Flame
description: You coat your weapon’s blade with this oil, knowing that you will be able to call flame to your weapon thereafter.

info.Description: Finemail is a more common armor made according to an advanced technique perfected in the eladrin courts of the Feywild, consisting of closely linked chains that provide few openings for enemy attacks.

This waterproof leather tube can be unrolled to form a writing surface. The maps you make with the tools inside, which include parchment, charcoal, ink, and strings with distance markings, can be sold to others interested in your discoveries.

name: Powder of Appearance
description: As this dust settles over a creature, it reveals that which was hidden.

name: Quaal's Feather Anchor
description: You produce a heavy iron anchor that is immobile and sturdy.

name: Quaal's Feather Pigeon
description: This feather turns into a messenger pigeon that awaits your instruction.

name: Quaal's Feather Sail
description: With a wave of this feather, a sail unfurls from its tip, ready to be lashed to mast and ropes.

name: Sands of Restored Opportunity
description: You fling this pebble into the air. As it flashes and is consumed, time rewinds slightly, allowing events to take a new course.

name: Scroll of Protection
description: You read words of power from this scroll that repel your enemies and prevent them from attacking.
special:: When the scroll is created, it is tied to a creature type of the creator’s choice: angels; demons; devils; dragons; elementals that have the air, earth, fire, or water keyword; or undead.

name: Trackless Ashes
description: You dump these ashes into your campfire, removing all signs of the camp and of your passage from it.

name: Unreadable Ink
description: You look at a blank folio, seeing the hidden message written there while others see nothing.

name: Vial of Darkness
description: This glass vial is filled to the brim with a black liquid and stoppered with a thick gob of dried black wax.

name: Alchemist's Essence
description: When this flask is shattered, its contents fill an area with a deadly distilled element.
special:: When this item is created, the alchemist chooses acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. The item gains that keyword, and all damage dealt by the item is of that damage type.

info.Description: These arrows, sling bullets, or crossbow bolts incorporate sunrod materials that ignite when the ammunition is fired, and are useful for coordinating maneuvers or signaling for help.

name: Chartreuse Gas
description: The green mist contained in this glass globe can make dreams and memories seem real.

name: Clinging Essence
description: This vial holds enough sticky essence of a distilled element to apply to one weapon or to douse one enemy.
special:: When this item is created, the alchemist chooses acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. The item gains that keyword, and all damage dealt by the item is of that type.

name: Corpseburster
description: Death is the trigger for the true virulence of this poisonous purplish fluid.

name: Elemental Accelerant
description: This pouch is designed to break apart when thrown, coating everything around it with a dust that intensifies the next reaction in its area.

name: Foaming Plaster
description: When you combine these two reagents, one chalky and one viscous, a billow of expanding foam quickly forms in the area and then soon afterward hardens.

name: Greater Sovereign Glue
description: This vial of gray paste creates a virtually unbreakable bond between the objects it glues together.

name: Icening
description: When you toss this crystal into water, it freezes that liquid solid.

name: Oil of Etherealness
description: When you apply this oil to yourself or an object, it is momentarily removed from the physical world.

name: Oil of Slipperiness
description: The oily gel in this vial quickly spreads to make your body or a patch of ground very slick.

name: Ossip Wax
description: This stiff yellow wax makes anything it’s spread on lighter.

info.Description: When you use these baited tripwire traps, you gain a +2 bonus to Nature checks or Dungeoneering checks to forage, but each check requires 2 hours instead of 1 hour.

name: Precarious Crystal
description: This small, clear crystal collapses into a tiny flame in response to motion, activating another nearby alchemical item.

name: Protean Silk
description: You draw forth a long, thin filament from this viscous glob that you can turn into a strong rope that lasts for a short time.

name: Smoke Snake
description: You throw this tab of compacted black powder to the ground and it ignites, releasing a cloud of foul-smelling smoke.

name: Sweet Water
description: This small glob of white jelly purifies even the most toxic food and drink, from poisons to dwarven spirits.

name: Twinned Flames
description: This tiny spark is almost invisible until it is fanned into life. When it is, its twin flame reignites as well.

name: Crown Jewel of Chessenta
description: This fist-sized sphere of unfathomable blackness slowly orbits about you, radiating menace.
quirks:: You must use a minor action each round to maintain or to regain control over the Crown Jewel. If not so controlled, the Crown Jewel stays within 8 squares of you and orbits around your space at a fly speed of 4.          Potential users can attune to the Crown Jewel by spending 24 hours with the item and succeeding on a DC 30 Arcana check. An attuned user can control the Crown Jewel. If two or more attuned users try to control the item at one time, those users make opposed Charisma checks, the winner gaining control of the item for 1 round.          The leader of the Karanok family can control the Crown Jewel without attuning to it and without having to beat other attuned users in an opposed Charisma check.

name: Manshoon’s Bloodmask
description: This full-face mask of rich, dark cloth reveals only the wearer’s eyes.
quirks:: If you are not undead, you spend two healing surges when donning the bloodmask for the first time during a day or at the beginning of any day in which the mask is already worn.          You can regain healing surges lost to the bloodmask by killing a sentient living creature and drinking its blood. You can drink through the bloodmask, even though it covers your mouth.          Undead sense the value of the bloodmask and gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls against a living creature that wears it.

name: Marlspire of Najara
description: This simple circlet of silvery metal has three long spines over the brow and is engraved with a snake motif.
quirks:: If you don’t have the reptile keyword, creatures that do have the reptile keyword gain a +2 bonus to all defenses against you while you wear the Marlspire.          If you don’t have the reptile keyword, creatures that have the reptile keyword gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls against you while you wear the Marlspire. This bonus increases to +4 for creatures of 11th level or higher, and to +6 for creatures of 21st level or higher.

name: Scepter of the Chosen Tyrant
description: This impressive morningstar is studded with cruel barbs.
enhancement_bonus:: +6 to Attack rolls and damage rolls
quirks:: If you don’t serve Bane as your patron deity, you take a –1 penalty to Will defense while you carry and use the Scepter. If you’re good or lawful good, this penalty is –2.          Bane’s servants of 21st level and higher know when a nonbeliever carries the Scepter. They can track the item’s location without fail and receive a +1 bonus to attack rolls against the carrier and all of that creature’s allies.

name: Thakorsil’s Seat
description: This massive throne of dark, veined stone is elaborately carved. Each arm looks like the head and neck of a snarling dragon, and each of its four feet is like a draconic claw grasping a sphere.

info.Description: Hundreds or thousands of people live and work in safety between the curtain wall and keep of one of these massive stone structures.

name: Black Star Pendant
description: A black stone in the middle of this star-shaped pendant  twists and turns as if handled by some ghostly hand.

name: Sun's Sliver
description: This sliver of pure sunlight is the only object in the universe that can truly destroy the Winter Witch.
special:: This item cannot be crafted.

name: Gauntlets of Swimming and Climbing
description: Primal strength flows through your limbs when you don these gauntlets.

name: Defensive Training
description: You won’t last long if you don’t learn to keep your guard up and dodge blows.

name: Aggressive Training
description: Your tactics are legendary for their devastating nature.

name: Tactical Training
description: Young gladiators seek you out, begging for you to share your insights on the art of combat.

name: Ashes of Royal Hubris
description: Scattering these icy ashes punishes the arrogance of those  who act against you, displaying the frigid might of the Raven  Queen.

name: Fragment of the Eleventh Rack
description: This wooden fragment of an age-old torture device is stained  with the blood of Kord, bestowing you with his fearsome endurance and inflicting pain upon those who harm you.

name: Lavanya's Shroud
description: This simple, unadorned funerary shroud is scarcely long  enough to cover a youth, but it brings life and hope to the  dying.

info.Description: The excavations below this structure are as extensive as the towers that crown it.

name: Lawmaker's Stylus
description: While holding this simple bone stylus, your authority cannot  be denied.

name: The Oracle's Head
description: Though gruesome, the austere countenance of this severed  head is untouched by time. When its milky eyes open, a  raspy voice details a foe’s doom.

name: Bracers of Assassination
description: These dark bronze bracers are covered in a mosaic of red and  black stones, depicting a flaming dagger.

name: Embers of Black Flame
description: This clattering assortment of charcoal beads and fire-blackened finger bones is strung together into a strand with sinew.
critical:: +1d10 fire and necrotic damage per plus

name: Reclaimer’s Totem
description: When you channel primal energy through this totem and use it to aid a dying comrade, the spirits provide some of their own essence to the effort.

name: Shepherd’s Totem
description: This totem emits an atmosphere of gentle command, lending the weight of nature’s authority to your attacks.

name: Wrath of Nature Totem
description: This totem quivers with the pent-up forces of nature, waiting to be released when your wrath is unleashed.

name: Bottled Twilight
description: This black glass bottle holds the power of dusk to make light fade.

name: Faerie Field Catalog
description: From boggles to brownies, nixies to nymphs, this volume keenly details the fey, giving you access to obscure knowledge.

name: Hill Tamer Crook
description: The path over the hill is much easier to negotiate when the hill obliges.

info.Description: This single-room hut typically has walls of wood or sod and a thatched roof.

name: Messenger Doll
description: With features resembling your own, this wood and cloth doll acts in your stead when you are not present.

name: Shinaelestra Chalice of Fellowship
description: You make a toast with this chalice to honor heroism and friendship, bolstering those who share the toast.

name: Starglass Eye
description: This plain glass marble becomes a lens from the Feywild to the world and its shadowy echo.

name: Tuathan Road Whistle
description: With a short blow on this whistle, you create a path that helps you quickly reach your desired location.

name: Hag’s Doorknob
description: When you touch this tarnished doorknob to a wall, a door to the other side of the wall instantly forms.

name: Horse’s Breath
description: Inside this canvas bag is the hot breath of a champion stallion that will give a mount or a vehicle a quick burst of speed.

name: Ray of Feywild Sunshine
description: These rays restore dead or withered foliage, renewing desolate lands with sudden summer growth and causing fruit to grow and ripen in the dead of winter.

name: Unseelie Candle
description: This flickering candle reveals those who might wish to remain unseen.

name: Calm the Storm
description: Your lilting words take to the wind, calming the wrath of nature for a short while.

name: Charm Token
description: You weave a simple charm on a small token, allowing you to sense the direction in which it can be found.

info.Description: For those who want to travel without leaving home.

name: Eyes of the Owl
description: You close your eyes, but instead of darkness, you see the landscape from the viewpoint of nearby birds.

name: Feast of Recuperation
description: You transform the most meager of provisions into a feast fit for a lord.

name: Gather Flames
description: You reach out and pluck a flame from its fuel source, then effortlessly carry it to a new location.

name: Know the Path
description: You can sense the way that you must go as clearly as if a tended path lay before you.

name: Mount Growth
description: You imbue a tiny creature with the power of nature, and it grows to such a size that you can ride it.

name: Ride the Winds
description: You whisper quiet words to a group of mounts, giving them the ability to run like the wind.

name: Scent of Gold
description: You’ ve got a nose for gold, allowing you to ferret out hidden valuables.

name: Speak with Animals
description: You speak to a creature using the language of animals, learning information from an unlikely source.

name: Speak with Sentinels
description: You listen to what the shapes of stone and straw have to say, learning what recently transpired nearby.

name: Voice of the Archfey
description: Your voice becomes as thunder, resounding with the authority of the archfey.

info.Description: This building has reinforced walls, its own gate and portcullis, and quarters for five guards.

name: Whispers in the Willows
description: Your words are absorbed into the bark of a nearby tree, then quickly travel by root and earth to a friend.

name: Mind of Two Moons
description: You have so disciplined your thoughts at the House of the Mind that your mental defenses lash out instinctively.

name: Chosen of Tectuktitlay
description: As one of Tectuktitlay’s favored students, you have learned techniques to crush the minds of those who oppose you.

name: Golden Blade
description: This golden blade is one of only nine created during the Dynasty of Might by the Shou Emperor. The wielders of such blades effortlessly turn aside the attacks of their enemies.

name: Manual of Ninjutsu
description: The most basic manual of the ninja teaches the secret of using the shadows as a weapon.

name: The Ineffable Secret of Death
description: The original masters penned this tome with the intent that it be read in a time of dire need. It holds the secret of how to use the power of the dying as a weapon against the living.

name: Dragon Claw Life-Thief Strike
description: Your claws cut deep, as you drink life from those around you.

name: Dragon Claw Fangs and Maw
description: The bite of the blades makes you stronger, the better to cull the weak.

name: Five Stars Arrow Deflection
description: Do not be fast. Do not be quick. Become the arrow before it strikes your flesh.

name: Five Stars Five Strikes
description: Do not stop moving simply because you have struck your target; let one strike blossom into five.

info.Description: This heavy stone fortification is built to withstand a siege.

name: Iron Hand Anvil Breaker
description: Move slowly to center the body. Find the weakness in your target that will cause it to crumble, and then strike.

name: Iron Hand Unbreakable Form
description: Be heavy as the iron bell, sturdy as the barred gate.

name: Mad Monkey Wobbles
description: Rule number one is to not get hit. Stop getting hit!

name: Mad Monkey Falls Down
description: Rule number one is that you will fall down if you are struck. So just fall down and skip being struck.

name: Nimble Hunter Pounce
description: Do not hesitate. Grace is simplicity and focus. Step in, strike, step out.

name: Nimble Hunter Grace of Eloquence
description: Words cannot be blocked. There is no defense against the beauty of logic.

name: Northern Fist Paralyzing Point
description: Strike like the scorpion defending its den from the predator, and block the ki to stop your foe’s movement.

name: Northern Fist Distant Pain
description: Just as the wind ripples the waves, your extended ki disrupts your foe.

name: Southern Star Ring the Bell
description: Don’t deceive yourself into thinking your reach ends with your fists. Strike further, from within.

name: Southern Star Cleave the Boulder
description: You raise a fist and strike an enemy far from your reach.

info.Description: This stately edifice has multiple wings, making it a good guildhouse or residence in which to entertain guests in style.

name: Cloak of Poison
description: The heavy cloak feels oily and has a faint chemical smell.

name: Cursed Weapon
description: This weapon feels comfortable in your hands.

name: Potion of Delusion
description: You feel a surge of energy but are surprised to find none of your wounds have healed.

name: Asmodeus’s Dread Authority
description: Asmodeus invests you with the authority he uses to rule the Nine Hells.

name: Bane’s Battle Acumen
description: The Iron General is the consummate warrior and those with his favor gain a measure of his tactical genius.

name: Gruumsh’s Bloodthirsty Wrath
description: Destruction and carnage are the only things able to quell Gruumsh’s appetite for chaos.

name: Lolth’s Fickle Favor
description: The Demon Queen of Spiders is a fickle goddess, as likely to offer a gift as she is to bestow a curse.

name: Tharizdun’s Madness Spiral
description: Although the Chained God is silent, the god’s will is revealed in the mad actions of its followers.

name: Tiamat’s Insatiable Greed
description: Tiamat commands her followers to let no slight go unpunished and to take what they want.

name: Torog’s Inescapable Suffering
description: Torog instructs his servants to embrace their agony, for only through pain can one unite the mortal with the divine.

info.Description: Braidmail is an armor made according to an advanced technique perfected in elven tradition, consisting of closely linked chains that provide few openings for enemy attacks.
The architecture and ornamentation of this immense complex is designed to impress.

name: Vecna’s Dark Secret
description: Vecna rewards your service with forbidden knowledge and a taste of what undeath has to offer.

name: Zehir’s Shadow Cloak
description: Each life ended at your hands honors the Lord of Darkness. Kill often and without hesitation, and the god’s favor will be yours.

name: Bracers of Suffering
description: The sharp spikes adorning each bracer bite into your flesh when you fit them over your arms.

name: Flesh-Eating Rod
description: This blacked iron rod is carved with horrid demons cavorting and killing all along its length.

name: Girdle of Skulls
description: By plucking a skull from the belt, you can call forth a skeleton to do your bidding.

name: Midnight Blade
description: A weapon forged for dark deeds works best when cloaked in shadow.
critical:: +1d8 per plus, or +1d12 per plus in dim light or darkness

name: Obsidian Wand
description: When you channel magic through the wand, you feel it grow as cold as the grave.

name: Ring of Domination
description: The Rellanic script drifting across the ring’s surface tells a tale of a wicked hag who seduced mortal men.

name: Serpentine Knife of Zannad
description: This wavy blade doubles as a weapon and an implement.

name: Skull of Terror
description: Channeling primal magic through the skull infects your enemies with an overwhelming urge to flee from your presence.

info.Description: Surrounded by a wall of sharpened logs, this wooden fort can be constructed quickly and garrisons up to fifty troops and their families.

name: Commandant Lathiel’s Subduing Technique
description: This technique enhances a Winterguard marshal’s ability to bring fugitives back alive.

name: The First Sword of Tyr
description: Barely larger than a dagger, the First Sword of Tyr has a hilt made of jhakar fang and is enchanted with magic that makes its blade bite deep.

name: The Second Sword of Tyr
description: This fine, slender blade has a hilt made of alabaster wrapped in leather, and is enchanted with magic that shields the mind from psychic assault.

name: The Third Sword of Tyr
description: This broad-bladed sword has a hilt made of anakore tusk and is enchanted with magic that preserves the wielder’s life force.

name: The Fourth Sword of Tyr
description: This simple blade features a studded grip of petrified wood, and is enchanted with magic that reflects psychic assaults back on their originators.

name: The Fifth Sword of Tyr
description: This sword features a broad, flat blade with a twin kirre-fang hilt. It is enchanted to disrupt an enemy’s ability to teleport.

name: The Sixth Sword of Tyr
description: This broad blade features a longer crystalline hilt, and is enchanted with magic that slows the minds of those it wounds.

name: The Seventh Sword of Tyr
description: This long, broad-bladed sword features a bone hilt and enchantments that suppress the auras of enemies.

name: The Eighth Sword of Tyr
description: This weapon features a long, curving blade with an inlaid ivory hilt and is enchanted to make it difficult for enemies to recover from their ailments.

name: The Ninth Sword of Tyr
description: This massive sword with a bone grip is the most ornate of the Swords of Tyr, and features an enchantment that steals time from an opponent.

info.Description: From beaches, docks, and sea caves to towers, villas, and observatories, it’s all yours.

name: Earthmother Torc
description: This rope-like silver collar is adorned with stylized acorns, oak leaves, holly berries, and ferns, representing the natural world’s serenity.

name: Ironhand’s Reckoning
description: The nicks and flaws in the blade belie this greatsword’s phenomenal balance and decoration. When you hold the sword, you hear the rumbling of booming voices crying out in pain.
critical:: +3d8 damage, +3d10 damage against a Large or larger creature, or +3d12 damage against creatures that have the giant subtype

name: Sentinel’s Cudgel
description: Each of these clubs is unique in shape and features, depending on how the tree from which the cudgel was formed died.

name: Silver Hart Clasp
description: This large silver brooch is fashioned in the shape of a stag’s head. Its enchantments help you to move swiftly and silently in forest settings, and the clasp heals you in time of need.

name: Brassburn Armor
description: Although the armor does not burn you, you feel heat radiating out from its brass links and plates.

name: Chromatic Robe
description: Fibers of elemental energy give this fine garment the ability to harvest dangerous forces and rebound them against aggressors.

name: Demonskin Armor
description: This hideous suit is made from a demon’s hide and retains enough of its nature to protect you from elemental energy.

name: Earth-Splitter Weapon
description: This stone-headed axe bears Primordial runes, which shine with dread power as you grip its handle.

name: Firewind Blade
description: The air around the long blade shimmers as if it were emitting heat.
critical:: +1d6 fire damage per plus, and you can slide the target 1 square per plus

name: Stormshard Weapon
description: The wind moans and thunder rumbles each time you strike with this spear.
critical:: One enemy within 5 squares of the target takes 1d8 lightning and thunder damage per plus

info.Description: These three small rooms might be a single-story wooden house, or an apartment within a larger building.

name: Tidal Weapon
description: With a head carved to resemble a watery fist, this potent weapon reveals its power each time you manifest elemental energy.
critical:: +1d4 damage per plus, and the target falls prone

name: Chronicle of the Dawn War
description: An exhaustive record of the Dawn War’s triumphs and defeats await those who examine this tome’s pages.

name: Cold Fury Ki Focus
description: The angrier you get, the colder this blue steel medallion becomes.

name: Demonomicon
description: Foul Abyssal runes and dubious stains mar the tome’s blackened cover, revealing the foul practices for which it has been used.

name: Enduring Hatred Ki Focus
description: A broken holy symbol represents a long-standing grudge against heaven’s immortals.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d10 damage per plus against an immortal creature

name: Fireblood Ki Focus
description: A burned and pitted scrap of steel might have once been a dagger or a shoulder plate. Gripping the item fills you with inexplicable anger.
critical:: +1d6 acid and fire damage per plus

name: Tablet of Ad-Baraz
description: Etched onto this clay tablet is a list of names, the identities of those primordials defeated in a time now largely forgotten.

name: Cinder of Gazra
description: Black soot and ash covers your body when you claim this shard and enemies who subject you to force or flame do so at their peril.

name: Echo of Ty’h’kadi
description: Light worms through this violet shard, as if somehow it contained the very essence of lightning.

name: Obsidian Sliver
description: Heat radiates out from this primordial shard, promising power over earth and fire should you take it up.

info.Description: The stone walls of this building make it an ideal workshop or townhouse. It can be two stories tall and is typically 30 feet wide by 40 feet long.

name: Pale Tooth
description: This milky white shard is cool to the touch, hinting at the elemental power contained within.

name: Pitted Flowstone
description: Your skin gains an unhealthy pallor, and a glistening sheen covers your body.

name: Gift of Chaos
description: Unpredictability dogs your steps, and you never know when chaos will play a part in your destiny.

name: Gift of Flame
description: Hearing elemental fire’s call, you vanish and reappear in a flash of flames.

name: Gift of Stone
description: A sudden transformation into stone protects you from an attack and adds power to your next melee strike.

name: Gift of the Sea
description: The harder your enemy tries to move you, the harder you move the enemy.

name: Spirit of Storm
description: Primordial lightning erupts from your enemy, and thunder booms all around.

name: Spirit of Wind
description: The fury of the storm manifests around you when you call forth its power.

name: Farbane
description: This stout hammer is forged, head to haft, of a strange violet metal. The symbol of Bane adorns the head and pommel, and the haft is wrapped in mottled leather.
critical:: +3d8 damage, or +3d10 damage against aberrant creatures

name: Shearing Weapon
description: This weapon slices through even the most powerful of defenses.

info.Description: A favorite residence for mages, this stone spire rises 30 feet high and is 20 feet in diameter.

name: Gleaming Weapon
description: The blade of this weapon shines like liquid silver.
weapon:: Axe, heavy blade or  light blade

name: Leaping Weapon
description: The blade seems light, as if it wants to jump away.

name: Sentinel Marshal Honor Blade
description: Members of House Deneith recognize this bright blade as a badge of respect and a shield against enemies of the law.

name: Echoes of Providence
description: Faint whispers speak of knowledge and events both ancient and prescient.

name: Flickers of Faith
description: A sense of benevolent reverence, so unlike what the sorcererkings demand, fills and sustains you.

name: Embers of Divinity
description: Light and warmth from a forgotten power burns within you, revealing the hidden and flowing out to burn your foes.

name: Last Breath of the Gods
description: A faint breeze stirs around you, the last gasps of a longabsent power mingling with your own breath.

name: Sword of Croodle
description: This handsome elven blade once belonged to Beek Gwenders of Croodle, a valiant ranger who perished in the Glacial Rift.
critical:: +4d6 damage (+4d10 damage against Large or larger humanoids)

name: Axe of the Glacial Rift
description: The blade of this greataxe is carved from black ice, and its iron haft is cold to the touch.

name: Chaos Storm Dagger
description: This serrated dagger constantly seems to squirm in your hand, as if it were alive.

info.Description: This two-story structure is typically 30 feet wide by 40 feet long and makes a good tavern or farmhouse. However, its wooden walls make it susceptible to fire.

name: Babau Gauntlets
description: These clawed, demon-hide gauntlets ooze the corrosive blood of a babau on command.

name: Hailstorm Ki Focus
description: This ice devil horn is inscribed with glowing runes. When you meditate upon it, you visualize yourself enduring the merciless ice and lightning of a mighty hailstorm.
critical:: +1d6 cold and lightning damage per plus

name: Rift Dancer Boots
description: These mismatched boots look somewhat unremarkable on the outside, but on the inside they appear to be filled with an unnaturally black void.

name: Elemental Ward Cloak
description: This midnight blue cloak has many different and colorful hides stitched into its lining.

name: Ring of the Djinn Slayer
description: This gold and silver ring feels lighter than air and seems to be constantly crackling with static electricity.

name: Wand of Fiery Hordes
description: This red lacquer wand resembles a miniature totem pole of impish creatures.
critical:: +1d6 fire and psychic damage per plus

name: Glowing Globe
description: Unless ordered to remain in a particular spot, this luminous glass globe floats a handspan above the creature that last touched it, giving that creature access to its powers.

name: Halaster’s Vision
description: Halaster left spirits in his wake, instructing them to grant the gift of second sight to the first worthy creature that sits upon the Seat of Visions. That creature is you.

name: Coin of Good Luck
description: This shiny gold coin can mean the difference between life and death, brilliant success and utter failure.

name: Horned Ring
description: Of the multitude of powers imbued in each ring, only one is accessible to a casual wearer—a teleportation power allowing expeditious transport through Undermountain.

info.Description: Giant reptiles roam the Talenta Plains. Long ago, the halflings who live and hunt these lands domesticated these beasts for use as steeds. Of these creatures, carvers and clawfoots are the most common. Both are bipedal drakes equipped with razor-sharp talons and terrible teeth. They are ideal mounts for war and travel. The halflings also make use of a slightly smaller beast known as the fastieth. Bred for speed, it can keep pace with a common riding horse in spite of its slight size.

name: Velvet Crown
description: This velvet band might be worn about the leg as a garter, but its powers of stealth and alacrity only come into play when the crown is worn about the head.

name: Quarrel of Biting
description: Once common throughout eastern and southern Faerûn, this missile takes flight as a winged, venomous snake.

name: Blast Scepter
description: This rare, ancient device is one of the more unpleasant legacies of lost Netheril.

name: Eye of Accuracy
description: Carved from the bones of a true marksman, this device temporarily confers the skill of that bone’s owner to the weapon it touches.

name: Stone of Shielding
description: When crushed, this chalky stone provides its holder with powerful defensive magic—at least for a little while.

name: Ring of Trobriand
description: This old, heavy iron band is free of rust. It bears a tiny etching of what appears to be a scorpion tail.

name: Avandra’s Boon of Storms
description: Like an ocean storm, change is both inevitable and rarely controllable. To those who embrace change rather than fight it, Avandra occasionally grants the power to influence events.

name: Aboleth Slime
description: This cloudy sludge racks your enemy’s body with pain and unwelcome transformation.

name: Longbreath
description: The refreshing air inside this container fills your lungs far more fully than its volume would suggest.

name: Pacification Dust
description: This powder of fungal spores renders those caught in it sluggish.

info.Description: Giant reptiles roam the Talenta Plains. Long ago, the halflings who live and hunt these lands domesticated these beasts for use as steeds. Of these creatures, carvers and clawfoots are the most common. Both are bipedal drakes equipped with razor-sharp talons and terrible teeth. They are ideal mounts for war and travel. The halflings also make use of a slightly smaller beast known as the fastieth. Bred for speed, it can keep pace with a common riding horse in spite of its slight size.

name: Phantom Ink
description: The dark fluid within this small ceramic bottle glows dimly in torchlight.

name: Stone Eater
description: Pouring the contents of this jar onto stone causes the material to begin dissolving.

name: Violet Phosphor
description: Vigorously agitating this small, transparent vial causes the liquid inside to emit a soft purple glow.

name: Thundercloud Tower
description: This fortified three-story tower floats atop a semisolid thundercloud.

name: Powered Armor
description: The armor appears to have been worked to create the illusion of a heavily muscled humanoid.

name: Blaster Rifle
description: This item consists of jointed metal rods, a curved metal plate, a hardened leather band, and a pane of glass framed and mounted on the end of a rod.
critical:: +1d8 fire and necrotic damage per plus

name: Chainsaw Sword
description: A series of rings and chains line the blade. These chains begin to move on their own after a few pulls of a loose string attached to the hilt.

name: Laser Pistol
description: This item resembles a heavy wristband that sports two projections. One ends in a black leather grip, the other in a smooth, cone-shaped red jewel.

name: Needler Pistol
description: This odd device looks like a potion bottle or a flask that is strapped to a number of tubes.

name: Confusion Ray
description: A metal pole, about 1 foot long, ends in a spinning, multicolored disk. A switch on the end of the pole controls the spinning rate of the disk, and this switch is warm to the touch.

info.Description: Giant reptiles roam the Talenta Plains. Long ago, the halflings who live and hunt these lands domesticated these beasts for use as steeds. Of these creatures, carvers and clawfoots are the most common. Both are bipedal drakes equipped with razor-sharp talons and terrible teeth. They are ideal mounts for war and travel. The halflings also make use of a slightly smaller beast known as the fastieth. Bred for speed, it can keep pace with a common riding horse in spite of its slight size.

name: Blue Communicator
description: This glowing blue device resembles a tooth. Do not place it in your mouth.

name: Jet Pack
description: A metallic pack clasps around one’s middle, and it projects flame directly underneath the wearer.

name: Gray Security Card
description: This gray rectangle resembles a heavy leaded pane of colored glass.

name: Wheely Sled
description: This sheet of solid metal sits on four wheels and is long enough for one person to lie down on it. A number of levers and switches are accessible from the sides.

name: Singularity Grenade
description: The size of a large fruit, this device is a polished white color, as if made of ivory. In the center is a hole made of pure blackness that seems to spin.

name: Sleep Grenade
description: This device is about the size of a large apple, with indentations all around that are suitable for grasping.

name: Dimension Hoops
description: Each of these thin metal rings is approximately one foot in diameter. An emerald crystal slides freely around each hoop.

name: Evasion Shard
description: This amber crystal warms quickly before drifting slowly from your grip to float overhead.

name: Greater Sleep Grenade
description: This device is the size of a large apple, with indentations suitable for grasping.

name: Nautiloid
description: An opalescent nautilus shell houses a sluglike creature with fine tentacles. It radiates a sense of comfort.

info.Description: Genasi mix steel with magic volcanic glass to create resilient crysteel armor.
The national symbol of Aundair, dragonhawks are used by the Knights Arcane and other military organizations. Although generally not for sale, they can be found on the black market.

name: Portal Gun
description: This elongated device resembles an armless crossbow with two handles. Blue energy shimmers over its surface, which is set with multicolored studs that periodically rise and recede.

name: Stimulant Injector
description: A small grip is affixed to a narrow tube containing a bubbling blue liquid. A narrow hole at one end houses a small gleaming object.

name: Standard of Taraskir
description: The banner unfurls with a roar to reveal a stylized lion’s head in red against a gold background.

name: Belled Branch
description: This silver tree branch, strung with tiny golden bells, hangs from a simple chain. It allows safe prayer in the heat of battle.

name: Hamadryad Egg
description: This egg-shaped white stone has a carving of an oak leaf that turns green when a worshiper of Silvanus uses it as a holy symbol.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, +1d8 damage per plus against aberrant creatures

name: Rose Scythe of Chauntea
description: This sturdy but worn scythe is carved with images of wheat sheaves, and the blade bears the image of a single rose.

name: Nature's Fervor
description: Defeating monsters that corrupt the natural world fills you with zeal, enabling you to carry on the righteous battle.

name: Focusing Astral Helm
description: This gem-encrusted wheel bolsters its host astral ship and enhances the magical powers of the pilot.

info.Description: Native to the Talenta Plains, the glidewing is a flying reptile with a thin head crest and tufts of brightly colored feathers. Halflings use glidewings for scouting and for monitoring the migratory patterns of animal herds throughout the region.

name: Moonbane
description: The ancestral weapon of the Markelhay family has ties to the Feywild and gleams with a light like the moon.

name: Torc of Justice
description: This golden neckband is inscribed with the mantra of Bahamut: Protect the weak, and bring justice to the wicked.

name: Potion of Feyspeak
description: This golden liquid looks like honey, but the gift it gives is far sweeter.

name: Amulet of Truth
description: Used in the Feywild to discover spies, the amulet reveals that all is not as it appears.

name: Charm of Making
description: Your song captures the breath of the world serpent, harnessing the power of life and knowledge into an omen of making.

name: Ease the Soul
description: Your song brings solace to a tormented creature, releasing it from its suffering.

name: Restful Lullaby
description: After singing this short song, you and those around you feel rested and refreshed.

name: Song of Destruction
description: The cacophonous power of this song brings destruction to those who hear it. In the wake of its discordant melody, disaster follows.

name: Soothe the Savage Beast
description: This song lulls an animal into complacency with its dulcet tones.

name: Mimir
description: This small skull made of an unidentified metal floats near you, ready to respond to your inquiries.

info.Description: House Vadalis magically enhances natural creatures to breed superior versions. A magebred destrier is a superior steed valued for its endurance, intelligence, and speed.

name: Karach Armor
description: This armor molds itself to you when it is donned, then seems to shimmer and transmute as you move.

name: Modron Toy
description: This small toy is shaped like a rogue modron. You can manipulate it to bring forth its remarkable powers.

name: Belt of Righteous Blood
description: The buckle on this well-worn belt holds a tiny vial of thick reddish liquid, purported to be the blood of the virtuous.

name: Crimson Wick Ki Focus
description: This braided wick burns brightly when placed within an oil lamp and ignited, yet is unconsumed by the flame. It inspires you to use your own inner resources to best effect.

name: Dark Hunger Ki Focus
description: Runes are carved into the surface of this dire wolf fang. As you study its intricate markings, you can feel the savage beast begin to stir within you.

name: Phial of the Empty Vessel
description: This small hollow crystal bottle dangles from a simple leather cord. Its delicate appearance belies a strength you can feel coursing through your body.

name: Soul Siphon Ki Focus
description: This small onyx tablet is no larger than your hand, its surface engraved with lines of text.  It describes how to heed the signs that presage the death of your prey.

name: Portrait of Holding
description: This painting conceals a secure extradimensional space.

name: Eye of Allabar
description: This orb is an alien astrolabe that allows one to predict when evil stars will align.

info.Description: Famed as the fastest horses in all of Khorvaire, these animals are bred by the elves of Valenar to carry warriors across the battle field. A mounted Valenar elf is able to speed into the thick of combat, strike, and dart away.

name: Lucky Bag o'Bones
description: This leather pouch is filled with what appear to be common dice, made of bone and painted with black pips.

name: Four-Sided Caltrop
description: This small pyramid is carved from smoky quartz, but upon closer inspection, it appears to be filled with viscous liquid.

name: Midnight Sixes
description: These six-sided dice look innocent, but when rolled, they often come up a winner.

name: Gambler's Eight
description: This eight-sided die, carved from tourmaline, is painted with dwarven runes.

name: Raven Tens
description: This pair of ten-sided dice, carved from obsidian, is painted with two symbols: a raven’s talon, representing risk, and a raven’s head, representing reward.

name: Shape of the Multiverse
description: This dodecahedron, carved from amethyst, initially appears to have numbered sides. On second glance, stars and spirals swirl within it.

name: Stone of Detection
description: When placed on a flat surface, this twenty-sided die, carved from aquamarine, rolls of its own accord. It is decorated with the runic characters for happiness, hope, and danger.

name: Iron Flask
description: This metal urn, closed with an engraved brass stopper, is surprisingly heavy despite being small enough to fit into the palm of a human hand.

name: Embroidered Beast
description: A roaring monster faces you in the threads of this tapestry. As you speak the words of summoning, it leaps forth to challenge your enemies.

name: Hanging Doorway
description: This plain wall hanging illustrates a doorway, which a word of opening causes to become a true passage.

info.Description: Organic materials coated in cockatrice venom slowly turn to stone over the course of 4 hours. One dose is enough to turn a single, handheld object to stone.        Creatures in contact with the venom do not fully turn to stone, but the venom does petrify the surface area of a creature’s body that comes into contact with it, giving that area a stone-like appearance for a few minutes. Potters, sculptors, and other artisans who need to quickly set their work into a permanent state often use the venom.

name: Portable Gallery
description: The sumptuous chamber this tapestry depicts springs into existence when the tapestry is hung.

name: Arras of Thrilling Heroics
description: The scene of daring adventure woven into this tapestry inspires you as you look on it.

name: The Map Imperishable
description: The rich threads of this tasseled wall hanging show a map of the known world. Close inspection shows paths crisscrossing the map.

name: Hide of Plain Sight
description: This wall hanging is not woven, but rather consists of sheets of soft, vellum-like skins cunningly stitched together. The scene it depicts is tattooed with many-colored inks.

name: Mold King's CrownBlistering Corruption
description: This jagged iron crown seems remarkably unaffected by the ravages of time.

info.stage_0: : The target recovers from the disease.
info.stage_1: : While affected by this stage, the target takes a -2 penalty to Fortitude.
info.stage_2: : While affected by this stage, the target takes a -2 penalty to Fortitude. In addition, the target regains only half the normal number of hit points from spending a healing surge, and the target’s hit point total cannot exceed its bloodied value.
info.stage_3: : While affected by this stage, the target suffers the effects of stage 2 and has an aura 2 (poison) that cannot be deactivated. Any creature that ends its turn in the aura loses a healing surge.
info.check: : At the end of each extended rest, the target makes an Endurance check if it is at stage 1 or 2.

name: Pileus Helm
description: This helmet is made of a tough, fibrous material shaped like a mushroom cap, and it smells of soil.

name: Toadcackle
description: The fumes of this draught drive hags mad with pain and confusion.

name: Potion of Spectral Form
description: This thin liquid transforms you into a spectral apparition.

name: Brightblade
description: This splendid sword, crafted in the old dwarven style, is as deadly and beautiful as when it was first forged.

info.Description: Cold iron is anathema to fey, and such a creature imprisoned within these shackles cannot teleport. Otherwise, these shackles function like any other.

name: Rabbitslayer
description: Even the most absent-minded adventurer always finds this knife in its sheath.
critical:: +4d6 damage, or +4d10 damage if the attack was a Sneak Attack

name: Kender Spoon of Turning
description: Whether this item is truly a kender holy symbol or simply a piece of tableware, the spectacle of a diminutive kender waving a spoon at an undead monster is usually well worth the price of admission.
critical:: +3d10 damage, +3d10 radiant damage to undead creatures
requirement:: You must be a kender to use this item.

name: Wyrmslayer
description: This blade thirsts after the blood of dragons and dragonkin. When roused, its murderous desire is far from subtle.
critical:: +3d10 damage, +3d12 damage against draconians and dragons

name: Staff of Magius
description: A perfectly formed crystal sphere, clutched by three carved dragon claws, tops this handsome mahogany staff.

name: Staff of Mishakal
description: Though it appears as an ordinary wooden staff, this item reveals its true form—a gorgeous blue crystal staff, pulsing with life energy—when its divine powers are activated.
critical:: +2d6 radiant damage, +2d12 radiant damage to demons, undead, and devils

name: Dragonlance
description: A magnificent dragonmetal lance, shining with the holy light of the Platinum Dragon, is mankind’s ultimate weapon for fighting the Dark Queen’s forces.
critical:: +1d8 radiant damage per plus; +1d12 radiant damage per plus against draconians and dragons

name: Phylactery of Action
description: When tied around your arm, this black leather box lets your mind or body escape restraint.

name: Hyrsam Fiddle
description: This finely crafted fiddle bears a glamer that betrays its fey origin.

name: Hyrsam Fiddlestick
description: This finely crafted fiddlestick is carved from wood and woven with strands of mithral.

name: Horn of Revelry
description: This horn is crafted from five types of polished wood, fitted together via complicated grooves. It plays a unique sound that begs to be joined in harmonies.

name: Cloak of the Gargoyle
description: Although this dark gray garment flows like a heavy woolen cloak, it has the texture of cracked, aged stone. When you act aggressively while you wear it, your eyes glow red.

name: Aboleth Slime Concentrate
description: This sticky tar-like substance makes creatures vulnerable to psychic attacks.

name: Umber Dust
description: This black dust scintillates with an odd sheen in the light, causing your head to spin if you stare at it too long.

name: Heart of Mimic Powder
description: This green powder clumps when you squeeze it, behaving like a solid mass one moment and like a powder the next.

name: Mind Flayer Tentacle Extract
description: This purple fluid scrambles a creature’s brain functions, momentarily reducing it to a defenseless state.

name: ESP Medallion
description: The blue metal medallion hangs from a silver chain. In the center of it is an eye. The eye moves to look at the creature whose thoughts you wish to know.

name: Flame's Champion
description: This ornate longsword appears to be silver, and its decorations marks it as a weapon dedicated to the Silver Flame.
critical:: +3d8 fire and radiant damage per plus

name: Catastrophic Dragon Egg
description: With a cataclysmic roar, the egg fractures under the pressure of the elemental power within it.

info.Description: Gnome artists excel at crafting duplicates of creatures’ faces and making them into masks. Not actually magical in construction, a doppelganger mask is so well crafted that it makes its wearer resemble one particular creature, usually as designated by the artist’s patron. One of these masks attaches tightly to the face of any creature that dons it, allowing the wearer to perfectly adopt the features of the creature that the mask depicts. A creature wearing a doppelganger mask gains a +5 bonus to Bluff checks to disguise itself as the kind of creature the mask depicts, as long as the wearer’s body generally resembles that of such a creature.        A doppelganger mask tears apart when removed from the face, so each can be used only once. Spies and members of the Unseelie underworld often use them, and some masks make their way to criminal organizations in the natural world.

name: Howling Bandolier
description: This long baldric has many loops for small weapons, such as daggers.

name: Moretta Mask
description: This black velvet carnival mask melts easily into the shadows, pulling you along with it.

name: Arlecchina Mask
description: One kiss from whoever wears this mask can stop the heart.

name: Bauta Mask
description: This crimson facemask fills your mind with simmering bloodlust.

name: Pestarzt Mask
description: This strange leather mask protects you from the hellish fumes of the underworld.

name: Volto Mask
description: This beautifully crafted facemask gives your thoughts a clarity that no magic can deny.

name: Blood Apricot
description: A rich orange-red, this small fruit turns much darker if given a taste of blood.

name: Burning Bronze Rye
description: The smell of this spirit is enough to water your eyes and chase away any cold feelings in your extremities.

name: Foulbranch Seed
description: Wrapped in a sealed packet, this seed feels as if it’s about the length of your thumb.

name: Ghost Ale
description: This dark ale smells of musty soil, but it has a hint of something rich and inviting.

info.Description: This small fey animate, usually made of wood or cloth, is designed to entertain eladrin children. As with an ordinary puppet, its controller begins moving it by manipulating it with strings. Thereafter, a minor enchantment allows the puppet to continue to move on its own after the puppeteer releases the strings. If the puppet encounters blocking terrain, it randomly turns left or right and continues in the new direction. It does not stop until a creature within 5 squares of it commands it to do so in Elven.

name: Myconid Essence
description: This earthy-smelling oil pours slowly, and only strong food can cover its taste.

name: Sonata Wine
description: You cannot describe the scent or taste of this wine, which fills your head with beautiful music.

name: Shadewater
description: Whatever cold substance is in this stoppered stone flask, just touching it makes you a little sad.

name: Boots of Other Paths
description: These fine leather boots lead you down paths you might not normally take.

name: Candle of Tomorrow
description: This silver candle gives off a breathtaking light for the brief instant before it and the creatures around it vanish.

name: Dilatory Armor
description: Defensive gear bearing this enchantment seemingly resists initial signs of attack, until all its wear and tear catches up with it at once.

name: Egg of Death
description: This apparently empty eggshell feels cold to the touch.

name: Expeditious Tome
description: When you study this tome, time seems to fly.

name: Fugacious Stone
description: This unassuming pebble appears to momentarily duplicate itself in your hand, or to vanish altogether for a few seconds at a time.

name: Torc of the Younger Self
description: This cheap bronze ornament somehow reminds you of the days of your youth.

info.Description: Devious creatures that want to bait unwitting mortals into entering the Feywild for the first time use these tiny, charmed stones to cruel effect. When a creature takes a few stones from the bag and places them on the ground, a small gravel path springs up that looks like a well-traveled route leading in whatever direction the creature chooses. Once a route has been started, the stones in a bag can be used only for that route, and the rest of them must be laid continually. The path can be up to 5 miles long, provided the creature blazing the trail walks the entire distance, dropping the rest of the stones from time to time along the way. The path lasts for a day before it disappears; the area it described returns to the state it was in before the stones were used, and the stones become like any other ordinary rocks scattered in the wilderness.        Scouts in the wild use false path stones to create simple roads that make travel easier for those following behind them.

name: Weapon of Chronal Omission
description: This weapon sometimes appears to lag behind where you move it, or to lead your swing by scant inches.
critical:: +1d8 damage per plus, or recharge the item’s utility power

name: Observer's Ring
description: This ring is set with a hemispherical glass eyeball that looks around when it is worn.

name: Demonbinder
description: This handheld contraption glows in the presence of demons and traps portions of their essence.

info.Description: Weavemail is an exquisite armor made according to an advanced technique perfected in the eladrin courts of the Feywild, consisting of closely linked chains that provide few openings for enemy attacks.

Grapes grown in the Feywild are so lush that even when they are dried and made into raisins, the raisins retain most of the grapes’ essence and potential. When a feywine raisin is stirred into a goblet of water, the raisin dissolves and the mixture instantly ferments, creating wine.

info.Description: Found only near the Maze of Fathaghn, this rare flower emits a fragrance that instantly awakens a sleeping creature, even one in an enchanted slumber, as long as the enchantment was meant to last no longer than a day. The flower must be placed near the sleeper’s nose and pinched (a minor action) to release the fragrance. This act destroys the blossom and awakens the sleeper.

name: Flowers of the Summer Queen’s Gown

info.Description: As Queen Tiandra treads through Senaliesse, summer flowers bloom wherever the long train of her gossamer gown sweeps the ground. A flower brought to life in this manner blooms eternal in the Feywild, and its beauty never fades. Wherever the seeds of these flowers are scattered, even the hardest barren ground or frozen tundra blooms anew with flowers for one day.

info.Description: Many icicles hang from the Prince of Frost’s Fortress of Frozen Tears. These icicles, known themselves as frozen tears, are said to be sorrow made manifest. Even when they carried away from the prince’s demesne in the Vale of the Long Night, frozen tears do not melt, instead chilling any object or creature in contact with them. Although they aren’t cold enough to cause damage, frozen tears are fervently sought by Feywild merchants, who use them to keep perishable goods chilled during transport—a handy trick for bringing specialized food and drink to the courts to satisfy the refined appetites of the archfey.

info.Description: A garment of this sort, made from the substance of a rainy Feywild afternoon, is created through the performance of a minor ritual. The garment looks and feels like a normal wool cloak, except that it keeps its wearer completely dry in the rain. When the cloak is spread out on the ground, it becomes a puddle of pure rainwater. You can turn the pool back into a cloak again by grabbing the water (a minor action), or water can be taken from the pool using a cup or a similar vessel. Doing so gradually uses up the cloak’s material, making it shorter every time it reverts to a garment, until nothing is left of it after 2 gallons of its water are consumed.

info.Description: Courting eladrin sometimes apply a mixture of pixie dust and larkspur to their fine, silky hair, changing it to a new, vibrant hue. Spies from the Court of Stars or the Unseelie underworld often use such a concoction as part of a quick disguise, and the elders of eladrin royal houses use it to complement their rich fashions and contribute to their striking appearances. Some wild fey add a shapechanger’s eyelash to the mixture, causing their hair to change color every seventh heartbeat.        A single dose of one of these mixtures, collectively called the hair of fairy hues, can instantly alter the hair color of any individual. The new color lasts until the hair is washed in a still pond beneath the light of the moon, or until the hair grows out.

info.Description: This “box” appears to be an acorn shell. When the shell is opened, a childlike chorus of pixie voices sounds from within it for the next six hours, drifting gently on the wind. At the end of that time, the pixie music stops, leaving only a plain, hollow acorn. While the music is sounding, natural beasts won’t approach or attack anyone in the sound’s area (a 20-square radius), heeding the pixies’ beautiful song and staying away out of respect for those magical creatures.

info.Description: Rain sticks are crafted from tree branches by dryads, hags, and other fey in the wilderness. When a creature breaks a rain stick, the act creates a sudden downpour of rain in a half-mile radius that lasts up to one hour. If a stick is broken indoors or underground, the downpour occurs outside, centered above the location where the stick was broken.
Pitmail is derived from an infernal technique used to armor great commanders in the days of the tiefling empire of Bael Turath.

Denizens of the enchanted forest beneath the Summer Queen’s demesne of Senaliesse sometimes befriend petitioners that are on a journey to the Court of Stars. The fey reward the visitors with chrysanthemums, marking the travelers as friends of the fey. The gift also offers a degree of protection; mischievous fey such as gnomes, nymphs, and pixies refrain from tricking or tempting those who bear such a flower, which remains a beautiful bloom until the bearer leaves the Feywild.

info.Group: accurate wand is a smooth and straight length of light wood, honed to a point at the tip.
cinder wand, in contrast, is blackened and crooked, and warm to the touch.
dragontooth wand is smooth ivory that is bound with bands of gold.

info.Description: Harvested from the water snakes native to the coral reefs near Astrazalian, snake oil applied to aching joints and wrinkled flesh can rejuvenate an aging body. After a treatment of snake oil, the treated skin peels away from the body, leaving behind soft, smooth flesh. Full-body treatments of snake oil have been known to reverse the cosmetic effects of the aging process, removing an entire year of wear from the body with each treatment. The cost of doing so is a reasonable option only for the wealthy. Even though the treatment removes the physical effects of aging on the skin, as well as some of the associated aches and pains, all other bodily processes continue to age normally. Death cannot be put off by using snake oil, a fact seldom conveyed by those who sell it.

info.Description: Made from strands of fey spider silk, a spiderweb dream net is used to capture dreams for varied uses. While a creature sleeps, the net is placed over it, and the creature’s dreams are absorbed into the net’s filaments. When the creature awakens, the net can be boiled in a cauldron or other large vessel. The trapped dreams evaporate into steam that rises in wispy shapes, playing out the events of the dream for any to view.        Instead of boiling a net that has captured one creature’s dreams in this manner, the user of the net can cut it into small sections and consume a portion to experience the captured dreams directly, allowing the viewer to experience the same set of dreams over time. A dream experienced in this way is more intense and offers deeper insights about the dreamer. A dream that arises from a portion of a net being  consumed cannot be captured by another dream net.

info.Description: The star-indigo plant grows only in the wild fields of the Feywild. By day, the plant’s flowers resemble those of any other vegetation. In the twilight just after sunset, its flowers glow slightly. At midnight, gazing down on a field of star-indigo plants is like looking at the night sky in reverse, as its flowers shine  as brightly as the stars. Feywild creatures often arrange star-indigo seeds in symbols and messages that can be seen only in the dark of night. Dyes made from star-indigo plants pass their nocturnal glowing quality to clothing and ink, and an object colored with these dyes emits light equivalent to  that of a candle.

info.Description: Gnomes employed by the eladrin archfey known as the Prince of Hearts make this heart-shaped confection. It is split into two halves and shared between lovers right before they part company for a time. Until they next meet, the lovers share an emotional bond, each vaguely sensing the other’s emotions. Each can sense when the other is in peril, though the link doesn’t reveal precise details of the situation.

info.Description: This kit includes camouflaged clothing, cold-weather clothing, desert clothing, a map case, five pieces of signal ammunition, and snares. Many purchasers supplement this kit with icening.

This collection of simple hand tools, nails, and a measuring stick is often seen in the home of a city-dwelling crafter, but adventurers would do well to take a set of these tools along. With them you can perform minor repairs, fashion basic wooden or metal objects, or dismantle simple locks.

This handheld tool comes with six tough metal bits. A drill can bore a hole through wood, stone, and even some metals with enough time and effort. A typical bit can drill through 6 inches of stone or 2 inches of iron (a process requiring up to 6 hours) before it breaks or its cutting power is exhausted. Each additional set of bits costs another 10 gp.

The risk of drowning in a cold underground lake leads some adventurers to carry these containers of cured animal hide. A character can blow into a flotation bladder to inflate it and  then hang onto it to keep his or her head above water. If you’re using a flotation bladder, failing an Athletics check to swim by 5 or more leaves you treading water instead of sinking.
Drakescale armor mimics the small, close scales of rage drakes to stave off attacks.

This thin-bladed saw can cut through tough material, even metal, although doing so can be quite slow. Harder materials dull the blade quickly, so a hacksaw is best used to cut thin or small objects. A single hacksaw blade can cut through a 1-inch-thick piece of iron (or larger objects of softer materials, at the DM’s discretion) in up to 2 hours, before  it breaks or its cutting power is exhausted. Each additional blade costs another 5 gp.

A bull’s-eye lantern is equipped with a lens that enables it to project a beam of bright light 2 squares wide out to 10 squares. This way, you can illuminate long hallways without lighting up the whole area.

Put the mouth of this cone of pressed iron against a flat surface and place your ear against its flattened tip to amplify the sounds you might hear beyond. This item grants a +2 bonus to Perception checks to listen through doors and walls.

The finest mirrors are made of silvered glass and are prohibitively costly, so most adventurers favor these less expensive handheld disks of polished metal. A mirror can let you safely look around corners without being seen, avoid the direct gaze of a medusa, or reflect light to signal distant allies (or to lure enemies).

The materials in this scroll case enable you to transfer an image of ancient runes or carvings onto a different surface to be deciphered later. The case contains several thin sheets of parchment and a stick of soft charcoal. After placing a piece of parchment over the surface to be copied, rub the  charcoal against it while applying gentle pressure. With a standard action, you can make a rubbing covering 1 square foot. One kit contains enough material for ten such rubbings.

These red glass inserts let you reduce a lantern’s brightness without limiting the area it illuminates. The red glow is easier on the eyes, and it doesn’t attract as much attention as the bright light of an unfiltered flame. The light that passes through a ruby lens is dim, but its radius is unchanged.

With this sturdy tool you can dig through deep, dense, or unappetizing material to locate treasure (or bury your hard-won prizes for security), scoop up small objects that might be dangerous or unpleasant to handle, or clobber an enemy in a pinch.

These foot-long metal pincers are similar to those used in smithies. With them, you can manipulate objects at times when using your hands is too risky, such as when you’re reaching into a scalding brazier, an unknown liquid, or a dark hole.

Stitched onto this well-crafted leather shoulder harness are ten padded holsters that can hold doses of potions, poisons, and elixirs, ensuring easy access while cushioning them against accidental breakage.

With some foraged twine, a supple reed, simple pulleys, and a soft cloth bindle, a kobold can piece together a crude device for getting around obstacles. These hurler-snatchers, as kobolds call them, have long been used to fling objects across gaps safely and retrieve small items lost down narrow chasms.        Using a hurler-snatcher (4 lb., 10 gp) requires a move action. When you do so, you either transfer one item you have that weighs 5 pounds or less to an unoccupied space or a willing character within 5 squares of you, or you take one similar item that the character or the space has and transfer it to yourself. If you intend to transfer the item to a character, he or she has to have a free hand and must use a free action to catch it. Otherwise, the item lands in that character’s space.
Wyvernscale armor mimics the small, close scales of the wyvern to stave off attacks.
This kit is used by trapsmiths to lay their special traps.

The Court of Stars delights in sowing affection between unlikely partners, turning chaste men into wild philanderers or making predators fall for their prey. When a drop of this honeyed draught is applied to a subject’s lips, the victim falls madly in love with the next creature he or she sees, but only until the following morning.

The spiders of Brokenstone Vale weave a thread that can be seen only by the light of the moon. When the clouds part, these silvered webs glow as though painted with gleaming dewdrops. A spool of nightspider silk is strong as a length of wire but wholly invisible during the day.

Some brave hunters shadow owlbears in heat to track down the males. Centaurs are practiced in luring hormone-crazed owlbears into traps, and they can extract musk glands from a corpse in seconds.        A single whiff of owlbear musk is strong enough to bring an enchanted creature crashing back to reality, immediately ending any dazing, stunning, or dominating magical effects. Each pouch is good for three doses, after which its potency fades away.

When songs are sung in Senaliesse, the forests surrounding the city ring with beautiful echoes that emanate from the tattlebugs living in the trees. These scintillating beetles can mimic sound by rubbing their hind legs together.        The mimicry of adult tattlebugs is almost indistinguishable from the originator of the sound, so they’re often used as spying devices. When placed in sight of another of its kind, a tattlebug repeats everything it has heard in the last five minutes.

Stairs are far too pedestrian and time-consuming for the average tinker gnome. The gnomeflinger is a small catapult designed for rapid travel to and from upper floors in tall structures. The cost includes the system of nets and pads necessary to ensure a safe landing.

This unwieldy contraption can be mounted on a bed’s headboard. The user dials the desired wake-up time, and when that time arrives, bells and whistles sound. The napwrecker is notorious for going off at random times when improperly maintained.

The stewmatic is a labor-saving invention intended to prepare savory, hot meals from raw materials with a minimum of effort and without a fire. The user adds raw grains, meats, vegetables, and water to the stewmatic. An hour later, the machine delivers a steaming, tasteless—but nutritious and edible—glop into waiting bowls. The stewmatic feeds the same number of people that the raw materials would have.
This steam-powered vehicle built of wood and iron has the carrying capacity of a wagon, the overland speed of a warhorse, and the temperament and handling of a severely annoyed donkey.

info.Description: Metal rings woven together into a shirt, leggings, and a hood make up a suit of chainmail. Chainmail grants good protection, but it’s cumbersome, so it reduces your mobility and agility.        Magic appears at higher item levels, and grants higher armor bonuses than its mundane counterparts. Chainmail grants +8 AC at levels 11-15, +9 AC at levels 16-20, +10 AC at levels 21-25, and +12 AC at levels 26-30.
Stormscale armor resembles the storm gorgon’s hardened plating and incorporates elemental magic.
