name: Acrobat Boots
description: These enchanted boots enhance your acrobatic skills.

name: Acrobat's Harness
description: These cloth straps help you to twist and dive out of dangerous situations.

info.Description: Gith plate is hardened with psionic techniques originating with either the mind flayers or the first generation of escaped githyanki slaves.

name: Adamantine Cradle
description: Dull black metal lines this massive nest and shield inhabitants from danger.

name: Adamantine Plating
description: Binding heavy adamantine plates to your body gives you insurance against your enemies' attacks.
requirement:: You must have the living construct racial trait to use this item.

name: Adamantine Rod
description: Collected from meteor rock lodged within the world's crust, this metal makes rods that shine with a piercing light.

name: Adamantine Weapon
description: This glossy black weapon pierces the toughest shells.

name: Addergrease Armor
description: The worn leather of this armor gleams with toxic grease.

name: Advanced Delver's Training
description: Your extended forays into the Underdark have honed your senses and prepared you for nearly any situation.

name: Aecris Weapon
description: This magic weapon is inlaid with platinum. It has a line of three white diamonds set into the flat of its blade and a pommel carved to resemble the head of a noble dragon.

name: Aegis Blade
description: This blade allows you to place your aegis on all nearby foes with a single word of power.

name: Aegis Fang
description: This massive and magnificently fashioned dwarven warhammer is wrought from mithral, adamantine, and diamond.
critical:: +1d12 damage per plus, and the target is knocked prone

name: Aftershock Weapon
description: This weapon sends ripples of force toward nearby foes.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, and each enemy adjacent to the target of the critical hit is knocked prone.

info.Description: Specter plate is infused with energy from the Shadowfell.

name: Aggressive Weapon
description: Your latent psionic energy flows through this weapon, meting out increased damage to your foes.

name: Agile Armor
description: This armor's flexibility allows its wearer much greater freedom of movement.

name: Agile Resolve Vestments
description: These embroidered vestments channel your resolve to imbue you with agility.

name: Agony Beetle
description: These insidious beetles latch onto a creature's spine and cause excruciating pain.

name: Airstriders
description: These light coverings lift your feet and your spirit.

name: Alchemical Defense Nodes
description: Several slots melded to your surface can hold alchemical materials. The latent energy in the alchemical item suffuses the armor, providing protection against similar effects.
requirement:: You must have the living construct racial trait to use this item.

name: Alchemical Failsafe
description: When you become too battered to continue fighting at full strength, this launcher located in your abdomen automatically triggers an alchemical item.
requirement:: You must have the living construct racial trait to use this item.

name: Alchemical Launcher
description: This springloaded armpiece fires alchemical items with great accuracy and without exposing you to attack.
requirement:: You must have the living construct racial trait to use this item.

name: Alchemical Silver
description: This shimmering liquid clings to a weapon, giving it the appearance of brightly polished silver.

info.Description: Legion plate mimics the forging techniques used in the Nine Hells to armor legion devils.

name: Alchemist's Acid
description: When shattered, this glass vial releases a spray of acid.

name: Alchemist's Fire
description: When shattered, this flask fills an area with alchemical flame.

name: Alchemist's Frost
description: This ceramic flask explodes in an icy haze when it hits, crippling its target with numbing cold.

name: Alchemist's Spark
description: The shattered flask releases two clouds that quickly coalesce and release a dazzling blast of energy.

name: Alchemy Gloves
description: When you use an alchemical item, these gloves charge it with magical power.

name: Aldron's Firebox
description: This small box is made of darkly stained pine with a number of arcane symbols branded into the side.

name: Alfsair Spear
description: This spear is a favorite druid weapon.
critical:: +1d8 psychic and poison damage per plus

name: All-Seeing Eye
description: This multifaceted diamond is usually placed in the eye socket of a statue or an idol, or atop a tripod that overlooks a room. It sees all and reports back to its master what it learns.

info.Description: Tarrasque plate, designed to emulate the tarrasque’s impenetrable hide, has hundreds of nodules packed between very thin metal layers, each treated with a different process.

name: Alliance Band
description: This silver ring is inset with complex interlocking decorations and provides healing to your allies.

name: Alluring Veil
description: This gossamer veil conceals your features and augments your glamour.

name: Amber MonkeysAmber Monkey
description: : The three monkeys in this figurine are carved from a single piece of amber, all stacked up in a column. The top monkey has its hands over its eyes, the middle monkey has its hands over its ears, and the bottom monkey has its hands over its mouth. Each monkey wears a leering expression that would be amusing if it wasn’t so sinister.               A mad wizard driven into exile in the Feywild carved the first amber monkeys in his jungle stronghold. Known for his wild simian slaves, he used them to wreak havoc on the enemies haunting his domain. Legend holds he bound the spirits of his most loyal servants into the figurine so that he could call upon them whenever he needed.

name: Amethyst Band of Invisible Eyes
description: This band of pristine amethyst is favored by spellcasters seeking indirect targeting capability.

name: Amulet of Adept Movements
description: This plain charm grants you the quickness to slip past your enemies in the heat of combat.

name: Amulet of Aranea
description: This neck charm protects you from poison even as it cripples your enemies with a venomous rebuke.

name: Amulet of Attenuation
description: This crude trinket has a rubbery shell that briefly toughens the skin.

name: Amulet of Bodily Sanctity
description: This heart-shaped ruby keepsafe is set in a gold cage.

name: Amulet of Double Fortune
description: Good luck begets even better luck when you wear this amulet.

info.Description: Barding is armor for your mount. It adds to a mount’s Armor Class just as armor does to a character’s. Barding also has similar check penalties and speed penalties. The barding’s armor bonus is added to a creature’s existing AC. Unlike heavy armor, heavy barding does not negate a mount’s Dexterity or Intelligence bonus to AC. Creatures that fill the soldier role already have additional armor (natural or otherwise) factored into their AC. As such, barding is less effective for them.        Magic barding can be crafted with its own unique properties. However, magic barding cannot be enchanted with an  enhancement bonus like normal armor. Most creatures already benefit from natural defenses that exceed those of a typical PC.

name: Amulet of Elusive Prey
description: White ash, oak, and bloodwood are carved in concentric circles and scorched with an X mark to ward off attacks.

name: Amulet of False Life
description: This dark blue amulet with a crimson center increases your defenses and can be activated to grant you temporary hit points.

name: Amulet of Health
description: This golden amulet increases your defenses and resists poison.

name: Amulet of Inner Voice
description: This clear diamond charm helps you shake off mental control.

name: Amulet of Life
description: Crafted in orum, and in the shape of a stylized sun, this amulet flairs with amber light whenever it's used.

name: Amulet of Material Darkness
description: Shadows congregate around the wearer of this onyx amulet.

name: Amulet of Mental Resolve
description: Your mind is guarded when wearing this cold iron talisman.

name: Amulet of Physical Resolve
description: This striking amulet wards you against effects that leave you physically debilitated.

name: Amulet of Protection
description: This light blue amulet increases your defenses.

name: Amulet of Psychic Interference
description: A shrunken head carved from bone hangs from a rough twine. It animates and cackles madly when you call on its power.

info.Description: Overlapping pieces of highly durable material, such as steel or even dragon scales, make up scale armor. Despite its heaviness, scale is surprisingly easy to wear; its straps and buckles make it adjustable and able to fit snugly on the body, allowing for flexibility and agility.        Magic appears at higher item levels, and grants higher armor bonuses than its mundane counterparts. Scale armor grants +8 AC at levels 6-10, +9 AC at levels 11-15, +10 AC at levels 16-20, +11 AC at levels 21-25, and +13 AC at levels 26-30.

Barding is armor for your mount. It adds to a mount’s Armor Class just as armor does to a character’s. Barding also has similar check penalties and speed penalties. The barding’s armor bonus is added to a creature’s existing AC. Unlike heavy armor, heavy barding does not negate a mount’s Dexterity or Intelligence bonus to AC. Creatures that fill the soldier role already have additional armor (natural or otherwise) factored into their AC. As such, barding is less effective for them.        Magic barding can be crafted with its own unique properties. However, magic barding cannot be enchanted with an  enhancement bonus like normal armor. Most creatures already benefit from natural defenses that exceed those of a typical PC.

name: Amulet of Resolution
description: Whether the affliction be of mind or body, this mithral necklace gives you a second chance to ward it off.

name: Amulet of Scales
description: A fetish made from dragon scales and claws.

name: Amulet of Seduction
description: Supposedly containing the tears of succubi, this glittering golden amulet can turn a foe's heart toward you and against itself.

name: Amulet of Vigor
description: This silver amulet bears an engraved prayer for health and healing on its back.

name: Amulet of Warding
description: Polished to a mirror finish, this bronze disk reflects light upon those closest to you, warding them against danger.

name: Amulet of the Diplomat
description: This subtle, but pleasing looking amulet gives the wearer a confident and soothing manner.

name: Amulet of the Unbroken
description: Encrusted with vibrant rubies that flash when it is used, this magnificent amulet proves that some heroes never say die.

name: Anakore
description: The hide of burrowing aberrants helps you resist being held in one place and avoid the risks that come with lack of mobility.

name: Anarch Sphere
description: The essence of the Elemental Chaos boils and churns in this massive sphere. The condensed power inside this unwieldy 10-foot diameter globe can be siphoned in many ways, though only a few have been discovered.

Most creatures already benefit from natural defenses that exceed those of a typical PC.

name: Anathema Weapon
description: This weapon shines in the presence of an aberrant menace, dealing greater damage to such enemies.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d8 damage per plus against aberrant creatures

name: Anchoring Armor
description: Those who try to move close to you without warning are caught by the magic of this heavy armor.
augment_1:: The creature is immobilized and cannot teleport (save ends both).

name: Andropinis's Authority
description: Andropinis claims to have been elected, but that event exerts no conditions on his dominion. Loyal retainers can be vested with a measure of his boundless authority.

name: Angelsteel Armor
description: The links in this armor glow with the silvery light of the Astral Sea.

name: Angelsteel Shield
description: This fine, steel shield flickers with light that flows out at times to help defend your allies.

name: Ankhmon's Bracers
description: These platinum bracers are engraved with a symbol of an eye wreathed in flames.

name: Anklets of Opportunity
description: When your foe is distracted by an ally, these glittering anklets quicken your step.

name: Anointed Mace
description: This steel mace is scribed with several runes of divine power. One side of its crushing end is marked with a rune of life, the other with a rune of final endings for the restless dead.

name: Anstruth Harp
description: Named for an ancient college of bardic learning, this small, elegant harp holds mighty powers of healing.
critical:: 5d6 extra damage on a critical hit.

name: Answerer
description: Its name engraved in the weapon's blade, Answerer ensures you have the last word in battle.

Most creatures already benefit from natural defenses that exceed those of a typical PC.

name: Antipathy Gloves
description: Use these gloves to keep your enemies at bay.

name: Antivenom
description: This thick tonic can help counter the effects of most poisons.

name: Aqueous Armor
description: Cold to the touch, this armor always appears damp. A person wearing the armor can transform into water, but at a cost.

name: Arcane Key
description: Using this silver key when performing Arcane Lock allows you to seal the door from afar.

name: Arcane Laboratory
description: Spirits of past arcane masters are bound to this well-equipped laboratory. Their aid allows you to refocus your magic for other purposes.

name: Arcanist's Glasses
description: These spectacles increase your sensitivity to the subtle patterns of magic.

name: Architect's Staff
description: Stylized architectural and elemental motifs adorn this staff, which helps you control spells that create barriers or change terrain.

name: Arkhosian Scepter
description: This silver scepter has a dragon's head carved at one end. Its magic focuses and enhances the power of your dragon breath.

name: Armblade
description: This serrated sword blade fits snugly over one of your arms.
weapon:: Heavy blade or  light blade (attached component)
requirement:: You must have the living construct racial trait to use this item.

name: Armbow
description: This magic crossbow generates its own bolts.
requirement:: You must have the living construct racial trait to use this item.

info.Description: The feathers of avian creatures on Athas, such as the carrion-eating kestrekel and the vulturelike aarakocra, are woven into cloth armor to give it masterwork quality. More advanced cloth armor is spun from crystal spider silk, giant hair, or silk wyrm thread.

name: Armor of Adaptable Resistance
description: This armor adapts to the attacks made against you, refocusing its protective power to keep you alive.
augment_1:: The armor's resistance increases by 5 until the end of your next turn.

name: Armor of Aegis Expansion
description: Flecks of magical force swirl around this light armor, coalescing to deflect attacks against you and your companions.

name: Armor of Attraction
description: This stout armor can attract projectiles, allowing you to better protect your allies.

name: Armor of Cleansing
description: The exterior of this armor is covered with symbols of healing, while the interior has many silken bands that cradle you comfortably and move to ease your suffering.

name: Armor of Dark Deeds
description: Swirling with shadows, this armor masks you from your enemies.

name: Armor of Dark Majesty
description: This armor is studded with gleaming, brass studs that flicker with hellish energies when you cast a spell.

name: Armor of Durability
description: When your allies rely on you to keep fighting, this armor helps keep you in the fray.

name: Armor of Dwarven Vigor
description: This armor, which appears to be crafted of chiseled stone, grants you the endurance of a dwarf warrior.

name: Armor of Enduring Health
description: While wearing this armor, you can draw more deeply on your inner resources.

name: Armor of Essence Inviolate
description: The strength of your unending spirit surges through this armor, reinforcing your defenses when you call upon it.

info.Description: The feathers of avian creatures on Athas, such as the carrion-eating kestrekel and the vulturelike aarakocra, are woven into cloth armor to give it masterwork quality. More advanced cloth armor is spun from crystal spider silk, giant hair, or silk wyrm thread.

name: Armor of Exploits
description: The arcane symbols etched into this armor's surface glow brightly as the item unleashes a previously stored power.

name: Armor of Eyes
description: The eyes carved on this heavy armor constantly watch for incoming attacks.

name: Armor of Negation
description: A wearer of this armor need not fear suffering the adverse effects of an enemy's missed attack.

name: Armor of Night
description: In this armor, you can drown the light and conceal yourself in roiling clouds of shadow.

name: Armor of Resistance
description: Special wards in this armor provide extra resistance.

name: Armor of Sacrifice
description: These plain robes offer no apparent defensive value, yet they aid your allies when they suffer.

name: Armor of Shared Health
description: This golden chainmail glows with divine energy that heals you when you help others.

name: Armor of Shared Valor
description: When you exhort your allies to find courage, you find it yourself.

name: Armor of Starlight
description: Bathed in the radiance of distant stars, this armor protects against light that would harm you. The stars' light also shields you from attack.

name: Armor of Sudden Recovery
description: You shrug off deadly conditions easily in this supple armor.

info.Description: The feathers of avian creatures on Athas, such as the carrion-eating kestrekel and the vulturelike aarakocra, are woven into cloth armor to give it masterwork quality. More advanced cloth armor is spun from crystal spider silk, giant hair, or silk wyrm thread.

name: Armor of Transport
description: Crystals woven into this armor flare when you're attacked, spiriting you a short distance away. By channeling more power to the crystals, you can take your friends with you.
augment_1:: You also teleport each ally adjacent to your starting space to different squares adjacent to your destination space.

name: Artificer's Belt
description: This multipocketed belt charges your healing infusions with potent power.

name: Ashurta's Blade
description: This byeshk spike can change size and shape into several bladed forms. It is deadly against aberrant creatures.
weapon:: Broadsword, dagger, longsword, shuriken or  short sword
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, +1d10 damage per plus against aberrant creatures

name: Assassin's Cloak
description: This voluminous cloak swallows you up, deadening the sounds you make and concealing your movements.

name: Assassin's Slippers
description: You are able to press your advantage from several angles while wearing these black chamois slippers.

name: Assassin's Weapon
description: A favored weapon of rogues and assassins, this plain-looking blade contains the power to afflict victims with a deadly poison.

name: Assassinbane Armor
description: Decorated with symbols resembling stylized eyes, this armor prevents foes from getting the drop on you.

name: Assault Boots
description: These mail boots trip up a foe when you strike a grievous blow.

name: Assured Wand of Frostburn
description: Your ability to use the frostburn power exceeds the normal boundaries of chance, allowing you an extra measure of confidence.

info.Description: The feathers of avian creatures on Athas, such as the carrion-eating kestrekel and the vulturelike aarakocra, are woven into cloth armor to give it masterwork quality. More advanced cloth armor is spun from crystal spider silk, giant hair, or silk wyrm thread.

name: Assured Wand of Howl of Doom
description: When using the howl of doom power, your knowledge reaches beyond probability and you can manipulate a small fraction of luck and destiny.

name: Astral Mead
description: This sweet sparkling beverage infuses and restores your body.

name: Astral Redoubt Totem
description: Each string of this dream-catcher totem records a leg of Rolant's journey across the Astral Sea, including a refuge along the path.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, and you regain hit points equal to twice the totem’s enhancement bonus.

name: Athasian Spellshard
description: This shard of obsidian or crystal can be imbued with magical knowledge.

name: Augmenting Whetstone
description: This rough sharpening stone temporarily grants your weapon a magical enhancement.

name: Aura Killer Weapon
description: The dark purple magic trailing in this weapon's wake shuts down your enemy's subtle spells and instinctive powers.

name: Austere Dojo
description: This dojo is complete with punching bags, a weapon rack, fencing equipment, and training automatons impressed with the personalities of history's greatest masters. Working with them allows you to refocus your fighting style.

name: Autumn Harvest Totem
description: This totem is fashioned from leaves and bone shards. It embodies the spirit of autumn and the inevitability of death.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d10 damage per plus against a bloodied creature

info.Description: The feathers of avian creatures on Athas, such as the carrion-eating kestrekel and the vulturelike aarakocra, are woven into cloth armor to give it masterwork quality. More advanced cloth armor is spun from crystal spider silk, giant hair, or silk wyrm thread.

name: Avalanche Boots
description: These heavy leather boots are covered in thick rock dust, and will not clean off no matter how well they are scrubbed.

name: Avalanche Hammer
description: Enchanted with the essence of elemental earth, this hammer strikes foes like an avalanche.
critical:: +1d10 damage per plus, and the target is knocked prone.

name: Avalanche's Wake Totem
description: Your spirit companion draws power from this jagged stone totem to become as unstoppable as a landslide.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, and you push the target 1 square per plus.

name: Avandra's Blessing of Confidence
description: Individuals blessed by Avandra gain an indomitable confidence in their own capabilities, allowing them to call upon their inner strength to augment themselves.

name: Avandra's Boon of Escape
description: Gambits that rely on luck and crushing blows against oppressors draw boons from Avandra. Individuals blessed by her are impossible to corner.

name: Avandra's Ring
description: This loose-fitting ring grants you the power to ignore effects that would constrain you.

name: Avandra's Whisper
description: Followers of Avandra use these blades to channel her powers of luck.

name: Avenging Ash Totem
description: The ashes staining the totem remind you of civilization's ravages against nature.

name: Aversion Staff
description: While you wield this staff, any foe afflicted by your powers is reluctant to attack you.

name: Awakening Armor
description: This plain-looking armor lets you foresee ambushes.

info.Description: The feathers of avian creatures on Athas, such as the carrion-eating kestrekel and the vulturelike aarakocra, are woven into cloth armor to give it masterwork quality. More advanced cloth armor is spun from crystal spider silk, giant hair, or silk wyrm thread.

name: Awe of the Dragon's Altar
description: You have stood before the Dragon's Altar, felt the residue of the great beast's passing, and come away changed. For a time, you carry with you a fragment of the power wielded by the Dragon of Tyr.

name: Axe of Sundering
description: This heavy axe looks battered and old, but the slightest touch shows that its cutting edge is sharp and true.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +10 damage per plus against objects and animates

name: Backbone Belt
description: Coupled with your second wind, this belt helps you stay in the fight longer.

name: Backlash Tattoo
description: Boars, sharks, and other creatures that enter a frenzy when wounded are used for this tattoo.

name: Backtrack Bindings
description: This airy footwear carries you out of whatever trouble you' ve gotten yourself into.

name: Badge of the Berserker
description: This fearsome badge, crafted from bits of bone and leathery flesh, is favored by those who savor taking the fight to the enemy.

name: Baffling Cape
description: This rippling cape allows you to slip past an attacking foe.

name: Bag of Holding
description: This item appears to be a simple sack of brown canvas.

name: Bahamut's Golden Canary
description: These harmless-seeming canaries are gold dragons in disguise.

name: Bahamut's Protective Ward
description: Bahamut grants his boon to heroes who shield the weak from the strong. Individuals who fight in Bahamut's name are beacons of hope and protection.

info.Description: The leather armors of Athas are made from a variety of desert creatures. The tougher and more dangerous creatures provide skins for masterwork armor. Domesticated animals such as the inix, the baazrag, and the jhakar produce fine leathers. An armorer set on making more fantastic protective gear, such as that from the skin of a cloud ray, a drake, or a floating mantle, is hard-pressed to assemble the necessary materials.

name: Baldric of Assault
description: This gray leather baldric lets you supplant your enemy when you use your aegis of assault.

name: Baldric of Dividing Ranks
description: Foot soldiers ineffectually stumble aside as you stride through battle wearing this baldric.

name: Baldric of Shielding
description: This marcasite-studded baldric aids you when you use your aegis of shielding.

name: Baldric of Tactical Positioning
description: This belt gives you greater command of the battlefield by helping you keep your enemies off-balance.

name: Baldric of Time
description: When you slip on this belt, you feel a brief lurch as the march of time seems to skip a beat.

name: Baldric of Valor
description: You feel the power of this belt inspiring you to hit your foes with everything you have even as its aegis protects you from your enemies’ counterattacks.

name: Bands of Equilibrium
description: These bracers are made from bands of the ivory tusks and layers of the snakelike hide taken from the legendary Beast of Talgora.

name: Bane's Collar
description: Your mind shrugs off the control of others while you wear this bright steel collar, but an ally pays the price.

name: Banquet Ring
description: Monarchs, and those who fear what might be in their food, treasure these gaudy, gem-encrusted baubles.

info.Description: The heaviest type of armor, made up of shaped plates of metal or similarly resilient material, plate provides the most armor protection. The cost for its superior fortification is mobility and agility.        Magic appears at higher item levels, and grants higher armor bonuses than its mundane counterparts. Plate armor grants +9 AC at levels 6-10, +10 AC at levels 11-15, +11 AC at levels 16-20, +12 AC at levels 21-25, and +14 AC at levels 26-30.

The leather armors of Athas are made from a variety of desert creatures. The tougher and more dangerous creatures provide skins for masterwork armor. Domesticated animals such as the inix, the baazrag, and the jhakar produce fine leathers. An armorer set on making more fantastic protective gear, such as that from the skin of a cloud ray, a drake, or a floating mantle, is hard-pressed to assemble the necessary materials.

name: Barbed Baldric
description: Hooked metal barbs spring from this belt on command, making it dangerous for anyone to grab you.

name: Bard's Songblade
description: This simple blade whistles as you whip it through the air, creating melodic tones with every swipe.

name: Bard's Songbow
description: This simple bow produces beautiful sounds when you pluck its string.

name: Barkskin Armor
description: The enchantment placed upon this armor toughens the material and provides it with a rough texture like tree bark.

name: Barrage Bracers
description: While you wear these bracers, when you attack rapidly, you can focus more power into your attacks.

name: Barulg's Magma Weapon
description: This hammer shifts slowly, as though its surface were gently flowing lava.
critical:: +1d6 fire damage per plus, and the target takes ongoing 15 fire damage (save ends).

name: Bashing Shield
description: This stout shield can be used to force your opponents back.

name: Basilisk Helm
description: This helm, carved to resemble a basilisk, can be activated to immobilize an enemy.

name: Bastion Armor
description: This blocky armor, usually crafted in the dwarven style, is a favorite of dwarven defenders.

name: Battering Weapon
description: This hammer rumbles with seismic power.

info.Description: The leather armors of Athas are made from a variety of desert creatures. The tougher and more dangerous creatures provide skins for masterwork armor. Domesticated animals such as the inix, the baazrag, and the jhakar produce fine leathers. An armorer set on making more fantastic protective gear, such as that from the skin of a cloud ray, a drake, or a floating mantle, is hard-pressed to assemble the necessary materials.

name: Battle Harness
description: Attack first, have your weapons ready, keep your vitals safe—this armor does it all.

name: Battle Spirit Weapon
description: Infused with the sprit of a savage warrior, this weapon gives you ghostly powers when charging.
weapon:: Axe, flail, hammer, heavy blade, mace or  spear
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d10 damage per plus on a charge

name: Battle Staff
description: This steel-shod staff is useful for staff wielders who prefer to get into the thick of battle.

name: Battle Standard of Healing
description: This white flag is emblazoned with sigils of healing that restore the vitality of you and your allies.

name: Battle Standard of Might
description: This flag is marked with martial runes that inspire strength in you and your allies.

name: Battle Standard of Shadow
description: This silky black flag becomes insubstantial as you raise it, a field of shadow spreading out from it to cover the battlefield.

name: Battle Standard of Tactics
description: This long pennant swirls even in still air as it carries your thoughts to your allies.

name: Battle Standard of the Fiery Legion
description: Swirling with animated flames, this flag lets you and your allies draw on the power of fire.

name: Battle Standard of the Hungry Blade
description: This black pennant bears the symbol of the hungry blade: an axe head with a toothy maw that resembles the silhouette of a dragon's head.

info.Description: The leather armors of Athas are made from a variety of desert creatures. The tougher and more dangerous creatures provide skins for masterwork armor. Domesticated animals such as the inix, the baazrag, and the jhakar produce fine leathers. An armorer set on making more fantastic protective gear, such as that from the skin of a cloud ray, a drake, or a floating mantle, is hard-pressed to assemble the necessary materials.

name: Battle Standard of the Stalwart
description: This silver and blue banner heightens both courage and resilience.

name: Battle Standard of the Tides
description: This blue flag ripples in a wind of its own, as ghostly water fountains whirl protectively around you and your allies.

name: Battle Standard of the Vanguard
description: The martial runes emblazoned on this bold banner grant combat prowess to those who rally beneath it.

name: Battle-Pact Rod
description: This heavy cudgel can be used as both a warlock's rod and a weapon.

name: Battlecrazed Weapon
description: The weapon seeks blood where it can be found, whether among the enemy or from its wielder.

name: Battleforged Armor
description: The dwarves and the dragonborn argue over which race invented this enchanted armor.

name: Battleforged Shield
description: Covered in Dwarven and Draconic runes, this shield aids badly wounded allies.

name: Battlemaster's Weapon
description: This weapon lets you reuse exhausted powers.

name: Battlestrider Greaves
description: This enchanted leg armor increases your speed when wearing heavy armor.

info.Description: The leather armors of Athas are made from a variety of desert creatures. The tougher and more dangerous creatures provide skins for masterwork armor. Domesticated animals such as the inix, the baazrag, and the jhakar produce fine leathers. An armorer set on making more fantastic protective gear, such as that from the skin of a cloud ray, a drake, or a floating mantle, is hard-pressed to assemble the necessary materials.

name: Beacon of Erathis
description: Taking the form of a cog alight with the flame of hope, this holy symbol brings light to the darkness.

name: Bear Spirit Armor
description: Crafted from bear hide and stitched with invocations to the beast's spirit, this armor rewards fury with a bear's endurance.

name: Beastbane
description: This rod of fast-burning incense creates a haze of smoke that holds beasts at bay.

name: Beastlord Armor
description: Made from animal skins and pelts, this armor is adorned with horns, teeth, and claws and makes any beast think twice before attacking the wearer.

name: Bed of Rapid Rest
description: This comfortable bed speeds your rest but is too large to cart around in the dungeon.

name: Beloved Performer
description: The people flock to the arena to witness your daring escapades and listen to your mocking wit.

name: Belt of Blood
description: This bloodstained belt helps you recover from serious injuries.

name: Belt of Breaching
description: Even as your foe falls, this plain leather belt sends you across the battlefield, refreshed and ready to fight on.

name: Belt of Endurance
description: Stitched from the hides of various animals, this belt gives you a beastly endurance.

info.Description: The leather armors of Athas are made from a variety of desert creatures. The tougher and more dangerous creatures provide skins for masterwork armor. Domesticated animals such as the inix, the baazrag, and the jhakar produce fine leathers. An armorer set on making more fantastic protective gear, such as that from the skin of a cloud ray, a drake, or a floating mantle, is hard-pressed to assemble the necessary materials.

name: Belt of Feral Might
description: This belt intensifies the rageblood that flows through your veins.

name: Belt of Fiends
description: This belt fills you with hellborn power and protects you from a devil's attacks.

name: Belt of Fitness
description: This well-made champion's belt lets you use your endurance to resist bodily harm.

name: Belt of Fragile Guard
description: This wide leather band toughens your skin but weakens your resilience.

name: Belt of Giant Strength
description: This rugged leather belt is inset with numerous chunks of polished gray stone. It improves your athletic skills and melee damage.

name: Belt of Lucky Strikes
description: When wearing this belt, you can hit when you need to.

name: Belt of Mountain Endurance
description: The steel buckle of this leather belt is engraved with the image of a mountain.

name: Belt of Nourishment
description: This comfortable leather belt is worked with images of foodstuffs that nourish you.

name: Belt of Raging Endurance
description: The amber glow spreading from this behemoth-hide belt swirls into the spirit aura of your rage, shielding you until the glow flares red.

name: Belt of Recovery
description: When you suffer a telling blow, this belt bolsters your defenses, giving you a moment to recover.

info.Description: Hide armors also are formed from the skins of various desert creatures. Less dangerous beasts such as the tembo and the kank provide materials for lower-level masterwork armors. The most advanced armors come from the hides of the Athasian roc and the nightmare beast.

name: Belt of Resilience
description: This common and well-worn belt aids those who aid you.

name: Belt of Sacrifice
description: This belt of leather allows you to help others heal.

name: Belt of Titan Strength
description: This rugged leather belt is inset with numerous chunks of polished obsidian. It greatly improves your athletic skills and melee damage.

name: Belt of Vigor
description: This chain metal belt improves your recuperative abilities.

name: Belt of Vim
description: You feel hale and hearty while wearing this wide belt.

name: Belt of Vitality
description: This belt helps you keep death at bay.

name: Belt of the Brawler
description: Your punch packs a wallop when this belt is about your waist.

name: Belt of the Flanker's Bane
description: When wearing this belt, a subtle shift of your weight is all you need to send a flanking enemy scrambling.

name: Belt of the Witch King
description: The links of this slim silver chain are separated by small spheres of arcane-enhanced obsidian.

info.Description: Hide armors also are formed from the skins of various desert creatures. Less dangerous beasts such as the tembo and the kank provide materials for lower-level masterwork armors. The most advanced armors come from the hides of the Athasian roc and the nightmare beast.

name: Bending Bullet
description: Whisper a direction to this warped bullet, and it bends around obstacles.

name: Benefactor Armor
description: The Khyber shards of this armor are set in a wave pattern, resembling flowing water.

name: Berserker Weapon
description: A weapon of pure rage.

name: Beryl of Catastrophe Avoidance
description: This blue gem hovers near your head, improving your ability to speak reasonably.

name: Bestial Armor
description: Crafted from the skin, fur, and bones of cave bears, this armor gives its wearer a feral relentlessness when pursuing prey.

name: Bilethorn Weapon
description: Poison covers the sleek surface of this weapon.

name: Black Cave Pearl
description: This rare black pearl is found in subterranean lakes and favored by mesmerists and hypnotists.

name: Black Dragon Bile
description: Distilled from the gullet of a black dragon, this caustic substance makes your foes more vulnerable to acid.

name: Black Feather of the Raven Queen
description: This onyx feather transforms the life force of a slain enemy into cold energy that can be unleashed upon another adversary.
requirement:: To use this symbol, You must worship the raven queen.

name: Black Iron Armor
description: The black metal of this armor glows red when violence flares.

info.Description: Hide armors also are formed from the skins of various desert creatures. Less dangerous beasts such as the tembo and the kank provide materials for lower-level masterwork armors. The most advanced armors come from the hides of the Athasian roc and the nightmare beast.

name: Black Lotus Extract
description: This thick oil is dark blue, though it becomes invisible when applied to a weapon or object.

name: Blackflock Robe
description: Wrapped in this tattered black cloth, you can briefly transform into a flock of ravens.

name: Blackgate Rune
description: This glossy black stone bears a complex sigil etched on its surface.

name: Blackleaf Gloves
description: Made from the leaves of an ancient Feywild oak, these wellpreserved black gloves increase the utility of your pact boon.

name: Blackshroud Weapon
description: Whenever this weapon snuffs out the life force of an enemy, it grants a boon in return.
weapon:: Axe, heavy blade or  light blade
critical:: Gain 1d8 temporary hit points per plus

name: Blacksmelt Weapon
description: This weapon can break through virtually any material.

name: Blade of Bahamut
description: Emblazoned with the holy symbol of Bahamut, this platinum blade empowers the wielder to unleash divine retribution upon  enemies while bolstering his or her allies.

name: Blade of Night
description: When the wielder of this blade strikes at an enemy's vulnerable spot, he magically blinds the target as well.
critical:: The target is blinded until the end of your next turn

name: Blade of Vengeance
description: Your foe's attack bites deep, but your counterstrike hits even harder.

name: Blade of the Eldritch Knight
description: Mystic runes shimmer along the length of this blade. The weapon enables you to attack a distant enemy.

info.Description: Hide armors also are formed from the skins of various desert creatures. Less dangerous beasts such as the tembo and the kank provide materials for lower-level masterwork armors. The most advanced armors come from the hides of the Athasian roc and the nightmare beast.

name: Blade of the Stalking Predator
description: This sickle is made from one of the talons of the legendary Beast of Talgora.
critical:: +1d8 damage per plus (+1d10 per plus against a bloodied enemy), and the target’s speed is reduced by 1 (save ends).

name: Blasting Circlet
description: The intricate silver circlet adorning your brow hums with mystical power.

name: Blastpatch
description: These granular crystals explode when they are stepped upon.

name: Blastwarp Staff
description: The crownpiece of silver and gold that tops this staff extends arcane power around its wielder.

name: Blazing Arc Ki Focus
description: When you grasp this white rock and focus on its power by enduring the charring heat within it, you mold your ki into a thing of fire.

name: Blessed Book
description: This leather tome, bound in iron and silver, contains far more pages than naturally possible.

name: Blessing of Blazing Fangs
description: Pain sears your neck, but you do not scream. From this day forth, you proudly display the burn scars from the spirit's bite.

name: Blinding Bomb
description: When thrown, this fist-sized ceramic sphere explodes in a blinding flash.

name: Blink Ring
description: This adamantine ring moves from finger to finger, much in the same way that you can move from place to place while wearing it.

name: Blink Shirt
description: The smooth material of this comfortable shirt is stronger than it appears, and allows you to blink away from danger.
augment_1:: You regain the use of this power but cannot augment it again during this encounter.

info.Description: Hide armors also are formed from the skins of various desert creatures. Less dangerous beasts such as the tembo and the kank provide materials for lower-level masterwork armors. The most advanced armors come from the hides of the Athasian roc and the nightmare beast.

name: Blood Drinker
description: You know when to feed your weapon, because it growls when it's hungry.

name: Blood Fury Weapon
description: Often decorated with bloodstones, these blades or axes are favored by dragonborn barbarians.
critical:: +1d8 damage per plus, or +1d12 damage while you’re bloodied

name: Blood Harvest Blade
description: When you drop an enemy with this bloodstained blade, your spirit companion takes on a horrifying visage that shakes your foes.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, plus 1[W] extra damage

name: Blood Jewel
description: This blood red glowing crystal hovers about your head, bathing you in candle-bright red light.

name: Blood Obsidian Weapon
description: Powerful defiling magic denudes the land and sometimes rends it asunder. When the magma that boils up from these vents cools, it forms veins of obsidian infused with the essence of death.
weapon:: Axe, heavy blade, light blade or  spear

name: Blood of Tyche
description: This golden vial holds swirling liquid luck—and a deadly poison.

name: Bloodclaw Weapon
description: The hilt of this weapon digs into its wielder's hand, drawing blood while inflicting a more grievous wound upon an enemy.

name: Bloodcrystal Raven Skull
description: This perfectly crafted raven skull is roughly a foot long and made of red-tinted crystal. A pale light flickers within its depths, seeming to react to your presence.

name: Bloodcurse Rod
description: This rod empowers its wielder to use his pact boon more often.

name: Bloodcut Armor
description: This armor has a crimson tinge that flares blood red when its power is activated.

info.Description: While you’re using a light shield, you can use your shield hand to hold another item, to climb, and the like, but you can’t make attacks with that hand or with anything in it.

Hide armors also are formed from the skins of various desert creatures. Less dangerous beasts such as the tembo and the kank provide materials for lower-level masterwork armors. The most advanced armors come from the hides of the Athasian roc and the nightmare beast.

name: Bloodfire Armor
description: This armor sheathes its bloodied wearer in scouring flames.

name: Bloodgem Shard
description: This blood-red crystal absorbs the life force of your defeated foes, bolstering your defenses.

name: Bloodguard Shield
description: As your foe's weapon strikes deep, this bronze shield flares red and covers you in a protective aura.

name: Bloodhound Bracers
description: You can track a wounded foe and strike it down when it's most vulnerable.

name: Bloodhunter Totem
description: This totem is carved from a petrified heart, which beats when the totem is close to wounded prey.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d10 damage per plus against a bloodied target

name: Bloodiron Armor
description: Forged from hammered iron cooled in blood, this armor protects best those who shed the most blood.

name: Bloodiron Rod
description: Channel your fury at being wounded through this potent device.

name: Bloodiron Weapon
description: Forged from iron tainted with the ichor of devils, this weapon is cruel.

name: Bloodletting Weapon
description: The jagged blade of this oversized sword can inflict a truly horrible wound.

name: Bloodmaul Weapon
description: This maul's dark red stains never seem to wash off.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, or +1d10 damage per plus against bloodied enemies

info.Description: Crafting chainmail without metal is challenging. Still, Athasian armorers have managed. They adorn stiff leather jacks with small disks or squares of horn, bone, or wood. The kank and the cilops have hard body parts ideal for the creation of masterwork mail coats. The greatest suits of mail armor are worn by the elite guards of the sorcerer-kings.

name: Bloodroot Poison
description: This crimson liquid causes fever and disorientation.

name: Bloodshard Ring
description: The images of eladrin nobles flicker within this circular shard of mirrored glass, which injures you even as it extends your vitality.

name: Bloodshored Shield
description: This strong, steel shield protects the bloodied.

name: Bloodsoaked Bracers
description: Your spilled blood causes these studded leather bracers to tremble with power.

name: Bloodsoaked Shield
description: A sheen of wet blood coats this wooden shield, protecting you when you are seriously injured.

name: Bloodstinger Poison
description: This inky toxin inflicts wounds that burn long after the initial blow is struck.

name: Bloodstone SpiderBloodstone Spider
description: : When you activate a figurine, the conjured creature appears in a space adjacent to you, provided the space is large enough to contain the creature without squeezing. The creature obeys only you, responding to commands spoken in any language. The creature remains for up to 8 hours or until you use a minor action to dismiss it. The conjured creature acts on the same initiative count as you. Every action it takes costs you a minor action (which you use to issue commands), and a conjured creature cannot exceed its normal allotment of actions (a standard, a move, and a minor action) during its turn. If you spend no minor actions on your turn to command the creature, it remains where it is without taking any actions on its turn.          A conjured creature has hit points, defenses, and attacks as indicated in its statistics block. It has no healing surges and cannot be healed, though it can still benefit from temporary hit points. When reduced to 0 hit points or fewer, the conjured creature disappears and cannot be conjured again until after you’ve taken an extended rest. Conjured creatures lack basic attacks and therefore cannot make opportunity attacks.          Mount: If the conjured creature has the mount keyword, you can ride the creature and are considered to have the Mounted Combat feat while mounted on it. While mounted, you can command the creature using free actions, though the mount is still limited to its normal allotment of actions. You can choose to be mounted on the creature when it appears.

name: Bloodtheft Armor
description: The surface of this armor looks as though it is constantly covered with blood that slowly cascades down its surface.

name: Bloodthirst Bracers
description: The crystals set in these golden bracers help you deal wounds that continue to impair your foe even after the initial strike.

name: Bloodthirsty Ki Focus
description: This stone in the shape of a five-pointed star has been sharpened down to a razor's edge at each point. Lines upon lines of shadow magic teachings have been painted upon the stone surface in a dark brown ink that looks like dried blood.

info.Description: Crafting chainmail without metal is challenging. Still, Athasian armorers have managed. They adorn stiff leather jacks with small disks or squares of horn, bone, or wood. The kank and the cilops have hard body parts ideal for the creation of masterwork mail coats. The greatest suits of mail armor are worn by the elite guards of the sorcerer-kings.

name: Bloodthread Armor
description: Eladrin master tailors magically weave threads of enchanted blood into the supple cloth used to create this robe or jacket.

name: Bloodvine Armor
description: Embedded beneath this armor's surface are rootlike tendrils. When you are hit, these tendrils expand and harden, providing superior protection.

name: Bloody Maul of Kord
description: This mighty warhammer metes out horrible pain to those it strikes.

name: Blurred Strike Ki Focus
description: You can master the secret of speed by catching this small mechanical fly in your hands.

name: Boar Tusk Helm
description: Your enemies are but standing obstacles through which you can rush.

name: Boar's Charge Totem
description: When you grasp this boar's tusk, your heart races with feral excitement and you throw yourself headlong into battle.

name: Boarding Boots
description: These hard boots of black leather keep you moving in combat, to deadly effect.

name: Bold Victory Armor
description: The magic that flows through this impressive armor bolsters you or your friend as you turn a battle toward victory.

name: Bolstering Shield
description: This ornate shield captures ambient psionic energy, using it to strengthen you in the midst of combat.
augment_1:: You gain double the number of temporary hit points.

name: Bolstering Weapon
description: This weapon shines brightly to inspire hope in nearby allies.
critical:: +1d8 psychic and radiant damage per plus
augment_1:: (Healing): The size of the burst increases to 2. Any bloodied ally in the burst can also spend a healing surge.

name: Bolt of Clumsiness
description: A victim of this malformed quarrel is too ungainly to avoid inviting attacks.

name: Bolt of Transit
description: Use this lightning-shaped bolt to move closer to your target.

name: Boltshard Crossbow
description: You pull the trigger, spraying shards at your foes.

name: Bone Ring of Better Fortune
description: Formed from coated bones cleverly entwined, this tiny circlet fortifies your life force.

name: Bone Ring of Preservation
description: This plain, bone ring protects its wearer from life-draining effects.

name: Bonegrim Armor
description: Forelimb bones adorn your arms and legs, rib cages are stretched across your chest, and a skull sits atop your head like a helmet.

name: Bones of the Traveler
description: An eight-pointed configuration of four crossed and rune-inscribed bones sows chaos and confusion, if your fickle deity desires.
requirement:: You must worship the traveler or the dark six to use this holy symbol.

name: Book of Five Truths (The Fifth Truth)
description: Scribes recorded five truths on scrolls at the start of the Dawn War and then scattered the scrolls throughout the planes of existence. Each scroll grants its reader essential insight into the nature of being.

info.Description: Crafting chainmail without metal is challenging. Still, Athasian armorers have managed. They adorn stiff leather jacks with small disks or squares of horn, bone, or wood. The kank and the cilops have hard body parts ideal for the creation of masterwork mail coats. The greatest suits of mail armor are worn by the elite guards of the sorcerer-kings.

name: Book of Five Truths (The First Truth)
description: Scribes recorded five truths on scrolls at the start of the Dawn War and then scattered the scrolls throughout the planes of existence. Each scroll grants its reader essential insight into the nature of being.

name: Book of Five Truths (The Fourth Truth)
description: Scribes recorded five truths on scrolls at the start of the Dawn War and then scattered the scrolls throughout the planes of existence. Each scroll grants its reader essential insight into the nature of being.

name: Book of Five Truths (The Second Truth)
description: Scribes recorded five truths on scrolls at the start of the Dawn War and then scattered the scrolls throughout the planes of existence. Each scroll grants its reader essential insight into the nature of being.

name: Book of Five Truths (The Third Truth)
description: Scribes recorded five truths on scrolls at the start of the Dawn War and then scattered the scrolls throughout the planes of existence. Each scroll grants its reader essential insight into the nature of being.

name: Book of Undeniable Fire
description: The pages of this tome have scorch marks along the edges.

name: Boots of Adept Charging
description: Rushing in is less dangerous in these studded leather boots.

name: Boots of Balance
description: These enchanted boots greatly increase your acrobatic skills.

name: Boots of Blood
description: These red leather boots come alive when your blood is spilled.

name: Boots of Bounding
description: These lightweight canvas boots are perfect for athletes, greatly increasing the length of leaps.

name: Boots of Caiphon
description: A mote of purple light orbits these black leather boots, burning you even as it lets you move freely across the battlefield.

info.Description: Crafting chainmail without metal is challenging. Still, Athasian armorers have managed. They adorn stiff leather jacks with small disks or squares of horn, bone, or wood. The kank and the cilops have hard body parts ideal for the creation of masterwork mail coats. The greatest suits of mail armor are worn by the elite guards of the sorcerer-kings.

name: Boots of Dancing
description: These ornate boots send you spinning and leaping out of danger.

name: Boots of Eagerness
description: Your feet feel peppy in these handsome brocade boots.

name: Boots of Equilibrium
description: The tough mesh sole of these supple buckskin boots grips even the most slippery surfaces.

name: Boots of Free Movement
description: You deftly avoid entanglement in these well-crafted boots.

name: Boots of Furious Speed
description: When you are injured, these boots turn crimson and vibrate slightly.

name: Boots of Grounding
description: These boots are unnaturally heavy, but they keep you grounded against magical movement.

name: Boots of Many Tracks
description: These rugged boots conceal your steps.

name: Boots of Quickness
description: This supple leather footwear keeps you out of harm's way.

name: Boots of Rapid Motion
description: With these polished leather boots, you are hard to slow down.

info.Description: Crafting chainmail without metal is challenging. Still, Athasian armorers have managed. They adorn stiff leather jacks with small disks or squares of horn, bone, or wood. The kank and the cilops have hard body parts ideal for the creation of masterwork mail coats. The greatest suits of mail armor are worn by the elite guards of the sorcerer-kings.

name: Boots of Resolute Reflexes
description: These thin leather boots respond to your thoughts, heightening your ability to avoid attack.

name: Boots of Sand and Sea
description: These wax-coated coverings help you glide over the earth when you are lightly encumbered, and might save you when the current runs deep.

name: Boots of Speed
description: These durable boots are designed to take you farther, faster.

name: Boots of Spider Climbing
description: These enchanted boots enhance your ability to climb.

name: Boots of Stealth
description: The soft leather soles and down lining of these supple boots quiet your footsteps.

name: Boots of Striding
description: These enchanted boots increase your speed if you wear light armor or no armor.

name: Boots of Striding and Springing
description: These enchanted boots increase your speed if you wear light armor or no armor and enhance your jumping capability.

name: Boots of Surging Speed
description: These springy boots let you get out of harm's way when you          need to catch your breath.

name: Boots of Swimming
description: A fin runs down the back of these fishscale boots.

name: Boots of Teleportation
description: Wearing these elegant boots, you never need to raise your feet to move.

info.Description: Crafting chainmail without metal is challenging. Still, Athasian armorers have managed. They adorn stiff leather jacks with small disks or squares of horn, bone, or wood. The kank and the cilops have hard body parts ideal for the creation of masterwork mail coats. The greatest suits of mail armor are worn by the elite guards of the sorcerer-kings.

name: Boots of Unchecked Passage
description: Your foes will make way for you while you're wearing these steel boots.

name: Boots of Withdrawal
description: This footwear allows you to live to fight another day.

name: Boots of the Dryad
description: Natural growth moves aside as you travel the wilderness, and you can disappear and step out from a nearby tree.

name: Boots of the Fencing Master
description: Your swift step befuddles your foes.

name: Boots of the Giantkind
description: These boots are made of overlapping flaps of behemoth skin and are extremely heavy.

name: Boots of the Infinite Stride
description: These enchanted boots allow you to teleport once per day.

name: Boots of the Mighty Charge
description: Your footsteps thunder as you charge in these boots, making bounds of steps and allowing you to deliver a mighty blow.

name: Bottled Smoke
description: This brass bottle is hot to the touch, and spews forth a cloud of ash and smoke when opened.

name: Bow of True Arrows
description: Enemies shelter their companions at their own peril against archers wielding this compound bow.

name: Bowl of Purity
description: This plain earthenware bowl can purify food and drink.

info.Description: Heavier Athasian masterwork armor is made from horn, scales, and carapaces, such as those found on mekillots or shed by thri-kreen. Advanced masterwork scale armor is created from the tough, thick hides of terrifying rampagers and drakes. The greatest armor of this type is formed from scales shed by the Dragon as it rampages through a region.

name: Bracelet of the Radiant Storm
description: Seemingly composed of pure energy, this bracelet keeps you safe from energy attacks.

name: Bracelets of Subtle Defense
description: When imbued with psionic energy, these bracelets help you escape attention on and off the battlefield.
augment_1:: You have concealment from all enemies until you make an attack.

name: Bracers of Archery
description: These leather armbands enhance your potency with bows and crossbows.

name: Bracers of Bold Maneuvering
description: These slick cuffs help maintain your defensive guard as you move around wary foes.

name: Bracers of Brachiation
description: You seamlessly negotiate through the forest canopy of a wilderness as if on foot.

name: Bracers of Defense
description: These enchanted armbands can be activated to reduce the damage you take from a single attack.

name: Bracers of Enforced Regret
description: When an enemy presses you, the power of these simple steel bracers lets you turn the tables.

name: Bracers of Escape
description: These bracers can whisk you out of harm's way.

name: Bracers of Infinite Blades
description: With a flick of your wrist, a gleaming blade appears in your previously empty hand.
special:: These bracers can be crafted to produce a different light thrown weapon, such as a shuriken.

info.Description: Heavier Athasian masterwork armor is made from horn, scales, and carapaces, such as those found on mekillots or shed by thri-kreen. Advanced masterwork scale armor is created from the tough, thick hides of terrifying rampagers and drakes. The greatest armor of this type is formed from scales shed by the Dragon as it rampages through a region.

name: Bracers of Iron Arcana
description: Favored by spellcasters, these iron bracers are covered in esoteric runes that help deflect physical attacks.

name: Bracers of Mental Might
description: The adage, “mind over matter,” truly applies when you wear these bracers.

name: Bracers of Mighty Striking
description: These enchanted armbands increase the damage you deal with a single melee attack.

name: Bracers of Rejuvenation
description: These wrist guards pulse with red light when you pause to catch your breath, increasing your defenses until you rejoin the battle.

name: Bracers of Respite
description: Commonly worn by combat medics, these white linen arm guards spread healing benefits.

name: Bracers of Speed
description: These wide bracers are lined with gleaming mithral rings.

name: Bracers of Tactical Blows
description: When your foes let down their guard, these dragonscale bracers make them regret it.

name: Bracers of Wound Closure
description: These copper bracers create a luminescent field that eliminates impairing wounds.

name: Bracers of Zeal
description: These golden bracers let you channel your own resiliency into a punishing attack.

name: Bracers of the Perfect Shot
description: These enchanted armbands increase the damage you deal with a single ranged attack.

info.Description: While you’re using a heavy shield, you can’t use your shield hand for any other task, since you must use that hand to handle the shield.

Heavier Athasian masterwork armor is made from horn, scales, and carapaces, such as those found on mekillots or shed by thri-kreen. Advanced masterwork scale armor is created from the tough, thick hides of terrifying rampagers and drakes. The greatest armor of this type is formed from scales shed by the Dragon as it rampages through a region.

name: Bradaman's Weapon
description: This elegantly crafted weapon draws on your own reserves of valor to take the fight to your foes.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, and you can spend a healing surge.

name: Bralani Cloak
description: This cloak lets you slip through the Feywild and call upon its winds to move you off the ground.

name: Branchrunners
description: You move unhindered through the undergrowth in these supple foot wraps of treated oak leaves.

name: Bravery Powder
description: This powder, made from the antennae of a rust monster terror, helps fortify the spirit against fear effects.

name: Breach Bracers
description: These spiked arm guards render enemies more vulnerable to your attacks.

name: Breaching Armor
description: Walls are no obstacle for you while wearing this armor.

name: Breaching Gauntlets
description: These thick leather gauntlets allow your attacks to bypass even the best resistances.

name: Breakchain Tattoo
description: One broken link is enough for the symbolism, but many use a full chain.

name: Briartwine Armor
description: The eladrin are said to be the architects of this armor, creating a form of protection that remains concealed until worn.

name: Bridle of Conjuration
description: This simple leather bridle conjures a magical mount for your use.

info.Description: Heavier Athasian masterwork armor is made from horn, scales, and carapaces, such as those found on mekillots or shed by thri-kreen. Advanced masterwork scale armor is created from the tough, thick hides of terrifying rampagers and drakes. The greatest armor of this type is formed from scales shed by the Dragon as it rampages through a region.

name: Bridle of Flame
description: This black leather bridle decorated with a flame motif grants healing power and can transform your mount into a fiery steed.

name: Bridle of Rapid Action
description: This fine leather bridle lets you and your mount react more quickly to danger.

name: Bright Jewel of il-Yannah
description: When you focus your mind, this jewel on the silver chain blooms with violet light. Your foes know the purity of il-Yannah.
critical:: +1d6 psychic and radiant damage per plus
requirement:: You must worship the path of light to use this holy symbol.

name: Brightleaf
description: These leaves, which sprout from old growth forests, never fall even in the deep winter. When used, they explode with stored light and energy.

name: Brilliant Energy Weapon
description: Infused with light, this weapon passes through armor and into flesh.

name: Brilliant Scrying Basin
description: The brilliantly clear water of this large bronze basin greatly aids scrying rituals.

name: Brimstone Cloak
description: This cloak smells faintly of sulfur and helps resist both fire and poison.

name: Bronze GriffonBronze Griffon
description: : The fearsome griffon statuette rears back on its hind legs so that it can claw the air, and its beak is open as if screaming. When dormant, the statuette tends to snag clothing and pierce skin with casual handling, and after a few scars and ruined cloaks, possessors learn to handle these items with care.               The alchemist Boreanis crafted nine bronze griffons for nine eladrin lords as gifts for the esteemed heroes of the war between Corellon and Lolth. When the lords passed from life to death and from history to legend, the figurines scattered across the planes to owners less worthy than those to first use them. Many eladrin nobles have more than a passing interest in these items and would pay a fine reward for their recovery.
blood_frenzy: (while it or its rider is bloodied)

name: Bronze Serpent
description: This small bronze snake slowly orbits your head, fortifying you.

name: Bronzewood Coils Totem
description: With this knotted serpent totem crafted of bronzewood, you can grant your spirit companion an aspect of the World Serpent.

info.Description: Heavier Athasian masterwork armor is made from horn, scales, and carapaces, such as those found on mekillots or shed by thri-kreen. Advanced masterwork scale armor is created from the tough, thick hides of terrifying rampagers and drakes. The greatest armor of this type is formed from scales shed by the Dragon as it rampages through a region.

name: Bronzewood Weapon
description: Creatures of the Shadowfell react poorly to this hard, red-brown wood.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, +1d10 damage per plus against shadow creatures.

name: Brooch of No Regrets
description: This ornate golden shield pin bolsters your allies even in dire circumstances.

name: Brooch of Shielding
description: This ornate silver shield pin absorbs force attacks against you.

name: Brooch of Vitality
description: This warm, redwood, heart-shaped brooch beats softly and represents the durability of life.

name: Burglar's Gloves
description: These fingerless black gloves are embroidered with dark red sigils and improve your thievery skills.

name: Burning Gauntlets
description: Made of iron and constantly trailing wisps of smoke, these plated gloves incite your inner pyromaniac.

name: Burrow-Ward Blade
description: This enchanted ornamental blade alerts you when creatures try to enter your hoard from beneath the ground.

name: Butterfly Sandals
description: These comfortable leather sandals make you more adept while airborne.

name: Byeshk Weapon
description: The violet-hued metal that makes up this weapon is anathema to creatures alien to the natural cosmos.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, +1d10 damage per plus against aberrant creatures

name: Canaith Mandolin
description: The life-giving music of this lutelike instrument revitalizes a listener.

info.Description: Heavier Athasian masterwork armor is made from horn, scales, and carapaces, such as those found on mekillots or shed by thri-kreen. Advanced masterwork scale armor is created from the tough, thick hides of terrifying rampagers and drakes. The greatest armor of this type is formed from scales shed by the Dragon as it rampages through a region.

name: Cannith Goggles
description: These goggles enhance your vision and can be empowered by magic to improve your vision even more.

name: Cap of Water Breathing
description: You are at home in the water while wearing this wax-coated cap.

name: Cape of the Mountebank
description: With a flourish of this silk-hemmed garment, you transport out of harm's way.

name: Carcanet of Psychic Schism
description: This ornate headband protects your mind by splitting it in two, but there's a price to pay.

name: Carnage Weapon
description: No amount of time spent cleaning and maintaining this weapon removes the old, ingrained bloodstains. They are evidence of its power and purpose.

name: Carrion Crawler Brain Juice
description: Purple, oily carrion crawler brain juice can cause sluggishness and paralysis.

name: Cascading Strikes Ki Focus
description: Your wide strike triggers your stout stone idol to release its power, helping you land a blow that would otherwise go astray.

name: Cask of Liquid Gold
description: This cask contains a never-ending supply of dwarven ale.

name: Casque of Tactics
description: Favored by sergeants and commanders, this utilitarian helm is remarkable only for its satin inner padding.

name: Cat Paws
description: Furry on the outside, silky on the inside, these gloves sprout claws that make climbing easier.

info.Description: Heavier Athasian masterwork armor is made from horn, scales, and carapaces, such as those found on mekillots or shed by thri-kreen. Advanced masterwork scale armor is created from the tough, thick hides of terrifying rampagers and drakes. The greatest armor of this type is formed from scales shed by the Dragon as it rampages through a region.

name: Cat Tabi
description: This silky black footgear gives you catlike reflexes when jumping or falling.

name: Cat's-Eye Headband
description: Two fragments of green jade set in this black leather headband open up the shadows to your sight.

name: Catstep Boots
description: These enchanted boots reduce falling damage and enhance your acrobatics and athletics skills.

name: Caustic Gauntlets
description: These rough leather coverings drip with acid as you attack.

name: Caustic Whetstone
description: This metallic green sharpener drips acid when touched to a weapon.

name: Cavern Explorer's Weapon
description: The haft of this weapon is scored with notches that count Maldoor's paces and record which way he turned in the Caverns of the Garden.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, and you push the target 1 square and shift 1 square into a square the target vacated.

name: Centering Cincture
description: With this simple sash, you fend off attacks against your body.

name: Certainty of Death Ki Focus
description: You gaze at the statuette with a hole where its heart should be and look into yourself, focusing your ki on the void of life within it.

name: Chainreach Weapon
description: This melee weapon sports several smaller chains on its hilt and blade.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus or +1d8 damage per plus if you have combat advantage.

name: Challenge-Seeking Weapon
description: This weapon is always eager to be introduced to a fresh enemy.

info.Description: Plate armor is made from giant insect or crustacean chitin, or from the shells of creatures such as chathrangs or rare desert tortoises. Braxats and gaj provide the durable shells used to make mid-level masterwork plate armor. The rarest plate armor is derived from drakes and braxat lords. Armorers drill tiny ventilation holes in chitin-plate armor to make it bearable in all but the hottest weather.

name: Chamber Cloak
description: This voluminous garment envelops you when you're hurt, giving you a safe place to recover.

name: Chameleon Ring
description: This lizard skin band is barely visible against your skin and makes you equally hard to discern.

name: Champion's Armor
description: Imbued with the spirit of a great hero of a previous age, this armor strives to ensure your own efforts are no less legendary.

name: Champion's Hauberk
description: Fitted to be worn under a priest's robe, this shirt of black mail lets you focus the power of your faith.

name: Champion's Ring
description: A ring of purest silver that glows with arcane light.

name: Champion's Symbol
description: Inscribed with stylized flames, this holy symbol grants you control over the will of your foes.
critical:: The target makes a melee basic attack as a free action against an enemy of your choice. If no enemy is within range for the target to attack, the target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

name: Chandelier of Revelation
description: This chandelier reveals that which is hidden in the room.

name: Chaos Burst Tattoo
description: This tattoo of spirit changes its appearance in a chaotic welter. On good days, it matches your complexion. On bad days it doesn't match anything, anywhere.

name: Chaos Cloak
description: This cloak is brightly colored and covered in nodules, like the skin of a slaad, and its effects are just as chaotic.

name: Chaos Shard Implement
description: This glowing lump of blue crystal can be fitted to a rod, staff, or wand, allowing its user to channel the power for the Far Realm to smite enemies.

info.Description: Plate armor is made from giant insect or crustacean chitin, or from the shells of creatures such as chathrangs or rare desert tortoises. Braxats and gaj provide the durable shells used to make mid-level masterwork plate armor. The rarest plate armor is derived from drakes and braxat lords. Armorers drill tiny ventilation holes in chitin-plate armor to make it bearable in all but the hottest weather.

name: Chaos Weave Armor
description: Woven from pure chaos, this armor features abstract patterns that seem to slowly swirl or spin.

name: Chaos Weave Weapon
description: Forged from the quintessence of the Elemental Chaos, this weapon pierces demons' defenses.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, +1d12 damage per plus against a creature that has variable resistance.

name: Charger's Headdress
description: Fashioned from a mountain ram's horns, this headdress lets you charge unhindered through the spirit world.

name: Charm Bracelet
description: This simple bracelet with tiny arcane symbols dangling from it lets you share in your foes' good luck.

name: Charm of Abundant Action
description: This plain metal charm allows you to outrun or outfight your foes.

name: Charm of Protection
description: Your familiar is protected by the charm almost as if it has a destiny of its own.

name: Cherished Ring
description: You and your words are more alluring when you wear this simple loop of burnished gold.

name: Chieftain's Weapon
description: This long spear's haft is covered with runes, each linked together to form a chain that runs in a spiral along its length.

name: Chill Wind Weapon
description: The weapon seems to radiate an aura of cold, glistening like a razor-sharp icicle.
critical:: +1d6 cold damage per plus and ongoing 20 cold damage (save ends)

name: Chime of Awakening
description: This silver chime sounds an alarm in the minds of you and your resting allies.

info.Description: Plate armor is made from giant insect or crustacean chitin, or from the shells of creatures such as chathrangs or rare desert tortoises. Braxats and gaj provide the durable shells used to make mid-level masterwork plate armor. The rarest plate armor is derived from drakes and braxat lords. Armorers drill tiny ventilation holes in chitin-plate armor to make it bearable in all but the hottest weather.

name: Chime of Opening
description: When struck, this chime rings out with a magical tone that opens locks.

name: Chime of Warding
description: The air around you shimmers with protective force when you strike this golden chime.

name: Chimera Headdress
description: Three miniature heads of a chimera stare out from this headgear, granting you the multifaceted abilities of that beast.

name: Choker of Eloquence
description: This damask neck wrap quickens the tongue and finds favor with diplomats and aristocrats.

name: Cincture of Vivacity
description: Where it covers you, this wrap holds you in a firm grip that strengthens your physical resilience.

name: Cincture of the Dragon Spirit
description: This scaly belt infuses you with the ferocity of a dragon.

name: Cincture of the Githzerai
description: This rope cord is woven to enhance the ability of the mind to lend strength to the body.

name: Cingulum of Combat Rushing
description: This heavily decorated belt pushes you straight through your foes.

name: Circlet of Arcane Extension
description: This golden circlet extends the range of your arcane power to strike at distant foes.

name: Circlet of Arkhosia
description: This twining silver band has two silver dragon heads with ruby eyes facing each other over your forehead, protecting your mind from being overwhelmed in battle.

info.Description: Plate armor is made from giant insect or crustacean chitin, or from the shells of creatures such as chathrangs or rare desert tortoises. Braxats and gaj provide the durable shells used to make mid-level masterwork plate armor. The rarest plate armor is derived from drakes and braxat lords. Armorers drill tiny ventilation holes in chitin-plate armor to make it bearable in all but the hottest weather.

name: Circlet of Authority
description: This simple metal headband improves your diplomatic and intimidation skills.

name: Circlet of Clear Thought
description: With this item, you can see through falsehoods and tricks with astonishing ease.

name: Circlet of Continuity
description: This platinum band sparkles with embedded golden topazes, guarding against mental disruption.

name: Circlet of Indomitability
description: This simple golden circlet fortifies your mind.

name: Circlet of Mental Onslaught
description: Your mental attacks strike more true while you wear this slender circlet.

name: Circlet of Portals
description: This brilliant band of celestial steel allows you to better perceive the unseen paths through the planes.

name: Circlet of Rapid Casting
description: This rune-etched silver headband speeds arcane formulas through your mind.

name: Circlet of Revelations
description: This slender mithral circlet grants you the unique abilities of your sibling-race allies.

name: Circlet of Second Chances
description: Luck favors those who don this plain copper accessory.

name: Circlet of the Resolute Mind
description: As it responds to your psionic power, this fine silver circlet strengthens your mind against mental attacks.

info.Description: Plate armor is made from giant insect or crustacean chitin, or from the shells of creatures such as chathrangs or rare desert tortoises.
