Braxats and gaj provide the durable shells used to make mid-level masterwork plate armor. The rarest plate armor is derived from drakes and braxat lords. Armorers drill tiny ventilation holes in chitin-plate armor to make it bearable in all but the hottest weather.

name: Circlet of the Urbane
description: Created from pure astral light made solid by the arcane artisans of House Norsair, this circlet grants the urbane wisdom and resolve of the Bright City's exalted of Erathis.

name: Clarity Salts
description: The odor from these tiny crystals is almost strong enough to wake the dead.

name: Clasp of Noble Sacrifice
description: This gold cloak buckle protects your friends with your life force.

name: Claw Gloves
description: These gloves incorporate the claws of a panther, granting you additional power in your beast form.

name: Clear-Blood Baldric
description: The protective power of this belt guarantees that foes who hide behind the cowardice of poison will regret it.

name: Clear-Path Mist
description: The mist clears out the underbrush, making your path easier to travel.

name: Clearing Cleats
description: These knobby-soled boots temporarily warp the terrain around you, clearing an easy path.

name: Clearsense Powder
description: This fine, silvery powder can restore lost senses.

info.Description: Feyweave armor is woven with techniques perfected by the eladrin.

Plate armor is made from giant insect or crustacean chitin, or from the shells of creatures such as chathrangs or rare desert tortoises. Braxats and gaj provide the durable shells used to make mid-level masterwork plate armor. The rarest plate armor is derived from drakes and braxat lords. Armorers drill tiny ventilation holes in chitin-plate armor to make it bearable in all but the hottest weather.

name: Cli Lyre
description: The graceful, rounded body of this magic lyre produces resonant tones that imbue listeners with increased presence.

name: Climb the Giant
description: Drizzt can climb right up one side of huge foes and tumble down the other to land like a cat.

name: Climber's Bracers
description: Your hands are as effective as an animal's claws at climbing while wearing these rough leather bracers.

name: Climbing Claws
description: Sharp claws magically unfold from the palms of these padded leather gloves.

name: Cloak of Arachnida
description: This soft cloak is traced in spiderweb patterns.

name: Cloak of Autumn's Child
description: Woven from exotic Feywild leaves, this cloak whisks you to a soothing pocket of peace where afflictions are less severe.

name: Cloak of Burgeoning Shadow
description: This dark cloak helps obscure your allies when you stay close.

name: Cloak of Displacement
description: When you wrap this shimmering cloak around yourself, your enemies’ attacks strike empty air.

name: Cloak of Distortion
description: This cloak roils about you like the rippling air of a scorching desert.

name: Cloak of Elemental Evolution
description: Stitched with the material forms of the elements, this cloak adopts the form of the element it is set to resist.

info.Description: Plate armor is made from giant insect or crustacean chitin, or from the shells of creatures such as chathrangs or rare desert tortoises. Braxats and gaj provide the durable shells used to make mid-level masterwork plate armor. The rarest plate armor is derived from drakes and braxat lords. Armorers drill tiny ventilation holes in chitin-plate armor to make it bearable in all but the hottest weather.

name: Cloak of Invisibility
description: This gold-hemmed cloak increases your defenses and can be activated to turn you invisible for a short time.

name: Cloak of Resistance
description: This crimson-hemmed cloak can be activated to provide minor resistance to all attacks.

name: Cloak of Translocation
description: This silver-white cloak glimmers and shimmers when you teleport, hampering your enemy's ability to locate you.

name: Cloak of the Bat
description: Donning this dark brown cloak lets you perceive the world from a different perspective.

name: Cloak of the Cautious
description: Dragonborn refer to this slick garment as the “cloak of the craven” because it facilitates hasty retreats.

name: Cloak of the Chirurgeon
description: This garment gives you the confidence and knowledge to assuage an ally's pain.

name: Cloak of the Crimson Path
description: When you're injured, this blood-crusted cloak allows you and your allies to take advantage of an enemy's error.

name: Cloak of the Desert
description: This tan cloak blends in perfectly with the desert sand.

info.Description: Plate armor is made from giant insect or crustacean chitin, or from the shells of creatures such as chathrangs or rare desert tortoises. Braxats and gaj provide the durable shells used to make mid-level masterwork plate armor. The rarest plate armor is derived from drakes and braxat lords. Armorers drill tiny ventilation holes in chitin-plate armor to make it bearable in all but the hottest weather.

name: Cloak of the Lion's Mane
description: This lionskin cloak bestows the majesty of that desert predator upon you to strike fear into the hearts of your foes.

name: Cloak of the Phoenix
description: As your enemy’s deadly attack hits home, this cloak flares with a blast of scouring fire that seems to devour you . . . until you return, ready for battle again.

name: Cloak of the Shadowthief
description: A veil of shadows erupts from this cloak, delaying your enemies’ reactions as they try to pinpoint your location.

name: Cloak of the Walking Wounded
description: Thin red veins form across the fabric of this handsome cloak when its healing properties are evoked.

name: Cloaked Weapon
description: This naturally invisible weapon becomes visible when it hits.

name: Clockwork Bomb
description: You set the device on the ground and hope that it detonates when you want it to.

name: Clockwork Cowl
description: This brass and electrum helm makes a soft ticking noise that can only be heard by its wearer.

name: Closed Mind
description: By erecting mental bulwarks, you ward yourself against hostile psychic attacks.

name: Cobra Strike Ki Focus
description: This clay serpent drips with a strange venom. By pressing your finger into its fangs, you unlock the serpent's mysteries.

name: Cog of Erathis
description: This holy symbol allows you to momentarily harness the will of Erathis to propel an ally to act with alacrity.
requirement:: To use this symbol, you must worship Erathis.

info.Description: Studded leather is leather armor reinforced with metal studs. It provides a middle ground between hide armor and ring mail. It is more flexible than either, while its reinforced construction gives it a slight edge over hide.        Magic appears at higher item levels, and grants higher armor bonuses than its mundane counterparts. Studded leather grants +4 AC at levels 16-25, and +5 AC at levels 26-30.

name: Cognizance Crystal
description: This multicolored crystal captures unspent psionic power. It crumbles to dust after releasing that energy.

name: Cognizance Ring
description: Inlaid with tourmaline gems, this electrum trinket strengthens your mind and spirit.

name: Coif of Focus
description: This plain mail hood hangs close to your eyes and ears, protecting them from assault.

name: Coif of Mindiron
description: Your head and mind is guarded by this glistening mail hood.

name: Cold Iron Bracers
description: The creatures of the Feywild recoil at the touch of these iron bracers.

name: Cold Iron Shield
description: Using this heavy iron shield, you can protect an ally's mind as well as his body.

name: Cold Iron Weapon
description: Denizens of the Feywild loathe this weapon forged from the coldest, darkest iron.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus, +1d10 damage per plus against fey creatures.

name: Collar of Recovery
description: Inset with a bloodstone, this neckpiece aids healing.

name: Command Circlet
description: Granted to the best warforged commanders during the Last War, the command circlet is a mark of distinction and honor.
requirement:: You must have the living construct racial trait to use this item.

name: Communal Weapon
description: Combat can bring some people together, and you can lend aid to your allies with this weapon.

info.Description: This flexible but sturdy armor consists of a typical suit of leather armor with a series of metal rings sewn onto its surface. The rings enhance the armor’s sturdiness, improving its protective qualities while still offering the maneuverability of lightweight armor.        Magic appears at higher item levels, and grants higher armor bonuses than its mundane counterparts. Ring mail grants +4 AC at levels 16-25, and +5 AC at levels 26-30.

name: Companion's Defender
description: This belt is constructed from woven bones and enhances a companion's defensive ability while adjacent to you.

name: Confounding Tome
description: The cloth cover of this tome is inscribed with a repeating mazelike pattern.

name: Contortionist's Cord
description: This extremely flexible snakeskin binding allows you to quickly squeeze through even the tightest spots.

name: Controller's Holy Symbol
description: An implement of purest silver that glows with arcane light.

name: Controller's Orb
description: An implement of purest silver that glows with arcane light.

name: Controller's Rod
description: An implement of purest silver that glows with arcane light.

name: Controller's Staff
description: An implement of purest silver that glows with arcane light.

name: Controller's Tome
description: An implement of purest silver that glows with arcane light.

name: Controller's Totem
description: An implement of purest silver that glows with arcane light.

info.Description: Banded mail consists of a suit of chainmail reinforced with layers of metal plates arranged in strips along the suit’s midsection. Banded mail offers the same level of protection as chainmail while proving lighter and more flexible. A warrior in banded mail moves as quickly as one in leather armor.        Magic appears at higher item levels, and grants higher armor bonuses than its mundane counterparts. Banded mail grants +8 AC at levels 11-15, +9 AC at levels 16-20, +10 AC at levels 21-25, and +12 AC at levels 26-30.

name: Controller's Wand
description: An implement of purest silver that glows with arcane light.

name: Controlling Weapon
description: Waves of force radiate from this polearm when it hits its target, forcing the creature to move.

name: Convert's Symbol
description: This symbol is a carving of a hand grasping an arcane implement. It allows you to convert some of your arcane power into healing.

name: Coral Armor
description: This heavy armor was first crafted by elves who sought to create amphibious patrols to safeguard the rivers and lakes bordering their land.

name: Coral DragonCoral Dragon
description: : Some believe the fragile coral dragons were the first figurines created and that they house the spirits of those noble dragons who aided Bahamut and Tiamat in overcoming the King of Terror. Others claim the coral dragons are not figurines at all, but are instead memories of forgotten dragon gods from another world. Regardless of their origins, seers and diviners prize these relics for the wisdom they contain, while cruder champions see great power in the violence of which the figurines are capable.               Coral dragons are unusual in that they possess cunning and wisdom that persists when inert. The dragon’s personality varies from figurine to figurine, but many possess great arrogance and expect their possessors to show them respect. A few champion specific causes, urging their possessors to advance good (or evil) in the world.

name: Cord of Divine Favor
description: A healer's garment, this cinch lets you tend to yourself as you aid others.

name: Cord of Elusive Thoughts
description: This thin cord of eel's skin lets you focus the power of your mind to escape from physical restraints.

name: Cord of Foresight
description: With the insight provided by this woven silk belt, you brace your body for physical danger.

name: Corellon's Boon of Arcane Might
description: Corellon brought arcane magic to the world. Mortals who please him gain access to powers that otherwise take years of study to master.

name: Corrosive Oil
description: Nonmetallic armor coated with this oil has the ability to lessen the effectiveness of metallic weapons that strike it.

info.Description: First developed by the dwarves, splint mail consists of vertical strips of metal bound to a thick layer of leather and chainmail. Because it is so heavy and ponderous, few other than dwarves wear it in battle. While it lacks the protective elements of plate, it is scale armor’s equal. More important, its rigid construction allows it to absorb some portion of an enemy’s blows.        Magic appears at higher item levels, and grants higher armor bonuses than its mundane counterparts. Splint mail grants +8 AC at levels 6-10, +9 AC at levels 11-15, +10 AC at levels 16-20, +11 AC at levels 21-25, and +13 AC at levels 26-30.

name: Coruscating Armor
description: This glittering steel armor masks your exact location from enemies that would impede you.

name: Cosmic Cycle Tattoo
description: The sun, moon, and stars wind around your chest in this tattoo of heart, flaring into motion when you use the tattoo's power.

name: Counterstrike Armor
description: The warding on this armor punishes the first enemy to strike you in battle.

name: Counterstrike Guards
description: A set of twin forearm shields small enough not to hinder you, these guards improve your strikes against off-balance foes.

name: Courtier's Cape
description: You have uncommon confidence while this short silk cape hangs from your shoulders.

name: Couters of Second Chances
description: As you swing past your opponent, these armored elbow guards sparkle with energy, bringing your weapon back in line.

name: Coverbreaker Weapon
description: Few can hide from the unerring accuracy of this ranged weapon.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus or +1d8 damage per plus if the target has cover relative to the wielder.

name: Crashing Tide Ki Focus
description: You focus the ocean's wrath to strike your enemies with tidal force.

name: Crashing Weapon
description: This weapon has a heft to it that makes it seem bulky, yet it flies through the air with incredible speed.
critical:: +1d6 damage per plus and the target is knocked prone

name: Creeping Gatevine
description: This red-flowering vine grows on the stones of magical gates and menhirs.

info.Description: A dwarven innovation, spiked plate is a suit of plate mail studded with sharp, metal spikes. The dwarves developed this armor to deal with subterranean beasts such as hook horrors and umber hulks that grasp and crush their prey.        Magic appears at higher item levels, and grants higher armor bonuses than its mundane counterparts. Spiked plate grants +9 AC at levels 6-10, +10 AC at levels 11-15, +11 AC at levels 16-20, +12 AC at levels 21-25, and +14 AC at levels 26-30.

name: Crest of Vigilance Eternal
description: The undying courage of the deva race fuels the power of this item to keep you focused in combat.

name: Crimson Cloak
description: This rich cloak shimmers with a blood-red sheen, defending you against the most potent attacks of your foes.

name: Crimson Determination
description: Having completed the Red Pilgrimage, your hatred of the gnolls' desecration makes you imagine each enemy you face is a member of their foul kind—and you show them no quarter.

name: Crook of Remembrance
description: Burned into this wooden shepherd's crook is an endless litany recounting the crimes against mortals.

name: Crowd Killer Shield
description: Your foes might think they have the upper hand, but this shield ensures you fight on a level field.

name: Crown of Command
description: This ornate crown greatly enhances your diplomatic and intimidation skills.

name: Crown of Doors
description: Architecture holds no secrets from those wearing this wood and stone headpiece.

name: Crown of Equilibrium
description: As your foes shake off disabling effects, this thick copper headband grants your allies similar relief.

name: Crown of Eyes
description: This circlet incorporating eyelike designs watches every angle.

info.Description: Though the dwarves are loath to admit it, human smiths crafted the first suits of full plate for the use of mounted knights. Of course, the dwarves are quick to add, they did perfect those initial, flawed designs. Among all the kinds of heavy armor, full plate offers unmatched protection and flexibility.        Magic appears at higher item levels, and grants higher armor bonuses than its mundane counterparts. Full plate grants +9 AC at levels 6-10, +10 AC at levels 11-15, +11 AC at levels 16-20, +12 AC at levels 21-25, and +14 AC at levels 26-30.

name: Crown of Leaves
description: The fey energy imbued into this delicate crown unveils nature and its secrets to your sight and touch.

name: Crown of Nature's Rebellion
description: This birch skullcap wards against death.

name: Crown of Neverwinter
description: This bejeweled crown radiates warmth and majesty.

name: Crown of Stuttered Time
description: This copper crown is set with numerous tiger's-eye gems that slip out of phase with the world even as you do.

name: Crown of Victory
description: This majestic platinum crown is fit only for the greatest of heroes.

name: Crown of Whispers
description: This gold circlet rises to points above the temples and the center of the brow. Three star rubies decorate the front.

name: Crown of the Brilliant Sun
description: This crown flares with brilliant energy that you can unleash in place of a lightning attack.

name: Crown of the Dream King
description: This ornate golden ring looks like a tiny crown, complete with miniature jewels.

name: Crown of the Goliath Champion
description: This crown is made of bone with carved archaic markings.

name: Crown of the World Tree
description: The experience of a thousand ritualists is yours when you don this crown of ash.

info.Description: Although a shield is usually a defensive item, a barbed shield turns the tables on attackers because of the long spikes and blades attached to it. While too awkward to use as a weapon, a barbed shield provides added protection against enemies that attempt to grab you, because the spikes and barbs built into it cut into them.

name: Crownring of Tchazzar
description: A simple mithral circlet engraved with Iokharic runes reads: “Through worship ascended, by fire consumed, a god-king is reborn”.

name: Cryptspawn Potion
description: Drinking this viscous fluid that smells of decay provides protection against the powers of creatures that live beyond the grave.

name: Crystal Armor
description: Seemingly made of solid quartz, this armor bolsters your mental abilities when you're badly injured.

name: Crystal Ball of Spying
description: This clear crystal orb flickers with the hazy images of distant people and places.

name: Crystalline Breastplate
description: Thumb-sized crystals set into this armor absorb certain types of damage, but at the expense of increased vulnerability.
armor:: Leather, hide, chain, scale or  plate

name: Cubic Portal
description: This fist-sized cube is cut from solid carnelian, and each face contains a stylized glyph that corresponds to a specific planar location.

name: Cunning Weapon
description: Finely crafted and ornately etched, this weapon makes its target succumb more easily to adverse conditions.

name: Cup of Death Ki Focus
description: You lift the black cup to your lips and drink deep of the nothingness inside it. The emptiness that opens behind your eyes fills you with a sense of how much you can take from your foes.

name: Curse Eye Tattoo
description: This tattoo is a small eye, often in the center of the forehead, which blinks when used.
